loans.name: Evgenia

texts.en:
Evgenia is married and has two adult children. She owns a retail business that sells various kinds of cosmetics. Her business is located at a small store that she rents at the central market. 

Evgenia has been in this business for 12 years. She used to work as salesperson. When she lost her job, she decided to use her experience and start her own business. Today, Evgenia has a large business location with electricity inside that helps her to prevent her inventory from freezing. 

Evnegia has used Kiva loans before and found them very helpful for the business. This time, Evgenia would like to borrow 20,000 Ukrainian Hryvnia to go to the bulk market in another city and purchase inventory at a lower price.

loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, who is married with six children, all of whom attend school, sells soda and passion juice seven days a week in Kawempe market. She buys crates of soda from delivery vans and passion fruits from Bwaise farmers' market. As well, Margaret owns rental rooms. She wants to use this loan to buy more crates of soda, a bag of passion juice and 20 kilograms of sugar.

In this business for 20 years, Margaret's challenges include seasonality and thieves. She joined MCDT because of the low interest rate charged. She resides in and owns a three-roomed house, and the family has access to electricity but no piped water at home. Her monthly expenses include market dues, food and school fees. Margaret aspires to build more rental rooms and also to start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more crates of soda, a bag of passion fruits and 20 kilograms of sugar

loans.name: Monica Achieng

texts.en:
Monica Achieng Ang'ela is 61 years old and is a single mother of one son by the name of George Omondi who is 26 years old. They live in Oruba estate in Migori town.

Monica has a hotel and restaurant business she has operated for many years. She is applying for a 2nd loan of Kshs 20,000. She repaid her first loan without any problems. She will use her loan to replenish the ingredients she uses to cook for her clients, who are mainly people who live in her neighbourhood and work in the surrounding offices. She has been a client in Kadet Ltd for sometime now and her credit history is good. She mostly uses her profits to pay for her son's college fees and for the family upkeep.

She hopes to diversify into a cereals business to run co-currently with her hotel business.

loans.use: To replenish food items for cooking for clients

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty D. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Pahilanga, Bgry. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fish vending and augments her income by hiring out as a sugarcane field laborer. Her husband Alberto, who is 51 years old, helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 8 to 21 years old. 

Betty joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Betty has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000, which she intends to use to put up a small sari-sari or general store adjacent to her house and to purchase a motorized fishing boat so that she con continue to save up for the future wellbeing of her family. Betty D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  n Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Open a sari-sari store and buy a motorized fishing boat

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
Doña Cipriana tiene 61  años, es viuda y tiene 2  hijos. 
Se dedica a la elaboración y venta chipas, posee un local propio donde tiene instalada su chipería. 
Todos los empleados que maneja en su microempresa están integrados por parientes y vecinos de la zona. 
Las chipas que elaboran son de buena calidad por lo que tiene clientela formada quienes optan consumir sus productos por ser reconocidos.
 El crédito será destinado a la compra de queso y almidón que lo utiliza para la elaboración de la chipa. 
Esta actividad es la fuente con el cual crio e hizo estudiar a sus hijos, y con el cual mantiene  los gastos básicos de la familia.
texts.en:
Doña Cipriana is a 61 year old widow with two children. She prepares and sells “chipas” (cheese bread) and has her own location from which she operates her business. Workers who drive by her business are mostly relatives and neighbors in the area.

The bread she makes is of good quality. Her customers choose to consume her products because they are better known. Her loan will be used to buy cheese and starch for making more cheese bread. This business provided a source of income while her children were growing up and attending school. Now it helps maintain her basic household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cheese & starch

loans.name: Suad

texts.en:
Suad is a young wife. Her husband rented a small vegetable and fruit shop in the city of Gaza. Shadi, Suad's husband, was working in a different vegetable and fruit shop. He saved a good amount of money to start his own shop. He started with a small stool until he could rent his own store. Suad wanted to help, so she took a $500 loan that her husband will use to fix the store and prepare it for the goods he will sell. 

Shadi appears in the picture here in front of the store.

loans.use: To fix the store

loans.name: Dinara

texts.en:
Dinara T. lives in the Kyrgyz southern city Osh. She is 44, married, and has four children.  In 2006, when her husband lost his job, she became the only bread-winner for her children. But her salary didn’t meet all the expenses of her family and for this reason, Dinara decided to begin her sales business.  Having been a very persistent person, she concentrated all her efforts and achieved success. 

Dinara managed to obtain a small shop at the local market, which had a wide assortment of women's clothes.  Her loyal customers – mostly school teachers, highly appreciate the good quality of Dinara's goods and the very attentive attitude of the shopkeeper to every client. 

In June 2010, when violent clashes caused by the deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Dinara lost her business. Her shop was robbed and looted. 

However, Dinara isn't giving up and is ready to resume her lost business and continue to work. For this very reason, Dinara is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her activity. She plans to purchase more women’s clothes to resell at the local market. Dinara believes that her favorite city Osh will certainly rise from the ashes and become a prosperous one. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothes for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James “Juma” H. W. is forty-six years old, married and has seven children aged between six and twenty-five years old. His wife sells fish and cereals. They hope to give their children a good education to the university level. Juma describes himself as very hardworking and honest.

Although it is a restaurant, Juma’s business is well known as the Salama Hotel. It is located in a busy town centre called Kakamegaand. He serves tea, doughnuts, chicken, stew and other types of Kenyan dishes. He has been in business for fifteen years now. He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge he has is a shortage of water. With his business, water is key, and Juma has to buy lots of water to keep the restaurant running, which in the long run is very costly and eats up most of his hard-earned profits.

Juma is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy more cooking oil, sugar and other foodstuffs for his restaurant. He hopes to diversify to sugarcane farming and later in the future build a house for his family.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, sugar and other foodstuffs for his restaurant

loans.name: Dialis Ines

texts.es:
La Señora Dialis A. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico  que fue proclamado el primero de diciembre como patrimonio de la humanidad.

Nuestra socia es  de la provincia de Esmeraldas y hace 16 años ha migrado a nuestra ciudad motivada por su hermana y en busca de un mejor trabajo. Tiene 42 años, es soltera y tiene una hija de 14 años de edad que estudia  en el colegio. No tiene vivienda propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Dailis trabaja como conserje de una universidad  hace un año y medio de lunes a viernes y un sábado al mes, también tiene un negocio de venta de comida hace 5 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito, fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa de la banca comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus platos.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dialis A. is a member of the Renacer Uncovia Communal Bank, she lives around the Uncovia area in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its beautiful landscapes, and its historic center was declared December 1st as a world heritage site.

Our member is from the Esmeralda’s province and 16 years ago she migrated to our city, motivated by her sister in search of a better job. Dialis is 42 years old, is single and has a 14 year old daughter who attends high school. Dialis does not own a home which is why she rents.

Mrs. Dialis has worked as a custodian in the University for a year and a half from Monday to Friday and one Saturday a month. She also has a business selling food, which she has had for 5 years and works in it Sunday to Sunday from 3 p.m. until 8 p.m.

This is Diali’s fourth loan, she was invited to be a member of the communal bank by a friend who is an active member. Diali’s loan is to buy foodstuffs to make her dishes.

Dialis’ goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Illuminada

texts.en:
Illuminada J. is a widow who lives in Purok Tuhay, Brgy. Canmoros, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business venture: a General Store business. 

Illuminada joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Illuminada has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use to buy raw materials for her home repairs and stocks for the general store so that she could continue to save up for future improvement of business.  Illuminada J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma S. runs a grocery store. She has been operating her business for four years and earns a monthly net income of 2500 PHP. Vilma is 39 years old, married, and blessed with four school-aged children. She is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga.

In 2002, Vilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Vilma is requesting her first loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras De Micaela Bastida Group

texts.es: La alcancía comunal llamada Mujeres Emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastida, es un grupo conformado por 10 mujeres  luchadoras y con buenas ideas para los negocios  hoy en día. Una D. las integrantes es Diana L. con una historia en particular D. éxito y progreso, Diana tiene 45 años D. edad y madre soltera D. un hijo que ha sabido sacarlo adelante con el esfuerzo D. un pequeño negocio que puso hace ya 10 años el cual es el negocio D. fotocopias que fue muy rentable en la zona en la que vive ya que por ahí no avía una. D. esta manera a sabido sobresalir siempre para adelante. Con el fruto del negocio D. fotocopias a podido darle una vida digna a su hijo y una economía estable para su hogar. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertirlo en implementos para las maquinas fotocopiadoras. Como la señora Diana L. cada integrante tiene una historia en particular pero si en algo coinciden es en el empeño que ponen, ante cada desafío que les presenta la vida, en lucha por el bienestar D. sus familias y sus mejoras económicas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Mujeres Emprendedoras D. Micaela Bastida" - or Micaela Bastida's Enterprising Women. The group is composed of 10 determined women with good ideas for their existing businesses. 

One of the members is Diana L., who has a personal history of progress and success. Diana is 45 years old, and the single mother of a son. She has been able to bring him up thanks to a small and very profitable photocopying business she set up 10 years ago in her home neighbourhood, where there wasn't any comparable service. With the profits from the business she has been able to give her son a good upbringing and bring a stable income into her home. With the loan she is planning to invest in implements for the photocopying machines. 

Like Diana L., each member of the group has her own story, but what they have in common is in their determination, in the face of whatever life throws at them, to fight for the wellbeing of their families and improve their economic situations.

loans.use: To invest in implements for photocopiers

loans.name: Hugo Rene

texts.es:
Don Hugo, se dedica a la venta de medicina, tiene 41 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, donde vive con esposa y dos hijo, tienen casa propia;  el negocio inicio luego que el saliera de ser un militar hace 10 años, se dedico a la venta de medicina como fuente de ingreso para su hogar.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de medicina, con esta ayuda estará adquiriendo mucha medicina para el inventario y tener a disponibilidad de los clientes.
Su visión es crecer en el campo de la medicina, ser buen cliente pagando puntualmente, y contar siempre con una fuente de ingreso para su hogar.
texts.en:
Don Hugo sells medicine.  He is 41 years old and lives in Jiquilisco in the department of Usulután along with his wife and two children.  They have their own house.  After leaving the military ten years ago, he began selling medicine to provide his household’s source of income.

He is currently asking for a loan to buy medicine.  With this help, he can acquire a lot of medicine for his inventory and have it available for customers.  His vision is to grow in the field of medicine, be a good borrower paying punctually, and always have a source of income for his home.

loans.use: Buying medicine.

loans.name: Caroline Mbula

texts.en:
Caroline is 35 years old and is married to Joseph who also contributes to the family income. She has been running a posho meal business (a porridge-like dish made from maize) and also practices crop farming as a secondary business. She has been doing this for about 10 years, generating an income of Kshs. 20,000 per month.

She has a good history with KADET and has never borrowed from any other MFI. This is her fourth loan from KADET LTD having successfully repaid her previous ones. She plans to use the loan to buy 30 bags of maize for sale in her posho meal. She hopes to be a regional cereals supplier and to give her children a quality education and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy 30 bags of  maize for sale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He helps his father and brothers to retain a good income source for the family. He has worked as a paving agent from 5 years ago and in 2007, he started to work as a freelance paving agent, sticking with several construction projects. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more tools for his business. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the client and make a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to expand his business operation.

loans.use: To purchase more tools

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a widowed woman with six children, three of whom still attend school and three of whom have graduated. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For over ten years, she has operated a food stall in an open air market, selling food to her neighbors and passersby. Bintihamisi’s major business challenge is competition from other food stall operators. 

Bintihamisi decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase wheat and maize flour, beans, rice, and sugar. In the future, Bintihamisi hopes to open a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase wheat and maize flour, rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Ysabel posee una familia conformada por sus 5 hijos y su esposo, todos juntos comparten sus sueños D. salir adelante y tener un mejor futuro, gracias al trabajo arduo y L. dedicación, Ysabel apoyo a su esposo, generando ingresos extras para el sostén D. L. familia. Sus sueños es poder proveer a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan, y darle una buena educación. Desea estar firme para seguir motivandoles a crecer. 

Ysabel opera el negocio D. ventas ambulantes, específicamente D. ropa, calzados e interiores. Este es su tercer prestamo en Esperanza Internacional, desD. que inicio hace casi dos años Ysabel ha podido invertir por medio D. los prestamos en su negocio, y ampliar clientes e inventario; sus planes al invertir este ultimo es D. poder comprar una buena variedad D. ropas, como faldas, pantalones, camisa, y algunos pares  D. calzado. 

ElL. pertenece al Grupo Mujeres Progresando 1 y 2, el cual posee 10 miembros y es coordinado por Ysabel. Viven en L. ciudad D. Samana, ciudad conocida por su turismo emergente, y ser un destino especial por su eco-turismo, D. muchos atractivos naturales, pero a L. ves con muchas necesidades y comunidades con pocos recursos y posibilidades D. sustitir.  Ysabel y su grupo gracias a los prestamos han podido dar un paso para mejorar sus vidas, las D. su familia y su comunidad. Les da las gracias por su apoyo.
texts.en:
Ysabel’s family is maD. up of her husband and five children.  They all share together the dream of getting ahead and having a better future.  Thanks to her hard work and dedication, Ysabel helps her husband by generating additional income to support the family.  Her dreams are to proviD. her children with everything they need and to give them a good education.  She wants to stay firm to continue motivating them to grow.

Ysabel is a street peddler especially of clothing, footwear and underwear.  This is her third loan with Esperanza Internacional.  Since she joined almost two years ago Ysabel has been able to invest in her business thanks to the loans expanding both her inventory and her customer base.  Her plans are to invest this latest loan to buy a good assortment of clothes like skirts, pants, shirts and a few pairs of shoes.

She is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando 1 y 2” (Women Progressing 1 & 2) group which has 10 members and is led by Ysabel.  They live in the city of Samana, a city known for its developing tourism and for being a special destination due to eco-tourism with many natural attractions, but which at the same time still has many needs and communities with very few resources and few means of support.  Ysabel and her group, thanks to the loans, have been able to take a step towards improving their own, their families’ and their community’s lives.  She thanks you for your help.

loans.use: To buy skirts, jeans, shirts and polo shirts.

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Un S. is  27 years old.  She resides with her family in Takeo province, Cambodia, in an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. S. is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a driver, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Each month, the family must spend USD 66 on food and USD 50 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her family's use. In the future, she would like to use her income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for family use

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is 45 years old, married, and has five children who are all studying. She owns a grocery store in Ayacucho and will be using her loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase rice, sugar and other supplies for the store. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years now. She previously had a business selling cheese, and then she sold clothing. She prefers running the grocery store as she does not have to travel around as much. Delfina would like to increase the quantity of products that she sells and to start to act as a distributor.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and other supplies.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old and married with three children. He has been farming for eleven years. He does dairy farming and also grows tea.

He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would access financial resources. Since then, he has improved his business, hence his living standards. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Segundo Asuncion

texts.es:
Segundo es soltero, tiene 29 años y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de San José, ubicado  a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Segundo se dedica a la fabricación de adobes (material usado para la construcción de viviendas, hecho a base de barro, arcilla y paja), los mismos que vende para obtener ingresos y poder sostener a su familia.

Segundo quisiera fabricar más adobes, por lo que necesita adquirir más insumos para la elaboración de los mismos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Segundo, 29, is single and lives with his family in the San José district, 20 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Segundo makes adobe bricks (mud blocks that are the material used to build houses, made of mud, clay, and straw) and he sells them to make money to support his family.

He would like to make more bricks but he needs more materials and that is why he is asking for a loan of 1500 new sols.

loans.use: To buy materials to make bricks

loans.name: Rosa Balbina

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa Balbina es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive por el sector del Vecino en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, fue nombrada en 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy calida  y con un gran carisma.

Doña Rosa tiene 30 años, es madre soltera de 3 hijos de 15, 10 y 7 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una academia y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la ciudad. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Rosa  se dedica a la venta de granos y frutas en un mercado de la ciudad, esta actividad la realiza hace 20 años, no tiene un puesto propio por lo que vende recorriendo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde y de domingo a domingo.

Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una vecina. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para tener una mayor variedad.

Su sueño es tener  casa propia.
texts.en:
Rosa Balbina is a member of La Paz community bank.  She lives in El Vecino sector, in the city of Cuenca.  This is a cold-climate city which was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.  The locals are very warm and have a lot of charisma.

Rosa is 30 years old.  She is a single mother and has three children aged 15, 10 and 7.  Her eldest (a girl) is studying in an academy and her two younger children attend a local elementary school.  They do not own their own home but live in a rental house.

Rosa sells grains and fruit in a market in the city.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She doesn't own a sales location and so makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor, from 6.00am to 5.00pm, from Sunday to Sunday.

Rosa is in her second loan cycle with her community bank.  She was invited to join by a neighbor.  She will invest this new loan in buying fruit so that she has a wider range to sell.

Rosa's dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Tuwezeshane Group

texts.en:
Jonathan C., in his mid-thirties and a married father of three children who are still going to school, has been running a butcher business for 15 years now. He works from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Jonathan's fifth loan from Tujijenge, his repaid previous loans having been used to increase his meat stock and to start a cosmetics-selling business. He hopes for a loan to buy more meat and more cosmetcs and dreams of one day building his own house.

Jonathan will share this loan with his loan group "Tuwezeshane" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loan portions.

In the picture Jonathan is the first person on the left front row in a dark blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy more meat and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mahdeyya

texts.en:
Mahdeyya is a 55-year-old housewife and mother of five daughters and five sons. Mahdeyya's oldest son has a poultry farm in the city of Tulkarm and another son works in construction. The one who works in construction needed new construction tools and kit. Mahdeyya took out a loan from FATEN to purchase the kit her son needs, which will allow him to have more construction contracts.
Mahdeyya appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and kit for her son

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El señor Simón es empleado, trabaja en una empresa al igual que su esposa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un auto que le ayudaran mucho para desplazarse a su fuente de trabajo sin problemas ya que viven en un lugar muy alejado. Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; Simon es casado y tiene dos hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron anteriormente y tiene un excelente historial de pagos.
texts.en: Simón is an office worker; he and his wife work for the same company. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a car, which will help them easily reach his place of work as they live quite far away from it. He lives in his parents’ house in Achachicala, a neighborhood of the capital La Paz. Simón is married and has two children. This borrower is very satisfied with the loan he has previously been granted, and his repayment history is excellent.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle to reach is place of work.

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Juana de oficio docente con más de veinte años dando clases, oficio que aprendió por vocación. Hoy en día es pensionada, y económicamente apoyada por sus hijos.
Atreves  de la institución ha logrado las mejoras a su vivienda, donde ha venido avanzando poco a poco, durante doce ciclos, con el crédito anterior logro levantar las paredes, y ahora con este nuevo préstamo, hará cambio de techo en la parte de atrás, que lo tiene en mala condiciones por ser ya muy viejo, lo que comprara: laminas de zinc, cuartones, madera, clavos entre otros y comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Juana is a teacher by profession and she taught classes for more than twenty years.  She learned the profession as her vocation.  Juana is now retired and financially supported by her children.

Through our institution, Juana has managed to make improvements to her home.  She has been making gradual progress through twelve loan cycles.  She used her previous loan to build some walls and will use this new loan to replace the roof out the back of her home because it is very old and in a bad state of repair.  She will buy sheets of corrugated metal, beams, wood, nails and other products, and start the job.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as sheets of corrugated metal, wooden beams and nails so that she can replace her roof out the back of her house

loans.name: Roberto Enrique

texts.es: Roberto, con su anterior credikiva agregó una línea telefónica, compró una vitrina y mercancías con las cuales surtió perfectamente y rotó los artículos de manera rápida. Él está muy contento por eso recurre a su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancías variada a un mayor volumen, que le permita obtener descuentos y ofrecerle buenos precios  a sus clientes para seguir posicionándose en el sector. Roberto envía el siguiente menaje a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Su apoyo es muy fundamental, ya que es una ayuda importante para que muchas familias que no tiene la oportunidad ni acceso a entidades prestatarias de recursos, para poder seguir adelante” . y “Que sigan con esta gran labor.”   Si usted quiere conocer la historia de Roberto ingrese al siguiente enlace: http://kiva.org/lend/218344
texts.en:
With his previous Kiva loan, Roberto added a phone line, purchased a display case, and restocked with more merchandise that sold quickly. He is very pleased to be receiving his second Kiva loan so that he can buy merchandise in greater volume. This will allow him to obtain discounts and offer good prices to his customers so that he can continue positioning himself in this sector.

Roberto sends the following message to Kiva lenders: “Your support is very essential and has already been a great help to many families who do not have the opportunity or access to resources from lending institutions so that they can move forward and continue with their work.”

To learn more about Roberto’s story, please click on the following link: http://kiva.org/lend/218344

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in greater volume.

loans.name: Yeremia

texts.en:
Yeremia is a 35-year-old married man with four children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to work hard and be able to pay school fees for his children.

Yeremia has been in the transportation business for seven years, specifically riding a motorcycle. His major challenge is the rainy season. Yeremia's dream is to own at least five motorcycles. Yeremia needs this loan to buy a motorcycle for transportation purposes.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Melinda

texts.es: La siempre risueña Melinda, de 34 años, convive con Edberto, su esposo; ambos tienen 7 hijos, a los que alimentan y educan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de La Unión Leticia. Su rostro sereno refleja a la  mujer luchadora y emprendedora que es, ya que se dedica a diversas actividades. Durante el día se levanta muy temprano para preparar los ricos panes que vende diariamente a su comunidad, muy ágil ella inmediatamente prepara el desayuno de sus hijos para mandarlos a la escuela; hace ya 6 años que se dedica a ello, sus panes son ricos y muy solicitados. Pero la actividad que le trae más ganancias, es la venta de Leña. Melinda compra un lote de 100 árboles los cuales corta con ayuda de peones; posteriormente los vende al por mayor a los comerciantes que visitan su casa los fines de semana; le gusta mucho la venta de leña, “No se requiere mucho trabajo y tiene mayor rentabilidad”, afirma. Además de dedicarse al cuidado de su animales menores a los que alimenta diariamente con alfalfa. Más adelante quiere poner un pequeño taller, donde pueda hacer escaños, escritorios, muebles y demás productos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La unión hace la fuerza” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, y está segura que su banco comunal le apoyara para seguir creciendo. Por ello espera de un pequeño préstamo para seguir adelante. Melinda de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un lote de 200 árboles con ello podrá abastecer la demanda que genera la compra de leña en su zona.
texts.en: The always smiling Melinda is 34 years old. She lives with her husband, Edberto. They have seven children who they take care of and educate in their own house located in the locality of La Unión Leticia. Her calm face reflects a motivated and enterprising woman who dedicates herself to various activities. During the day, she wakes up very early in order to prepare delicious breads that she sells in her community. Being very agile, she then immediately prepares breakfast for her children in order to send them off to school. She has done this activity for six years. Her breads are delicious and very popular. The activity that brings in the most profit is the sale of firewood. Melinda bought a lot with 100 trees that she cuts with the help of laborers. Then the wood is sold wholesale to merchants who visit her house during the weekends. She likes selling firewood a lot. “It doesn’t require much work and it is very profitable”, Melinda states. In addition, she raises small animals which are fed alfalfa daily. In the future, she wants to have a small workshop where she can make seats, desks, furniture and other products. She belongs to the “La unión hace la fuerza” communal bank and this is her ninth loan with MFP. She is sure that her communal bank will help her continue to grow. With this support, Melinda will invest the requested money in the purchase of a lot with 200 trees. With this, she can keep up with the demand that is generated by the purchase of firewood in her area.

loans.use: purchase a lot of 200 trees.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a mother of three children and they live together with their father (her husband).  She lives in the city of Hato Mayor. This is a rural area where agricultural activities are common.

She is dedicated to selling ice cream, groceries, candies, and snacks; she had a candy store, and she also sold ice cream to her neighbors from her home. She had been running this business for around 10 years, and she started her business with her own savings. After some  years without having any business at all, she decided to take her first loan from Esperanza and restart her business. 

Sonia will use this loan to expand her business inventory by purchasing ice cream, groceries, candies, and snacks. Her business profits will be used to reinvest and save, as she is looking to provide for her children's studies.

She really enjoys working. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy ice cream, groceries, candies, etc.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is an honest and straight-forward 36-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children of whom one is in school. To make a living, he has been selling newspapers so as to meet the needs of his family. He supplements his income from the earnings that he gets from his barber shop. 

He wants in the next 5 years to have improved his businesses and become self-reliant. His dream is to own his own house. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine so as to be able to start a new business of tailoring. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has become enlightened in financial matters.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mujeres Poderosas 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Evangelista a member of a group called "Mujeres Poderosas 1 & 2" (Powerful Women 1 & 2). This group is located in Puerto Plata, a rural port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. Most of the group members sell products in this area.  Evangelista is a single mother and her home is a simple structure that she shares with her three children. Her most difficult challenge is to begin her new cafeteria business. Evangelista says that her business efforts will make it possible to provide for her family. In the meantime, she plans to continue to enjoy attending and participating in church and doing business.

Evangelista will use her portion of this group loan to invest in her butcher shop and she is planning to buy a cow to butcher and sell. She also sells boiled beans that neighborhood people buy to cook them faster at home. She began her business by selling these boiled beans and after she saved enough money she began buying meat such as chicken, beef, and pork, to start a butcher shop. Evangelista will save her profit to invest in her business and to save for the cafeteria that she would like to open soon. 

Evangelista is excited to receive her first loan through Esperanza Internacional because her loan will take her one step closer to expanding her business. In the future, she dreams of building a concrete house. Evangelista and her group thank you all for your support!

loans.use: to buy a cow to butcher

loans.name: Theolith

texts.es:
Theolith tiene 58 años y es socia del Banco Comunal "Mujeres Valerosas II“ del distrito Tarapoto del departamento San Martín. Està casada y tiene a una hija y un hijo mayor de edad. 

Se dedica a la costura y confección, trabajó primero en una tienda, pero por mal trato decidió empezar su propio negocio.  Este negocio lo tiene desde hace más de 30 años y en este tiempo ha podido conseguir una clientela fija que también da las recommenaciones a otra gente. Sin embargo le gustarìa crecer y tener una tienda muy grande. Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,5000.00 piensa invertir una parte en publicidad, la otra parte en la compra de telas e hilos para la confección de prendas.

Nos cuenta que le gusta los temas que son tratados en las reuniones. Dice que antes no sabìa en verdad còmo tratar a los clientes.  Está muy contenta ya que gracias  a los préstamos su negocio ha crecido.
texts.en:
Theolith is 58 years old and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Valerosas II" of the Tarapoto district in the department of San Martín. She is married with a daughter, and 1 adult child. 

She makes and sews clothing. At first she worked in a store, but because of bad treatment she decided to begin her own business. She has been doing this for more than 30 years, and has a steady clientele, and they recommend her services to others. Nonetheless she wants to grow and have a very large store. 

She wants to use this loan of $925 in part for advertising and partly to purchase fabric and thread for making clothes. She tells us that she likes the things they talk about at the meetings. She says that she didn’t know before about good customer service. She is very happy, and thanks to the loans her business has grown.

loans.use: to advertise and to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Shamsihol

texts.ru: Шамсихол занимается животноводством. Разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов крупнорогатого и мелко – рогатого скота.
texts.en: Shamsihol raises livestock for a living, mostly to sell for meat. She would like to take out this loan to buy a few more calves and lambs for her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Jesus Deliva

texts.es:
Jesús Deliva es soltera tiene cincuentaisiete años de edad tiene una hija, vive con la hija de treintainueve años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Jesús se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y ventas las realiza  en san Juan.  Solicita el crédito para poder dar mantenimiento a l cacao y obtener una buena cosecha.

El crédito será de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar el cultivo de cacao para venderlo a un buen precio.

 Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente es la competencia y la plaga. El sueño es compartir momentos agradables y  estar siempre con la familia y salir a delante.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir a pasear con la hija por el pueblo.
texts.en:
Jesus Deliva is single and she is fifty-seven years old. She has a daughter. She lives with her daughter who is thirty-nine years old and they live in the canton of Los Rios.

She is a member of the communal bank "Cevallos", which is located in the San Francisco enclosure. It belongs to the Parrish of San Juan del Pueblo Viejo, in Ventanas. The population in Ventanas is dedicated to agriculture and cocoa cultivations.

Jesus is an agriculturist who cultivates cocoa. The makes her purchases and carries out her sales in San Juan. She requests a loan to carry out maintenance care on her cocoa plantation so that her product will be of higher quality.

The loan will be a great help to improve her cocoa cultivation and she will be able to sell it at a good price. 

The challenges which she faces very frequently are the competition and plagues. Her dream is to share happy moments, to always remain with her family, and to move forward.

In her spare time she enjoys visiting the village with her daughter.

loans.use: to carry out maintenace care to her cocoa plantation to ensure a good harvest.

loans.name: Lien's Group

texts.en:
Lien is 35 years old with 3 children who are in high school. They live in Phu Man village. Joining SEDA's credit program in 2010, she received a loan of 5,152,000 VND to open her small grocery store. Her business is running quiet well. It generates a profit of 150.000 VND. This income helps her a lot in managing her family's lifestyle. In the process of repayment, she is always in a good situation. As group leader, she will encourage other members in her group to complete their repayment punctually.

Thanh is 46 years old with 2 children. She is a farmer and focuses on growing rice and raising chickens and pigs. For this new loan cycle, she requires a loan of 7,392,000 VND.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of products to meet the demand of customers

loans.name: Nambilo A Group

texts.en:
Celestine is the facilitator of the Nambilo A group. Celestine and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Celestine takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's best prices and in order to grow enough to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Celestine had a good maize yield harvesting seven bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Celestine was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Celestine and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Celestine will educate his children and build a house. 

In 2012, the members of Nambilo A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and one acre of land. 

He is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 42 years old, married, and has five adult children. Lucila is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. Lucila operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has earned 6,000 PHP a month for more than five years. 

In 2010, Lucila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucila has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Lucila is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase motorcycle spare parts and maintenance. This will be Lucila's fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena, age 30, owns and operates a business venture involving the planting and harvesting of taro. She offers her harvested taro for sale to local community members. She has four years of experience in this business. She lives with her husband and two children in Manono, Samoa. 

Filomena needs a loan of WST $2,500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 800 talas or US $333 per week) to improve and expand the business.
 
In 2009, Filomena joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Filomena's fourth loan with SPBD. 



*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the ""overall social metric score.""  For example, a 3 out of 3 on ""level of education"" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Mikayel

texts.en:
Mikayel is engaged in agriculture. He lives together with his wife, mother, and children.
 
Mikayel needs some financial means to improve his orchard and protect it. With the requested loan he plans to purchase wire and columns. This will allow him to organize the cultivation of land, grow trees more effectively, and have a better harvest next year. 

Mikayel will increase his profit and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for wire and columns for the orchard.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Gregoria; la socia continua con le negocio de compra y venta de papa al por mayor y menor en uno de los mercados, la socia tiene su stand y desea comprar papa al por mayor en diferentes variedades, la socia también comprara bolsas de rafia para almecenar las papas según el tipo de papas. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el credito en la compra de papa en diferentes variedades, la socia tambien comprara bolsas de rafia.
texts.en:
The borrower is Gregoria. She is continuing with her business of buying and selling potatoes at wholesale and retail at one of the markets. She has a stand, and wishes to buy various varieties of potatoes at wholesale. 

On this occasion, the borrower wishes to use the loan to buy various varieties of potatoes. She also wishes to buy raffia (palm fiber) bags.

loans.use: To buy raffia (palm fiber) bags.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is a 34-year-old, married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had her business selling tea in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Hawa is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and coffee. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase coffee and sugar to sell.

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Loma de la Cruz y vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad tiene una gran belleza arquitectónica, es muy rica en su cultura, su gente es muy amable y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. María tiene 47 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña María es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de periódico, revistas y billetes de lotería, esta actividad la realiza hace 30 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de periódicos, revistas y billetes de lotería para su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
47-year-old María is a member of the communal bank 'Loma de la Cruz' and lives in the city of Cuenca. The city is rich in culture with beautiful architecture, and it's people are very friendly and strive to maintain their culture and traditions.
 
María lives with her partner, with whom she has had 3 children who are now grown, married and living independently. Her husband is a trader, and they are renting their house as they do not own their own home. 

María is a merchant and sells newspapers, magazines and lottery tickets. She has had this business for 30 years and works from Sunday to Sunday, 6 am to 6 pm.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years and will invest this new loan in the purchase of newspapers, magazines and lottery tickets for her business.
 
María's goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: purchase of newspapers, magazines and lottery tickets for her business.

loans.name: Latinka

texts.en:
Latinka T. keeps a little clothing shop in one of the trading halls in the town of Smolian. She has run her little business for 15 years. Before the political changes in Bulgaria in 1989, she had been a waitress in one of the town restaurants, but right after that she had lost her job and decided to start with the trading.

She says that she has always liked the trading and contact she has with customers. The shop is still very small but for the past 15 years in the business she has attracted many regular customers.

The money she earns from her shop is enough to make a stable living, but 4 years ago her husband passed away and now she is experiencing great difficulties. Although her two children are grown up and do not live with her anymore, she still helps them with some money and supports them in some ways. Even through the challenges, she remains an optimist. Her dream is so simple – to be in good health, to work hard, and for the shop to be well-supplied so that her customers will be satisfied.

Latinka T. will use this loan of 1000 USD to buy 200 unique sets of children's clothes that she does not already supply in her shop.

loans.use: Working capital - 200 sets of children clothes

loans.name: Yeyevi

texts.en: Yeye is a stone cracker. She cracks stones of different sizes and sells them to constructors and individuals who want to build houses. She buys the stones for cracking from a very long distance away from her work site. She is unable to buy in large quantity due to the cost involved in buying and transporting the stones to her work site. She needs a loan of $1000 from Kiva to enable her to buy in bulk.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Florence wants to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: "The catering business is very good if you can invest in it," Comfort M. says. Her business is presently worth about $500 (Nigerian Naira 70, 000) but she needs additional capital. Comfort is married with five children. She hopes to receive the Kiva loan of $ 750 so that she can expand her catering business.

loans.use: To buy more caking-baking equipment

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Aged 40, Mrs. Ablavi A. is married and the mother of five children. Her activity is to buy small ruminants and poultry from local breeders and sell them at the various markets. This work requires a lot of financial means since it involves a fair amount of travel. However, it is a very profitable activity. For this reason Mrs. A. is seeking financing to strengthen her business. She is asking for a business loan of $700. This loan is very important for improving her income as the financial burden of the family is too great.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame A. Ablavi est mariée et mère de cinq (5) enfants. Son activité est d’acheter chez les éleveurs, des petits ruminants et des volailles qu’elle revend sur les marchés. Un travail qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens financiers car demandant assez de déplacement. Cependant, c’est une activité très rentable. C’est pour cela que Madame A. Ablavi recherche un financement pour la renforcer. Elle sollicite un apport financier de $700 de fonds de commerce. Ce crédit est très important pour améliorer ses revenus car les charges de la famille sont trop lourdes.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

loans.use: Buying and selling small ruminants and poultry

loans.name: Liua T

texts.en: Liua is one of the old ladies in the Samatau Fou Center. She is sixty years old and she is married with eight children. Her husband does not work. Therefore, her plantation is the primary way Liua supports her family. The income helps send the children to school, pay family commitments, and solve financial issues. Liua goes to the market four days a week. She spends the rest of her time weaving fine mats and also fans for extra income. However, she lives on the far east of Upolu Island, which means transportation costs are one of her major problems. She is looking for a solution to this problem and she hopes that in the future she will be able to have her own transportation to deliver her goods to the market. Although Liua is happy with her business, she is requesting the current loan to further develop her plantation.

loans.use: To buy iron roofing, timber, and cement for home improvements and also chemicals and equipment for her plantation.

loans.name: Fredy Toribio

texts.es:
Fredy is an admirable father to three sons. He always showed his hardworking ethics and dedication to the beautiful art of art crafts. He makes house accessories with with peruvian jungle motives. He performs this job efficiently, making multiple designs and innovative crafts. He has been having a lot of demand due to his innate talent and he has been able to help his family progress.

He currently has a great quantity of clients. However, he does not have enough capital to purchase the necessary materials to produce these requests. This is the reason why he is requesting your support by soliciting a loan. The loan will help him accomplish his orders and obtain a larger economical benefit to raise the quality of life of his dear sons. We count with your generous contribution to make Fredy's dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Fredy, es un admirable padre de tres hijos, que durante el desarrollo de su vida siempre se mostró como un hombre muy trabajador y dedicado al hermoso arte de la fabricación de artículos artesanales como la confección de adornos con motivos propios de la selva peruana, trabajo que desempeña eficientemente, realizando múltiples diseños y confecciones novedosas y que gracias a su talento innato está teniendo mucha demanda y con esta labor está progresando su familia.Actualmente cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes, pero tiene un problema, no posee suficiente capital para comprar los materiales necesarios para la producción de los artículos que ofrece, es por esa razón que recurre a vuestro apoyo y solicita un préstamo que le permitirá cumplir con sus pedidos y al mismo tiempo obtener mayor beneficio económico para brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus queridos hijos. Contamos con tu gentil contribución para hacer realidad en corto tiempo los sueños de Fredy.

loans.use: Inject capital in order to consolidate Fredy's  art crafts business.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị L. is 49 years old. She tends a small stand selling fruits and grocery. This type of business is quite popular amongst the locals. It gives her cash flow to cover her family living expenses and making the weekly payment. Her income is about 4 USD a day. Ms L. lives with her husband, her son and her daughter in the town of Lương Bằng, Kim Động district (near Ha Noi). Her husband helps her a lot in tending her business. Ms L. is a TYM member for 6 years now. She would like to obtain a L. to buy more merchandise, in time for the Tet period (New Year). She's requesting 950 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị L., 49 tuổi, làm nghề bán hàng hoa quả tại thị trấn Lương Bằng, Kim Động. Đây là một nghề phổ biến với người dân trong vùng. Công việc này giúp chị có được những khoản thu nhập hàng ngày để chi phí cho gia đình và trả tiền tuần. Tiền lãi hàng ngày của chị khoảng 4USD. Chị L. sống với chồng và 1 con trai 1 con gái đều đã đến tuổi trưởng thành. Chồng chị là người phụ giúp chị rất đắc lực trong việc kinh doanh. Chị tham gia quỹ TYM đến nay được 6 năm nay. Sắp đến Tết âm lịch, chị rất muốn vay vốn từ TYM để mua thêm nhiều hàng phục vụ cho người dân. Mức vốn đề nghị của chị lần này là 950USD.

loans.use: Buy fruits

loans.name: Phov

texts.en: Mrs. Phov C., 29, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband in a part of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling various kinds of vegetables at a busy market, where she can typically make on average around $8 each day in revenue. Her husband works selling a variety of grocery products to the people in his area, making on average about $4 each day of income. One of her children is enrolled in school and the rest are too young to attend school. Mrs. Phov C. has humbly requested a loan to expand her inventory, to enable her to meet her growing customer demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory, to enable her to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: “God bless the initiators of this wonderful program,” exclaimed Adama.  "The loan has improved my family livelihood.”  She proudly said she was able to send one of her sons to college and has paid all the tuition fees and this is purely from the profit.  She added that she would very grateful if Kiva could grant her more loan capital to expand her business.  She sells various food items in the market, and there is a lot of demand.  She is requesting for Le.800, 000.  Adama has completed paying her previous loan.

loans.use: Adama needs an additional loan for expansion of her business so she can continue paying for her son's college tuition fees.

loans.name: Egna

texts.es:
A short time ago, Egna set up a small space to sell cold drinks in a tourist center of her city. Up until now, business has not gone all that well, but it's certain that little by little more people are coming to her small stand. She is requesting a loan to be able to offer more variety and quality to her customers, and help make her small business well known.

Egna, hace poco instaló un pequeño espacio de ventas de bebidas heladas en un centro turístico de su ciudad, hasta el momento las cosas no parecen marchar muy bien pero está segura que poco a poco las personas acudirán a su pequeño local en búsqueda de sus servicios.Con este propósito y a fin de ofrecer además de variedad calidad desea obtener un préstamo a fin de hacerse conocida y muy popular dentro de poco también iniciará las ventas de platos típicos en este espacio ya que tiene la esperanza de convertirlo en el espacio turístico de mayor visita.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HER BUSINESS AND OFFER A GREATER VARIETY  OF DRINKS TO HER CUSTOMERS.

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es:
Señora Betty D. Castillo D. T. is a member of the communal bank called 'Ayahmaman' located in the district of Moyobamba in San Martin. She sells delicious different types of soups from door to door and also at the local supermarket located in Moyobamba.

With this loan, which she will repay within 6 months, she will purchase beans in huge quantities in all different varieties in the region. She will also purchase vegetables that she will add to her soups to offer to her daily clients.

Betty is 55 years old. She loves her children and takes good care of them. She works to offer them a better life. She hopes to one day offer internet access (booths) and to sell ice-cream from her home.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Betty D. Castillo D. T., es socia D. Banco Comunal “Ayaymaman”, ubicado en la provincia y distrito D. Moyobamba, departamento D. San Martín, se dedica a la venta D. menestras cocinadas en sus diferente variedades las mismos que ofrece en su puesto D. ventas ubicado en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Moyabamba. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará menestras en sacos tanto los que se producen en la región D. la selva como: fréjol huasca, Chiclayo, y lo que se produce en la región D. la costa y sierra como: fréjol canario, caballero, alverjas, pallares, habas, lentejas, para ofrecer diariamente a su basta clientela. Betty tienes 55 años, es una mujer muy preocupada por sus hijos, trabaja para sacarlos adelante, anhela tener cabinas D. internet y venta D. refrigerios en su casa.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 32 year-old Anna K.. She is single, and has no children. Anna owns a local brew business and has applied for this loan in order to purchase additional equipment and ingredients, which she will use to make more beer. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. For example, when a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. This is a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. They are, therefore, labelled ‘not-creditworthy’ by financial institutions because they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services, for women with low incomes.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment and ingredients for making home brew (local beer)

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mrs. Yan C., 42, is married and resides with her husband and six children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, where she has been working as a farmer since 1980. She works growing rice crops and vegetables on her rice paddy, making only a meager sum of money per day. 

To earn more money to support the family’s expenses, her husband has a business making ice cream which he sells  to a number of people in his town. His profit is around $1.50 per day. The ice-cream business is the main income for the family. In order to expand the ice cream business and make more money, Mrs. Yan C. and her husband have humbly requested a loan to buy more ice cream ingredients ( sugar, salt, peanuts, coconuts and other ingredients). This will allow her husband to produce a larger quantity each day to satisfy their client demand. (Her husband who is working as an ice cream vendor is pictured because his wife was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream ingredients to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in new bedspread styles for her small business.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina A. sells cosmetics such as perfume, creams, etc. Philomina has received primary education.  She is divorced and has 6 children. Philomina has been selling cosmetics since 2001. She is responsible for paying the school fees to educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy more goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Muhiddin

texts.ru: Негматов Мухиддин парень в возросте 26 лет имеет двоих детей , вместе с женой торгует на рынке г. Худжанда арендовав отдел в магазине. В его ассортимент товаров входит разновидность туалетного мыла, щотки, губки для мытья посуды,заколки и резинки для женских волос и .т.д. Уже 5 лет как они самостоятельно видут свой бизнес , за товаром ездит сам Мухиддин , а торговлю при его отсутствии ведет его жена, для увеличения товара Мухиддин решил обратится в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Muhiddin N. is 26 years old, he has two children. Together with his wife he sells on the market of the town of Hudjanda by renting a space in the store. The assortment of his merchandise includes soap, brushes, sponges for washing dishes, women's hair decorations and other items. They have been independently running their business for five years now. Muhiddin travels for the merchandise and his wife sells in the store while he is away. To increase their assortment Muhiddin decided to come to MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling retail of every day convenience items

loans.name: Hamdullah

texts.en: Hamdullah is 30 years old, married, and the father of five children. He lives in Behsood Ningarhar province. Hamdullah has two daughters and three sons, his oldest son is studying in the fifth class in the public school, and the others are small. He has own house and his parents live with him. He used to be an auto driver and now he has a hairdressing shop. To support his family, he needs money so he contacted the lenders of (AFSG) to take a 50000 (AF) loan for 18 months. He wants to buy such items as chairs, tables, and other things. He also wants to hire a person to work for him in his barber shop. He will now be very happy and he thanks the lenders of (AFSG) so much.

loans.use: Hamdullah would like to buy tables, chairs and supplies for his barber shop.

loans.name: Noeng

texts.en: Noeng S., 48, is married and lives with six children in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband have a business catching fish from the river which is near their house. They always sell their catch at the market to earn approximately US$5 of profit each day. This couple also get support from two of their children who work at Phnom Penh as garment factory workers. Noeng S. would like to take out a loan of US$400 to purchase more fishing tools. This will allow this couple to catch more fish for sale.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Pin S., 49, is a true entrepreneur who lives with three of her children and husband in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She raises pigs and cooks for the garment factory workers near her house. She receives money and cooks for them. On average, she makes $3 a day, while her husband is a farmer. He grows and sells cashew nuts and yams to earn a living, and is able to make approximately $3.50 a day. One of their children is a student, and two help their parents work. 

Pin S. would like to take out a loan of $1000. Her husband will use some of the money to purchase yams from individual growers for resale. The rest of the money will be used to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase yams

loans.name: Saeed

texts.en: Saeed is a 35-year-old married carpenter with two young children, living in Sir Al Gharbieh, Nabatieh, southern Lebanon. Saeed opened his shop in 1998, and he has already taken several micro-loans to ameliorate his business. Today, he is asking for US$ 1,000 to buy special tools to diversify his services.

loans.use: Buy special tools for his work

loans.name: Neomila

texts.es:
NEOMILA P. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Amistad” ubicado en la Av. Bolognesi Mz. H, Lt. 8 del AA.HH. “Nuevo Bolognesi” C.F.B. km. 7.000 del Distrito de Callería, tiene 43 años, 03 hijos, su esposo es profesor.

	El primer préstamo que recibio de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró pollos bebe, e implementos para la crianza, ella trabajaba en el comedor Nacional de Pucallpa N° 18 en sus momentos libres, hacia los alimentos para los pollos.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, compró más pollos bebes, los cría en su fundo, por ahora ella viene a la ciudad a comprar los alimentos e implementar para su crianza, y ya no trabaja en el comedor solo cría a sus pollos.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por su comprensión y confianza.
texts.en:
Neomila P. T., 43, is amember of the Communal Bank "Friendship", located in the Calleria district. Neomila has 3 children, and is married to a school teacher. Neomila used the first loan that she received to purchase chicks and supplies to raise them. At that time, she also worked in a "comedor nacional" (government-run soup kitchen). This loan (1,000 soles) will be used to buy more chicks. Now Neomila just raises her chickens, and goes to town to buy feed and supplies. She does not need to work in the "comedor" anymore. Neomila is thankful to Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for its support and trust.

Translated from Spanish by Maria B., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing more chicks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Mrs. Susan B. hails from the province of Antique. She is blessed with three children. She is married to a driver of delivery van and which also serves as their service vehicle when going to the market.

She is requesting an amount of PHP15,000 as additional capital for her variety store. She was started the variety store when ASHI gave her an initial capital. The income generated from her business is a great help for her to meet family expenses.
	
She dreams that her children will finish their studies and her variety store will become a mini-mart someday.

loans.use: To be used as additional working capital for her variety store.

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en:
Rihab A. is 45 years old (her son appears in the picture). She lives in Hebron in Palestine with her husband and five children. She and her husband opened a grocery store to help pay for their children's education as well as the household expenses.

Rihab is asking for a $1000 loan to expand her grocery store and acquire more merchandise, so that she can be well supplied and satisfy her customers. She makes all the decisions with respect to the income from her business. She has become more outspoken and has a great desire to succeed. Rihab is grateful to Ryada for allowing her to grow both as an entrepreneur and as a woman.

loans.use: expand her grocery store and acquire more merchandise

loans.name: Kambarali

texts.ru: Камбарали мужчина 32 лет , женат имеет одного ребёнка. Камбарали работает в колхозе трактористом на поле. Из-за того, за работу ему дают не деньги , а продукты, то поэтому он занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ему друзья посоветовали увеличить скот в кредит. Для чего и обратился Камбарали в Микроинвест. Он думает, что в дальнейшем он будет продолжать кредитоваться .
texts.en:
Kambarali is a 32 year old man, he is married and has one child. Kambarali works at a collective farm as a tractor driver in the field. He gets paid in kind for his work and is not given any money, so he also raises and sells livestock. His friends suggested that he increase his livestock headcount by taking out a loan. This is why Kambarali turned to MicroInvest. He thinks that he will continue taking out loans in the future.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock count

loans.name: Kwasi

texts.en:
Kwasi B. is a fifty-eight-year-old married man and a father of four children, two sons and two daughters. His two eldest children have completed school and are working. The rest are in senior high and junior high schools. His wife is a professional midwife in the local government hospital. Kwasi lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Achiase. Achiase is a busy farming antd rading community in the eastern region of Ghana. 


He is a farmer and also runs a drugstore in his community. He sells drugs such as paracetamol (also known as acetaminophen), syrups and other kinds of tablets. His drugstore is located at the local market square. He visits the farm early in the mornings to make time for the drugstore later on in the day. He procures the drugs from nearby bigger towns. Kwasi has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk. He hopes to provide his children with the best possible education.

loans.use: To procure drugs

loans.name: Gantuya

texts.en: Gantuya G. is 61, married and the mother of two children ages 17 and 21. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Both her children are university students. Gantuya has been running an underwear stall at Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, since 2000. Since then, her working capital has increased from 500,000 tugrugs ($1 USD=1400 MNT) to 2 million tugrugs. With the profits, she has bought a summer house. She also pays her children's tuition every year. Her husband works as a construction worker and contributes to the family's income. She requests a loan to buy more underwear to increase her business inventory. Gantuya says that "if my children are happy and fully content with their lives, I suppose my dream has come true."

loans.use: To buy more underwear.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.en:
M. Bahodur is 30 years old. Together with his wife, they are raising three children. Bahodur has been running a drug store already for five years. He is selling only certified medicines. The drug store is located in the center of the town, which allows him to have many clients and customers. Bahodur has been a client of IMON for a year. Now he requests 4000 Somoni. Being a very accurate person by nature, Bahodur is sure, and would like to ensure the lenders, that he is able to pay the loan on time without any violations. Your generosity can change their lives.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to expand his business

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is 46 years old and is married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colors. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Hourt

texts.en:
Mr. Hourt R. is 21 years old. His wife’s name is Srey Ren, and she is age 20. This young couple make a living as local tailors. They also buy clothes, sew them to produce other kinds of clothing, and sell their clothes in bulk to market sellers. This couple has been married a year but still have no child.

Hourt R. has used his business investment very well and has attracted a number of clients to use his services. To make more his business successful, he would like a loan in order to purchase a pair of sewing machine he can use to perform his work more quickly.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of sewing machine

loans.name: Davrondjon

texts.en:
M. Davrondjon is a married man responsible for three children. For three years, he has been selling basic foodstuffs in his grocery located in the central market.
