He began his business with $200 USD that he saved over a long period of time. It is necessary to note that Davrondjon is a strong and hardworking man. He knows how to respond to the call of being a father who supports his three children who study in elementary school. He has worked with IMON International for a year, having received a loan that he has taken advantage of wisely to better his and his family’s living conditions. Currently Davrondjon is requesting a loan of $3000 USD. He is counting on your help and thanks all of you sincerely!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Faete

texts.en:
Faete A. K. is a 43-year-old woman living in the town of Fagalii-Uta.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Faete runs a general store.  The primary source of income for this business comes selling a variety of different products to the local community.  Faete has been engaged in this business for over 3 years.

Faete joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Faete has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1750 Samoan tala (or about $725 US) from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to renovate her general store.  Faete is now requesting a new loan of 2500 tala (or about $950) which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan Faete has taken out from SPBD.  Faete plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her store.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia P. is a 57-year old mother of nine children. Her eldest son is now 33 years old and is already married. She is a fish vendor and a seaweeds grower. Her husband knows how to fish so if ever her husband catches plenty of fish she also sell it in the village.  What she likes to do is buy  more fish from other fishermen wso that she will have more fish to  resell at 40% mark up value.

She needs additional capital in her business for pumpboat repair and buy seaweeds seedlings for her seaweeds farm. 

She likes availing loans from CEVI because they are very kind and they give only 2% interest rate.

loans.use: Pump boat repair and buy seaweeds

loans.name: Little Is Much When God Is In It. Group

texts.en:
"Little Is Much When God Is In It" is a group of 5 borrowers led by Mako T. T.. Mako is a 34-year-old high school graduate and a single parent of 2 children ages 8 and 14, who are both in 4th grade. Mako lives between Mechlin and Water Streets, a community that is known for small businesses, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. 

Mako buys clothing wholesale and sells it retail to the residents of downtown Monrovia. Because she is a single parent, she takes her clothing business very seriously. She needs this loan to buy more clothing to make a profit in order to educate her kids.

Mako sells good material. That makes her win more customers. She has been running this business for 15 years. She wants to import clothing from abroad to make it cheaper and affordable even for poor people to buy. Her dream is to change her live and the life of her family through her business.

loans.use: Buy more clothing

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: D. Jacqueline est née vers 1973 à Dogbo au Sud du Bénin. Jacqueline est mariée à METO René, un revendeur. Jacqueline est mère de trois enfants. C’est Jacqueline et son mari qui assurent ensemble les dépenses du foyer. C’est les produits de quincaillerie que Jacqueline vend. Jacqueline a sa boutique de quincaillerie au carrefour Aglouza à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Jacqueline a déjà huit ans d’expérience dans cette activité. C’est au Ghana, État voisin du Bénin que Jacqueline achète ses produits de quincaillerie. Jacqueline veut augmenter le volume de son activité mais il lui manque des moyens financiers pour y arriver. C’est pourquoi Jacqueline s’est approchée d’ALIDé pour avoir un crédit.
texts.en:
Jacqueline D. was born around 1973 in Dogbo, in the south of Benin. Jacqueline is married to René Meto, a secondhand dealer, and has three children. Jacqueline and her husband take care of their household expenses together. Jacqueline sells hardware accessories from her store in the Aglouza Carrefour, in Cotonou - the economic capital of Benin. Jacqueline already has 8 years of experience in this business. She purchases her products in Ghana, Benin's neighboring state. Jacqueline would like to increase the sales volume of her business, but she is lacking the financial means to do so. This is why she has approached Alidé to request a loan.

Translated from French by Dina Dumenko, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware and building supplies

loans.name: Virgen De Las Mercedes Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes” esta representado por la señora Lenny y conformada 14 miembros  de los cuales la gran mayoría del grupo ya trabajaron bajo esta modalidad de crédito, algunas socias son antiguas. En general todas se dedican a la venta de pan, empanadas, abarrotes, comida, elaboración de tortas a pedido, cosméticos y reposterías. La competencia en el ámbito comercial es alta pero todos tienen buenos productos para vender y saben como hacer su trabajo por lo que no tienen mayores dificultades con la competencia. El destino del crédito es para apoyarlos en sus pequeños negocios como compra de insumos para sus negocios como harina, manteca y herramientas como utensilios para la elaboración y decoración de tortas para agrandar mas sus negocios y genera mayores ganancias que ayuden a mejorar la calida de vida de sus familias. En cuanto a la experiencia muchas de las socias no cuentan con experiencia en créditos solidarios pero están muy entusiasmadas por recibir la confianza de una institución que las apoya y cree en que puedan salir adelante con sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
Lenny represents the Virgen de las Mercedes Communal Bank, which is comprised of 14 members. Most of the group has worked with this type of loan; some of them are long time members. Generally, they all sell things like bread, empanadas, groceries, food, cosmetics, pastries, or make cakes to order. There is a lot of competition in the commercial area, but they all have good products to sell and they know how to do their work. Therefore, they do not have major problems with the competition. The loan is to support them in their small businesses. They will buy supplies for their businesses like flour and shortening. They will buy tools like utensils for making and decorating cakes. They will do this to expand their businesses and generate greater earnings. This will help them to improve the quality of life for their families. As far as experience goes, the members do not have experience with unified loans, but they are very enthusiastic to have the confidence of an institution that helps and believes that they can get ahead in their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Esther Wanjiru

texts.en:
Esther started selling used clothing 10 years ago and has grown her customer base over the years. She is 33 years old, married and has a ten-year-old son. She earns about 10,000 Kenyan shillings a month from her business. This is Esther's fourth loan and she will use it to purchase additional used shoes to sell to customers. Esther's customers live in a low income urban settlement. One day, Esther hopes to have enough money to purchase a plot of land and build a home.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a micro-finance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy secondhand shoes to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Adelitas Group

texts.es:
Adelitas, así se hacen llamar un grupo de 8 mujeres y 1 varon que muy alegres desarrollan su reunión, en el Centro Focal Collpani además  les gusta la capacitación que imparten en Pro Mujer y durante el anterior préstamo ellas  se capacitaron en un 20% en temas de Fortalecimiento (Mora, Central de Riesgo), 20% en temas de Salud y 10% Negocios.  

Todas tienen diversos negocios como la venta de conservas, lana, detergentes, llantas, bordado de prendas de vestir y transporte. Ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar  mercadería y materia prima según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
Adelitas, which this group of eight women and one man call themselves, happily meet in the Collpani regional branch. They enjoy the training that is given at Pro Mujer. During the previous loan, they trained themselves, dedicating 20% on topics about financial strengthening (default payments, banking risks office), 20% about health, and 10% about business. All of them have distinct businesses, such as the sale of canned goods, wool, detergents, tires, embroidered clothing, and transportation. They need this loan to purchase merchandise and raw materials according to the businesses that they own.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and raw materials.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad has worked as a fisherman for the past 20 years. He's 44 years old and really likes his job. Today, Ahmad is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy special fishing tools and appliances in order to expand his business. He hopes to fish more and sell more fish to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy special fishing tools and appliances

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen M.’s previous loan recently ended. She was so thankful for the lenders that through KIVA she was able to obtain the loan she was requesting. Because of that loan, she was able to help her niece and her niece’s child which she considers her family to have their own source of income. Aside from them, Carmen also considers her co members in ASHI as her extended family. Despite of the time she is required to attend the weekly center meeting, she enjoys exchanging ideas about running a business with them. Now, she wants to request another loan she will be using to finance the fishing business of her niece’s 18-year-old son who preferred not to go to school anymore and earn money instead. She wishes to use it in purchasing another fishing boat to be managed by her relative and some will be used to finance her hog fattening business. Carmen and her 53-year-old niece, Susan shares the responsibility of selling fish directly to people around the community and at times of good catch, they sell in other neighboring municipalities. When fish is off season, Carmen retails vinegar in addition to her previous business which is selling of soft drinks, and raises hogs in their backyard as an alternative source of income. Hogs she will fatten will either be slaughtered and will be directly sold to people in their village per kilo or will be sold as a whole to a meat vendor. Through her business Carmen hopes to have savings in preparation for her needs as she grows older.

loans.use: To purchase another fishing boat and to finance her hog fattening business

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, es una mujer muy respetuosa, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 36 años, es madre de tres hijos, todos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida típica de la región, esta actividad la realiza en la vereda de su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es vendedor independiente. Milagros forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”, desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de insumos para la preparación de su comida y posterior venta.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de una cocina a carbón y en la compra de productos e insumos para la preparación de su comida.	La meta de Milagros es tener un restaurante, ya que ella vende en forma ambulatoria.
texts.en:
Milagros is a very respectful woman who lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucayali province of Peru. She is 36 years old and has 3 young children. She works selling regional food from the porch of her home. Her husband works as an independent salesman and supports her in her work. Milagros has been part of the "Talented Women" village bank for the past year; the first loan she received was for $100 and she invested it in ingredients for her food sales. Now she needs $200 which she will invest in purchasing a charcoal stove and in ingredients for her food. She would like to eventually have a restaurant since she now sells her food on foot.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a charcoal stove and ingredients for food

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion A. is a typical wife who wants to help her husband earn money to improve the lives of their six children, whose ages range from one to 16 years. Her husband is a small-time laborer who earns just a small about of income.

With her husband’s income alone, Consolacion’s dream of giving their children a better life is impossible. Therefore, together with her supportive family, she joined ASHI just recently so that she can request a loan which she will use to start up a small business raising pigs.

The nature of this business is that either you will slaughter the hog or you will sell it live after four months fattening. The larger the volume of hogs sold, the greater the profit. However, starting up with a small amount of capital, Consolacion would still be happy to see her small profit responding to her family’s basic needs.

With ASHI and its partner Kiva, Consolacion believes that someday her small business will grow and its profit will sustain the education of her children until they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and married with four children, ages 12, 10, 8 and 4, with all four children currently attending school. She is a farmer in the Kisii region in western Kenya. She's been farming for six years and sells milk at the local market. She also earns supplementary income from small-scale tomato and maize production. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of a ready market for her products at all times.

Rose requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for KES 60,000 to purchase a chuff cutter. A chuff cutter is a device for cutting straw or hay into small pieces to feed cattle, saving a significant amount of time over doing it by hand. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to sell more milk to help pay for school fees, and also to improve the health of her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business to have ten good dairy cows for milk production.

loans.use: To buy a chuff cutter

loans.name: Morris Maina

texts.en:
Morris is the father of three children and he is 36 years old. He operates a barber shop at Mwiki trading center near his home. He has been in this kind of business for ten years. 

Besides the barber shop, Morris also operates a green grocery stall within the same trading center. His wife Mercy is also a businesswoman.

Morris was introduced to KADET by a staff member during a marketing exercise. This will be Morris' second loan with KADET and he has not borrowed from other financial institutions before. He plans to add more stock to the grocery stall with things like tomatoes, potatoes, onions, kale and others. This will help him get more income. 

He hopes to buy his own pickup (a small truck) to transport tomatoes and other farm produce in the area.

loans.use: To add stock to his grocery stall.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mrs. Lai H. is 44 years old and she lives in Check village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 2 hectare field to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband is a fisherman who earns a small income to support the family. 

Mrs. Lai H. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to help her grow crops. She is the mother of three children: one is a farm laborer while the other two are students in the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Gerson

texts.en:
Gerson B. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 48 years old. Gerson is married and has four adult children. Gerson owns and operates a charcoal business in the local community. Gerson has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gerson joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid his first loan from HSPFI, which was for 5000 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Gerson is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to to expand the business. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Lun L., 60, is married and resides with his wife and four children in Battambong Province, Cambodia, an area known for its good quality rice products. He is a farmer who grows vegetables and rice for an income of about USD 3 per day. His wife is a farmer, too, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family's expenses.  

L. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a motorbike to transport his agricultural products to sell at the market. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to expand his current business.  This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: United Tamemsu Group

texts.en: Lucy J. (left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Lucy was born in Kabala town about 35 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has two children, both of whom are attending primary school. For 10 years now, Lucy has been selling toothpaste, soap, milk, biscuits, etc. This is the first loan that Lucy and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Lucy will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business. She will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy toothpaste, soap, milk, biscuits, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Sonia Graciela

texts.es:
Sonia de 28 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil, tiene una hija de 5 años, su esposo es conductor, ella tiene una pequeña peluquería empezó el negocio haciendo peinados a sus vecinos y amigas para solventar sus gastos.

Poco a poco fue incrementando su capital de trabaja, y por su esfuerzo y dedicación pudo construir mejor su casa y poner la peluquería en la parte delantera de su casa, trabaja desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h30pm todos los días, hace cortes de cabellos, tinturado, alisados con creatina etc. Con el préstamo quiere comprar tintes, shampoo y cosméticos para su negocio.  

En el futuro quiere expandir mas su negocio, y tener mas peluquerías.
texts.en:
Sonia is 28 years old and lives in the suburban area of Guayaquil. She has a five-year-old daughter, and her husband is a driver. She has a small hair salon, which she started by offering haircuts to her neighbors and friends to fund her expenses. Little by little she increased her capital, and, because of her strength and dedication, she was able to improve her house and move her hair salon to the front of her house. She works from 8 in the morning until 7:30 in the evening every day. She does haircuts for men, hair dyeing, chemical straightening, etc. With the loan, she wants to buy dyes, shampoo and cosmetics for her business. In the future, she wants to expand her business more and have more hair salons.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Dyes and shampoo

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
la señora Silvia P. tiene de 35 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Romulo Meza quien se dedica a la albañileria, tienen una hija que depende de ellos,  su hija esta en la escuela.
el Negocio de Silvia es una pulperia la cual opera bajo el nombre de Nicol. Silvia se a dedicado al comercio desde hace varios años,  vende sandalias, ropa, abarroteria y pescado.
Silvia es una mujer muy luchadora y dinamica.
el credito lo utilizara para surtir un nuevo local que adquirio en la zona del comercio en coyolito.
su meta es que el negocio que va emprender sea muy exitoso.
texts.en:
Silvia is 35 years of age and lives in a free union with Romulo who is a brick layer. They have a daughter who depends on them and is still in school. Silvia's business is a general store she operates under the name of Nicol. She has been dedicated to commerce for various years, primarily selling sandals, clothing, groceries and fish. Silvia is a very determined and dynamic woman. She will use her loan to supply a new store she has acquired in the commercial zone of Coyolito. Her goal is that the business she is about to launch should be very successful.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING MERCHANDISE, MAINLY GROCERIES, TO STOCK HER NEW STORE

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of West Poblacion in Kalilangan Bukidnon. She is 53 years old and married. To make a living, Elsie sells floor wax and has been doing so for over 3 years, earning about 8,000 PHP a month.  In 2009, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to  purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Elsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Margaret Alila

texts.en:
Margaret Alila A., 60 years old, is a widow with 7 children. The family lives in Oruba estate in Migori town. Some of Margaret's children are married and only one is still in school.

Margaret sells cereals at Onyinjo market. She has been in this business for the past 30 years. Her clients consist mainly of people who come to the market to shop. Margaret was introduced to Kadet Ltd. by some clients after she saw how they were benefiting from the loans they were receiving. This is Margaret's second loan, having completing the first one without problem. Her main hope and dream is to expand her business and her capital base.

loans.use: to buy more cereals to add to her stock

loans.name: Epecinia

texts.en:
Epecinia G. is a 61-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: oyster and farming businesses. She lives in Sitio Tinago, Bgry. Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her oyster and farming businesses, she is making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of PHP12,000. 

Epecinia is borrowing PHP 12,000 to purchase a fishnet for her oyster business.  This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000, which she paid off well within its term, was another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Epecinia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the Dungganon way. 

------------------------------------------
About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishnet for oyster farming

loans.name: Alba Lina

texts.es: La señora Alba Lina tiene 42 años, cuenta con una tienda de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños en su casa de habitación. Su negocio que inicio con fondos propios, con las ganancias de la tienda le ayuda a cubrir los gastos de la casa y los gastos de universitarios de su hija,  Lo que le agrada de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo para atender a su familia, además de ser un trabajo independiente y rentable, razón por el cual tiene deseos de incrementar la cantidad de productos que ofrece. Con este financiamiento espera establecer mejor su tienda o negocio para que le siga generando las ganancias que necesita. El negocio tiene más de 16 años de tenerlo, por lo que necesita del crédito para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señora Alba Lina is 42 years old. She has a shop, located in her home, where she sells clothes for ladies, gentlemen and children. She started her business using her own funds, and uses the earnings from the shop to cover the costs of running her household and of sending her daughter to university. What she likes about her work, apart from it being an independent and profitable line of work, is that she is able to manage her own time and be with her family. For these reasons, Alba Lina wishes to increase the number of products she offers. With this loan, she hopes to make her shop better established so that she can go on generating the income she needs. The business is already 16 years old, and with the loan, Alba Lina will be able to better meet her customers' needs.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Urbania

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PROSPERIDAD”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Urbania;  La socia tiene 48 años de edad;  ella es natural de Anta y tiene 1 hijo, La socia alterna sus actividades con la administración de su restaurante, ella tiene un restaurante y necesita el dinero para capital de trabajo e implementar su negocio y comprar menajería.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de  mercadería para su negocio. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Urbania is a member of the Communal Bank “Prosperidad” (Prosperity), which is located in the District of Huanchac, Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old and has one child. Urbania is a native of Anta. She divides her time between her activities and managing her restaurant. The loan she is requesting will be used as working capital to keep her business in operation. She plans to buy equipment and supplies for her restaurant.

Urbania appreciates and values the loan that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase equipment & supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine N. is 36 years old. She is single and has 10 dependants. Her business is located at Mwingi in a very busy market and is served by the Thika Branch. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. She sells charcoal in the residential area, a business she has done for the last 10 years. She says that this business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints, not being able to buy her products at wholesale. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 10,000 to buy more charcoal to expand her business and be able to serve more customers. In the future, she hopes to grow her business and be able to buy at wholesale. She also hopes to give her children a good education. She describes herself as hardworking, innovative, patient and quiet.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mr. S. was born in 1982 and is a resident of Kompong Chhnang province, where he constructed a workshop to operate a vehicle repairing service for a profit. He is married to Mrs. Sreysros, and they have given birth to a young child who is enrolled in the primary school. S.’s wife is a grocery seller who sells cooking ingredients, soft drinks, and some sweets to people who are their nearby villagers. 

S. said that his house is getting old and has broken often, and it has been affecting the family's living conditions. Because of this, S. decided to take out a loan to replace the broken part of his old house.

loans.use: To replace the broken part of his old house.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer J. owns an olive wood workshop where he and his two sons produce wooden crafts such as crosses, rosaries, statues, etc. The workshop is located next to Sameer's house. He wants to buy a large amount of olive wood in order to double production and increase the return preparing for the Christmas season.

Sameer's sons are married and the workshop is the source of income for the three families as well as other employees.

Sameer is showing samples of their product in the picture here.

loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and a brother).   

 Rose has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  Rose sells her products at the market, both wholesale and retail.    Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal.     She also generates additional income through part-time teaching.

 The main business challenges for Rose include transportation and the rainy season.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only and also to educate her children up to university.   Rose lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying utility bills, feeding the family, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Saeeda's Group

texts.en:
Saeeda lives in the historic city of Pakistan called Lahore.  Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture.  She lives there in a three room brick house with her family in the area named Green town which is a housing colony.  She moved here after her marriage with G. R. 26 years ago. 

She is a 53 year old lady, mother of a son.  He is twenty-five years old, named Dilshaad who operates a construction supply sales business.  He couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial condition of his parents.  He started this business few years ago and is getting a good income from it. 

Saeeda herself bears the financial burden with her family by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from wholesale markets named “Ichra and Shahalmi” and sells it to her local area clients for a good profit.
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes sales business. With the loan, she will buy clothes of different varieties in bulk quantity that will help her make more sales by offering more variety to her clients.  She is very hopeful that this loan investment will have a positive impact on her business and her monthly income will increase. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Saeeda.

loans.use: To buy clothes of different variety for cloth selling business.

loans.name: Esy

texts.es:
Esy es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Lambayeque, una ciudad ubicada a veinte minutos de Chiclayo y que cuenta con bastante movimiento comercial.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos por catálogo. Trabaja en base a pedidos y sus clientes son sus vecinos y conocidos, siempre está a la búsqueda de nuevos clientes ya que mientras más pedidos coloque, más ganancias obtiene por parte de la compañía que le abastece de productos. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a solventar la economía de su familia.

Esy desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda contar con un inventario estable que le permita satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes cuando ellos lo necesiten sin tener que esperar a fin de mes, que es cuando llega el pedido, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Esy is a 30 year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in a marginal urban area of the city of Lambayeque, a city which is located 20 minutes from Chiclayo and has quite a lot of commercial activity.

Esy sells cosmetics through a catalog.  Her customers, who are her neighbors and acquaintances, place orders with her.  She is always on the look out for new customers since the more orders she places, the more profits she makes from the company who supply the products.  The income which she makes from this activity are used to help her husband with the family's finances.

Esy would like to expand her business by purchasing more products so that she can have a stable inventory which will allow her to satisfy her customers' demands when they want their products without having to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders arrive.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Esy is a quiet and responsible woman.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman so that she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more products

loans.name: Wilton Cristobal

texts.es:
Wilton Cristobal J. R. tiene 23 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hijos 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNIDOS VENCEREMOS, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto la America, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz fréjol gandul. 

Wilton Cristobal  se dedica de manera especial al cultivo de maíz, arroz y fréjol. Los productos lo comprar en Comercial López  y en Agripac en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado de Ventanas y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca y un carro.

Le gusta bailar y escuchar musicar música.
texts.en:
Wilton Cristobal J. R. is 23 years old.  His is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton in Los Ríos Province.  He has no children. 

He is a member of the UNIDOS VENCEREMOS farm co-op, located in an area called America which belongs to the Ventanas Canton. This co-op grows short-cycle crops such as corn, rice and beans.

Wilton Cristobal specializes in growing corn, rice and beans. He buys products from Comercial López and Agripac in Ventanas, then sells them at the Ventanas market.

He is requesting a loan to buy farm equipment and fertilizer for his crops. The loan will help him purchase items to combat plagues, disease and climate change. He dreams of buying a farm and a car one day.

He enjoys dancing and listening to music.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Mbuzi Twekambe Women's Group

texts.en:
Florence is a 24-year-old, enterprising married woman with a child living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She desires to build a permanent home for the family. 

For two years, she has been working in retail, enabling her to provide basics for the family. Florence needs the loan to regenerate her banana plantation. She is a member of Mbuzi Twekambe Farmers Group.

loans.use: regenerating her banana plantation

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T. is from the village of D'Ban, Calamba. She is 51 years old, married and blessed with five children. 

Anita is engaged in running a grocery store, selling basic household items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns a monthly net income of 2,500 PHP.

In 2008, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Anita is requesting her first loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business.  

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her grocery store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive en casa propia en la zona Villa Nuevo Potosí, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y tiene un hijo menor de edad, la señora realiza trabajos de cocinera para eventos particulares,  con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen.
El crédito será utilizado para la construcción, refacción de las gradas de su casa en dos tramos. 
Es la primera vez que presenta una solicitud de créditos.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home in Villa Nuevo Potosí neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  She is single and has one dependent child.  Maria works as a cook, preparing food for private events.  She uses her income to support herself and her child.  She will use this loan to build and remodel her house steps in two flights.

This is the first time that Maria has requested a loan.  The socio-economic analysis we have carried out qualifies her to receive a loan.

loans.use: To build and remodel her house steps

loans.name: Maridilia

texts.es: Maridilia es madre luchadora tiene 3 hijos y son independientes. La señora tiene como actividad una pulpería, que está ubicada en su vivienda. Por lo que es aquí donde comenzó a vender poco a poco para aumentar su inventario. Ella tiene 5 años con este negocio, por lo que siempre ha luchado para salir adelante con sus hijos a pesar de los difíciles problemas que han enfrentado pues a sus hijos le ofrecerle todo lo necesario. Ella está muy feliz con el trabajo que realiza pues sin él no tendría lo necesario para  comer todos los días.  El mayor  sueño es ampliar su negocio para que sea parte de la competencia. Este crédito es para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, galletas pan entre otros.
texts.en: Maridilia is a tenacious woman who has 3 children who are independent.  She has a grocery store that is located in her home.  This is where she started out selling, and gradually increased her inventory.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She has always struggled to provide for her children in spite of the difficulties they have faced, so that she can provide them with everything that they need.  She is very happy with the work that she does, because without it she would not have the means to eat every day.  Her main dream is to expand her business so that she can keep up with the competition.  This loan is to buy staple grains, candies, soft drinks, cookies, bread and other grocery items.

loans.use: working capital to buy groceries

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man who owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

Salim has operated an electronics repair business for the past three years, going from door-to-door repairing electronic sockets. He hopes to establish a wholesale shop in the future. Salim plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase electronic appliances. He decided to work with Yehu because of its simple training.

loans.use: to purchase electronic appliances

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es: Clementina  de 35 años de edad soltera, labora para ALcaldia de Juigalpa como operario de limpieza desde hace 1 año. Esta solicitando su 1er credito con el objetivo construir el muro de retencion para la parte trasera de su casa y ademas cambiar el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y de esta manera brindar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Clementina, 35, is single and has been employed for the last year by Juigalpa City Hall as a Cleaning Lady.  She is asking for her first loan to build a retention wall in the rear of her house and also to replace the roof which is in poor condition thus providing her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: El cliente Daniel K. S. de 67 años de edad vive junto a su esposa. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio Santa Dominguita. El cliente se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su negocio y además realiza labor de campo en sus horas libres. Su esposa tambien se dedica a vender en el negocio. El cliente nos comenta que su sueño es incrementar su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida. El está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado a travéz de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Daniel K. S., 67, lives with his wife.  He owns his house which is located in Santa Dominguita.  He has a grocery store that he’s managed to have thanks to his efforts and using his savings.  His wife also sells at the store.  He also works as a field hand in his free time.

According to the client, his dream is to increase his business in order to have a better quality of life.  He is very grateful for whatever help we can provide through this financing.

loans.use: to increase the purchase of foodstuffs for his store

loans.name: Morita

texts.en:
Morita is 50 years old and married with 8 children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Morita is borrowing 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell.

Morita has been raising livestock for 30 years and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to sell

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha A. es socia del banco comunal El Crédito, vive por la parroquia de Baños, esta parroquia es muy visitada por las fuentes de aguas termales que le han permitido a los habitantes de la zona crear piscinas para la distracción de propios y extranjeros, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente es muy amable, cordial y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Martha tiene 27 años, es casada y ha concebido 2 hijos, uno de 3 años y un bebé de 3 meses.  Su esposo labora en un taller de latonería (arreglo de latas de los vehículos), con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora Martha es de profesión estilista, ha estudiado por 3 años en una academia y ahora tiene un salón de belleza, labora de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. También es profesora de belleza y dicta clases 3 días a la semana.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 1 año y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos como tintes de cabello, permanentes, esmaltes de uñas, etc. para su gabinete.
 
Su meta es tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha A. is a member of the El Crédito (Loan) Community Bank. This region is a popular tourist location because of its thermal pools that have allowed for the inhabitants to make private and public pools. It has a wide variety of foods, and the people are very kind, polite, and maintain their culture and traditions.

Mrs. Martha is 27 years old, married, and has two sons, a three year old and a 3 month old baby. Her husband works in a body shop fixing cars. Together, they have been able to work and build their own home.

Martha is a beautician. She studied for 3 years in an academy and now has a beauty salon. She works from Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am until 8:00 pm. She also teaches at beauty school three days a week. She has been a member of the community bank for one year and will use the loan to buy products such as hair dye, perms, nail polish, and more for her cabinet.

Her goal is to have a car.

loans.use: buy hair dye, perms, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase skirts, shorts, shirts, T-shirts, and shoes.

loans.name: Erminda

texts.en:
Erminda  is from the village of Baki, Aurora Zamboanga del sur. She is 63 years old, married, and has 7 grown children. To make a living, Erminda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting corn for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Erminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC, which was used to  purchase additional seeds to plant. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be Erminda’s fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family’s general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership consists mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 55 años, esta no es la primera vez que solicita créditos ya que tiene mucho tiempo de ser cliente de Fundación. Su actividad es la venta de carne, pues siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, todos los días llegan sus clientes a comprarles una gran variedad de carne. Lo que ella ofrece es lomo, pancho, hígado, posta y otros productos, es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra de una gran variedad de carnes.
texts.en:
This isn’t the first loan Mercedes, 55, has requested; she’s been a client of the Fundación for a long time.  

Her activity is meat sales since she’s always seeking ways to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Customers come by daily to buy a large variety of meat.  She stocks sirloin, brisket, liver, round steak and other meat products and this is why she’s asking for a loan to buy a large variety of meats.

loans.use: to buy meat and meat byproducts.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is a hairdresser. She sells hair extensions and creams at Abura. Araba has a junior high level of education. Her business is just 2 years old and she needs a loan of 400 to buy more hair products to use on her customers' hair. Her loan will be used to buy more hair extensions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy more hair extensions for sale.

loans.name: Nicasio Antonio

texts.es: Nicasio Antonio tiene su negocio que es una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años  que tiene esta actividad, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar de manera muy independiente. Debido a que él se había jubilado quería un ingreso estable que le proporcionara ayuda para su familia. El financiamiento que ofrece es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, pan, refrescos, papel higiénico, enlatados y sopas. Su objetivo es surtir su inventario para proporcionar a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos.
texts.en: Nicasio Antonio runs a corner shop, an activity he has been engaged in for more than 6 years, as he has always liked working independently. After having retired, he wanted to earn a regular income that would help his family. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy basic grains, detergents, bread, drinks, toilet paper, canned food and soups. His goal is to supply his inventory to offer a wide variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, detergents, bread, drinks, toilet paper, canned food and soups.

loans.name: Bwavumpologoma Women' Group-Buikwe

texts.en:
Prisca has been working assiduously to obtain a firm footing for her green fruits and vegetables sales business over the past 20 years in Lugazi. A firm footing, being that this business is seasonal and one involved in it has to compete with other green fruit and vegetable traders. 

Prisca's courage and strong-willed determination have seen her survive in this tough business. Previously this congenial and warm-hearted married mother of seven had nothing she was doing to make ends meet. She was mostly engaged in a daily trivial round involving house chores. The fact that Prisca is a farmer who grows fruits and vegetables on her farm plays to her advantage. Prisca says her husband helps her out with her business. Weekly, this business makes her sales profits totaling up to Ugandan shillings 40,000, and monthly, her profits total up to Ugandan shillings 120,000.

With this Kiva loan, she says she is going to purchase more fruits and vegetable seeds to grow on her farm.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetable seeds to grow on her farm.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en: Mila, 59 years old and single, works very hard to provide for her family. For the past eight years she has been selling nipa (palms) in the Philippines, and is now requesting a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy additional nipa to sell. In the future Mila would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her nephew to college.

loans.use: to buy additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: María Flora

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Unión y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad, lugar que cuenta con hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes trabajos.

La Señora. María tiene 25 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 9, 7, 6 y 3 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo es aserrador, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María labora en una guardería, trabaja de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En su casa se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y chanchos a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue  invitada por una vecina, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un bosque para el negocio de su esposo.
 
Su meta es  agrandar su negocio de venta de animales.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Unión y Prosperidad community bank. She lives in the Zhidmad parish, which has beautiful scenery. The people there raise animals and farm. Many of them work in the city at different jobs.

María is 25 years old, married and has four children from this marriage, aged 9, 7, 6 and 3 years old. Her three oldest children go to a local elementary school. Her husband works in a lumberyard and the house they live in is their property.

María works in a daycare. She works Monday through Friday from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon. At home she raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs which she sell sin the community.  
 
This is the first loan she has taken out in the community bank she was invited to join by her neighbor. She will invest the loan in buying a woodlot for her husband's business.
 
Her goal is to grow her animal selling business.

loans.use: to buy a woodlot.

loans.name: Chernor

texts.en:
This is 31 year-old Chernor.  He is married and has 1 child, aged 2 years.  In 2007, Chernor established his cosmetics, drinks and water business. He began his business after he had managed his father's tailoring business.  He did that for 4 years.  Because he wanted to live an independent life, he opened up his own business.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business.

 He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,500,000.  Chernor needs a loan in order to buy drinks, pure water and cosmetics for his business.  In the future, Chernor plans to expand his business and educate his wife and son.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy drinks, pure water and cosmetics for his business

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr:
Kayi est une femme âgée de 43 ans. elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est juriste. Elle a 3 enfants. Kayi est une revendeuse depuis 1996, elle achète et revend à ses clients des produits d’alimentation générale dans sa boutique. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé.
Elle sollicite de WAGE son premier cycle de prêt pour acheter divers produits d’alimentation générale afin d’agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Kayi is 43 years old. She is married to a lawyer and has three children. 

Kayi started selling general food products in 1996. She runs her business out of her shop, and buys her merchandise at the Grand Market in Lomé.

She is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy various food items. Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale

loans.name: Tereza De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña Tereza  labora como docente y comercializa productos de cosmetico Avon, para lograr su estabilidad economica, como el apoyo a su familia, su esposo labora como conductor y sus cuatro hijos estudian.
Tereza ha venido mejorando su casa, con financiamiento en Afodenic, lo que para ella ha sido de gran logro al poder dar una mejor vivienda a sus hijos, pues todo esta ha altos costos y es por este medio que se avanza mas, ya que son ah plazos, pudiendo equilibrar sus gastos.
Con este nuevo prestamo sera para la construccion de pared de concreto interna para lograr mejor privacidad. Materiales a comprar bloques, arena, hierro, cemento, tablas entre otros materiales para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Doña Tereza works as a teacher and sells Avon cosmetic products to stabilize her economy and support the family.  Her husband works as a driver and her four children are in school.

Through loans from Afodenic, Tereza has been making home improvements in order to give her children a better home environment.  Since materials are expensive the loans have allowed her to pay over time and balance her expenses.

The new loan will be used to build an indoor concrete wall for more privacy.  The materials required to begin the project are blocks, sand, iron, cement and boards.

loans.use: To build a wall for more privacy.

loans.name: Chuluunbat

texts.en: Chuluunbat is 50 years old and lives with his wife and children – who are college and high school students – in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia.  He started their family business in 2002 by selling clothes and other products in the open flee market. His wife has now been selling clothes and shoes there for several years, and currently manages this business. The couple have many years of business and work experience.  Now Chuluunbat is making wooden furniture which he sells from his home.  In the future, he plans to expand his business and provide a high level of education to his children, and prepare homes for his daughters as well. He is a hardworking and proactive man who says "I want to expand my business and increase my income. I also want to give a good education to my children. This is very important to me and my family." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy clothes for the family shop and wood for his own work.

loans.use: To buy clothes for the family shop and wood materials for his own work

loans.name: Monica Isabel

texts.es:
Mónica Isabel tiene 32 años vive en unión libre tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con el hijo de ocho años de edad en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC Cevallos, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Francisco, Pertenece a la Parroquia San Juan del Pueblo viejo Perteneciente a Ventanas se dedican a labores agrícolas  a la siembra de cacao.

Mónica se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao las compras y las ventas de los productos para los cultivos los compra en San Juan. Solicita el crédito para poder dar mantenimiento  a  los cultivos de cacao.

El crédito será de mucha ayuda para poder invertir en los cultivos de cacao.  A los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y las plagas.

En el tiempo libre le gusta andar en bicicleta.
texts.en:
Mónica Isabel, 32, lives in a common law relationship and has a son.  She lives with her husband and 8-year-old son in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.  She’s a member of the “Cevallos” communal bank that’s located in Recinto San Francisco that belongs to San Juan del Pueblo Viejo Parish in Ventanas.  They are cocoa bean farmers.

Mónica is a cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San Juan.  She’s asking for a loan to provide crop maintenance to her cocoa beans.  The loan will be of much use to her to be able to invest in her cocoa bean crops.  The challenges she faces are competition and pests.  She enjoys bicycle riding in her free time.

loans.use: to provide maintenance for her cocoa bean crops.

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee is 50 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in Ger, Mongolian yurt in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business, elder three kids live independently, and her daughter is a college student. 
She rents space to run a grocery shop. Now that winter is approaching, she wants to buy some vegetables before prices go high. She is a strong and diligent woman who says, "I struggled my life to support my children. Now that my children are old enough, it is time for me to concentrate on my business which i wanted to expand for years". She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy grocery products from Ulaanbaatar at wholesale price.

loans.use: To buy grocery products

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is 25 years old. She runs a salon to earn a living and has been in the business for three years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has grown her business and has employed one person. She hopes to have a bigger salon in five years. Tabitha wants to start a knitting and sweater-selling business. Tabitha has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy a machine for knitting sweaters.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Burmaa

texts.en: Burmaa is 20 years old and lives with her father and sister in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her father and sister help with her business. She started her business in 2009 by helping her father until earlier this year when she rented her own counter. Her business is going well since her family is very supportive. Now that winter is approaching, she needs to stock up on some supplies before prices get high, which they usually do. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who is requesting 250,000 MNT to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Amua Shg Group

texts.en:
Gladys is the facilitator of the Amua SHG group. Gladys and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Gladys and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Gladys joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Gladys had a very good maize yield, harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Gladys was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Gladys will invest in livestock rearing and hence save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Amua SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Gladys with her group members, and the person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  ”VIRGEN PURIFICADA DE TUPAC AMARU;  El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Modesta;  La socia tiene 51 años de edad, La socia es soltera, La socia tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son todos ellos independientes; La socia trabaja comprando y vendiendo fruta, la socia compra fruta en la ciudad de Cusco del mercado de abastos Vino Canchon y compra al por mayor y lleva  a vender al departamento de Puerto Maldonado; la socia compra manzanas, uva, pera,  también según la época lleva verduras y choclos a vender en camión y muchas veces al mismo monto en plena selva, la socia se queda allá cerca de 1 mes antes de volver para que no sea mucho trajín el ir y volver debido a las distancias. La socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de frutas en esta época y llevar a vender su mercadería.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Modesta, 51, is a member of the “Virgen Purificada de Tupac Amaru” communal bank located in Urcos District in Quispicanchis Province and Cusco Department.

She is single and has five children who are all independent now.  She works as a fruit merchant.  She buys fruit in the city of Cusco’s Vino Canchon foodstuffs market at wholesale and then takes it to sell in Puerto Maldonado Department.  She buys apples, grapes, pears and according to the season also takes vegetables and dehydrated potatoes by bus to sell in the jungle.  She stays there for about a month before returning to minimize the coming and going due to the distance.  She wants to invest the loan in the purchase of seasonal fruit and to take her merchandise to sell.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments according to the payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es: Maria angélica cuenta 30 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene tres hijos los cuales están estudiando José armando esta en la primaria, ana cristina en el preescolar y Elia Liliana tiene dos años de edad, ella es comerciante vende empanadas las cuales vende muy bien ya cuenta con 25 años de edad ya que ella muy niña empezó con la venta de empanadas desde niña inicio ese negocio esta trabajando mucho para sacar adelante el negocio y sus hijos ya que quiere darle una mejor educación de la que tuvo ella. Doña angélica e invertirá el préstamo en la compra de los siguientes insumos como son: harina, leche, arroz, camote, etc.
texts.en: María Angélica, 30, is a single mother of three children. Two are attending school: José Armando in elementary school, Ana Cristina in preschool and Elia Liliana who is two years old.  She is a merchant; she sells turnovers and does very well.  She has 25 years’ experience since she started out as a little girl selling turnovers.  She is working very hard to move her business and her children ahead because she wants to give them a better education than what she had.  Angélica will use the loan to buy the following ingredients: flour, milk, rice, sweet potatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia is a 56-year-old business lady; she is married to Kamuya. They are blessed with four children aged 21, 18, 16 and 12 years respectively. She has been running a green grocer store for the past three years with a monthly income of 10,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her third loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Telesia will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and open a retail shop.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits for her business

loans.name: Ramantou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Ramantou, celle qui a la main levée sur la photo est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un transporteur du nom de Salami. Le couple n’a pas d'enfant. Ramantou n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Ramantou vend de la nourriture (riz mélangé à haricot accompagné de sauce tomate) depuis une vingtaine d'années. Ramantou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Ramantou ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe, sollicitent un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter du riz, du haricot, de l'huile végétale et des condiments.

loans.name: Mwalimdogo

texts.en: Mwalimdogo, a mother with one child, is committed to teaching secondary school students about life skills and self-awareness, and does this for at least 2.5 hours per week as a Camfed Learner Guide. She visits parents in her community to raise awareness of the importance of educating their daughters. She has also opened a local business where she sells vintage African garments and ornaments. However, she faces many challenges because she often does not have enough money to buy the best items to sell. Mwalimdogo is requesting a Kiva loan to expand her business by buying more clothing to sell and to pay her rent for her store. Her goal is to open a larger shop or boutique in two years so that she can earn more profits and increase her income.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more clothes to sell and pay rent for her store.

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara is a single mother who has a six years old son. Ten years ago due to her income, Clara started to sell food in her house. Clients began to ask her for more diverse merchandise and she had to invest in different products like bread, milk, soups, etc. In a short time she had a general store in front of her house.

Clara's business is the only income for her family and, for this reason, she knows that she must have a full stock of different products and a clean store.

In order to achieve this, she is requesting a loan of US$ 750 and offers to pay this loan in 6 months. Clara needs this loan to purchase merchandise to continue supporting her son in a honest way and, with this loan, she can increase her sales and give her clients better service.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

Clara, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 6 años. Desde hacer aproximadamente 10 años por cuestiones económicas empezó a vender en su casa frituras y refrescos, los clientes empezaron a llegar y a solicitarle mas mercancía por lo que invirtió en pan, leche, sopas, etc, hasta llegar a tener una tienda bien surtida en el frente de su casa. El negocio es su única fuente de ingresos por lo que esta conciente de que siempre tiene que tenerlo bien surtido y con muy buena presentación. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US$750 a 6 meses para compra de mercancías. Su tienda le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos de una manera digna con trabajo y constancia. Con el préstamo podrá incrementar sus ventas, darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y como consecuencia obtener mayores utilidades.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Auntie Vic sells children's wear. She buys in bulk from companies and retails to her customers. She sells from house to house but she wants to open her own babies' wear shop where she can buy more goods to sell. She is seeking a loan of $800.00 to enable her open a shop.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Pauline would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Amachi

texts.en: Mrs. Amachi E. is a married woman and has five children. She is a hard-working woman and has the interest of helping the poor with her goods. Amachi has been in the fish business for 10 years. She hopes to expand her business if she receives a loan of $625.

loans.use: To buy more river fish

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos lives in his own house which is located on Final Landaeta Street, #45 in the Cota zone in the capital city of La Paz, Bolivia. He is single and works with plastic tubing for the sewer system. He distributes the material throughtout La Paz. The loan that he is applying for will be invested in increasing his capital. He was also asked to supply boxes of the same item for a customer. He has his workshop at home and works by himself.

He is a new client and his financial analysis indicates that he is able to access the loan for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Santos vive en casa propia en la Calle Final Landaeta Nº 45 de la zona de Cota huma de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltero y trabaja con tubos de plástico para el alcantarillado y reparte su material en La Paz. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar capital ya que le pidieron cajas para el mismo rubro. Tiene su taller en el mismo domicilio y trabaja solo.

Es cliente nuevo y el análisis financiero indica que puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en: I have a business designing and selling tortillas. I run this business in my home and also sell at the market in the San Miguel neighborhood of Guanacaste. I started this business 8 years ago. I have very good customers who love my tortillas because they are large and fresh. With the sales revenue I buy medicine for my arthritis. This is the only income I have, since I am a single mother. Thank you.

loans.use: Buy milk, corn, salt and lime

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario Velásquez is a woman who very much likes to get ahead to improve her family’s standard of living. To this end, she began seeking work to help her husband meet their living expenses. With time passing, and her efforts not resulting in getting hired, she started to investigate how to start her own business without the need to invest substantial funds. She began by selling natural products, later expanding her inventory to include novelties such as sandals and combs, among other things. Little by little, she began selling her goods among friends and family.

Regardless, Rosario’s struggle continues as customers demand more products and she tries to reduce the wait time between when she can purchase more items for her inventory. For this reason, Rosario is asking for a loan of $550USD to be repaid over a period of four months. With these funds, Rosario would be able to purchase additional natural products and novelty items so that her customers have more merchandise from which to choose. With your support, Rosaria will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario Velásquez es una mujer que le gusta salir adelante y sacar a su familia adelante para que ésta tenga un mejor nivel de vida. Por lo tanto comenzó a buscar trabajo para así poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Sin embargo la búsqueda fue fallida, puesto que pasaba el tiempo y nadie la contrataba. Por lo tanto comenzó a ver de qué manera ella podría iniciar un negocio sin la necesidad de invertir grandes cantidades de dinero y fue así que comenzó por vender productos naturistas y después incrementó su repertorio ofreciendo novedades como sandalias, peinetas, entre otras cosas. Poco a poco comenzó a vender entre sus familiares y amigos.

Sin embargo la lucha continúa y los clientes cada vez van pidiendo más y más cosas y tratando de reducir los tiempos de espera para que les llegue sus productos es por eso que Rosario está solicitando un crédito de US $550 para pagarlos en un plazo de 4 meses y con este dinero Rosario podrá comprar más productos naturistas y novedades para que sus clientes puedan tener de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda Rosario podrá sacar a su familia adelante.

loans.use: Purchase novelties/merchandise for customers.

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini is a 33-year-old woman, and together with her husband, H., she started a bamboo mat-making business, earning about US$ 22 per month. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 125 to expand her matting business. Since Kartini joined MBK her business is doing increasingly well. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her bamboo mat business

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
"My name is Shamim A.. I am married and the mother of three: two sons and one daughter. I live with my family in a small town, Arifwala, Pakistan. My husband wants to start a new business selling fruit on his cart and for this purpose he needs a loan. Currently, he works somewhere for very meager pay.

I would like to have a group loan and my group members are: Sakina B. who requires a loan for her son who runs a tea stall; Sabra B. whose husband runs a lumberyard; Sakina M. who wants a loan to buy her brother a donkey cart; and Shamim A. who needs a loan for their dairy store."

loans.use: Start a new business selling fruit from a cart

loans.name: Sonia Nancy

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia Nancy H. F. is a member of the Communal Bank Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Feria. She sells fruits and vegetables in the Yungay market in Ancash state.

With a prior loan of S/800 soles, she increased her merchandise and income.

With this loan of S/500 soles which will be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy apples, bananas, pineapples, mandarin oranges, oranges, and grapes.
