She is 34 years old, married with 5 children. Her husband is a driver. Both work to support their home and educate their children.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sonia Nancy H. F. , es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial” ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras ,su local esta ubicado en el mercado de Yungay del departamento de Ancash.

Con el crédito anterior de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, ha incrementado su mercadería y sus ingresos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, lo invertirá en la compra de : manzana, plátano, piña, mandarina, naranja, uva

Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente con 5 hijos su esposo es chofer, ambos se apoyan para sacar adelante su hogar y la educación de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase fruit

loans.name: Yasmina Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Yasmina B. is a very hard working lady who works out of her house in the municipality of Villanueva selling cosmetic products. She has her own place of business where she uses a glass case to place and display her products.

It is important to note that this is the only source of income that she has to maintain her home and for this reason she is seeking the help of Ceprodel to improve her financial condition and get ahead in her cosmetic sales business.

Currently she has a history of two loans with Ceprodel which she has repaid in time and according to the agreement set out by both parties.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Yasmina B. es una dama muy esforzada que labora en su casa de habitación en el municipio de Villanueva vendiendo productos cosméticos teniendo su propio establecimiento que cuenta con una vitrina de vidrio donde coloca sus productos.

Es necesario destacar que este es el único ingreso económico que percibe para mantener su hogar y por este motivo hoy en día busca apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan mejorar su situación económica y así salir adelante en el negocio de venta de cosméticos.

Actualmente su record crediticio es de dos créditos con CEPRODEL habiéndolos cancelado en tiempo y forma según lo establecido por ambas partes.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is an enterprising mother who specializes is making blankets and decorations typical of her region. Elena also operates a radio station with her children, who inspired their parents to undertake this project. It was also because of their children’s studies in systems that they were able to begin broadcasting a program called “Radio Top 40”. The program is heard throughout the town thanks to the agreements they have secured with the town government and cooperative. The station reaches far and wiD. thanks to Internet and the efforts of the 14 young people who work tirelessly to broadcast, day in and day out, the programs requested by listeners.

Elena and her family would like to establish a television station from which they will be able to report the news in their community and city. The station also will help spread the word about the community’s artisanal products.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

ELENA, es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la producción D. mantas y diversos tipos D. adornos típicos D. la zona, además D. dedicarse a esta labor, tiene una emisión radial en la cual trabaja asociada con sus hijos quienes son los que motivaron a sus padres a iniciar este gran proyecto y gracias a los estudios D. sistemas D. sus hijos es que pudieron implementar lo necesario para la trasmisión D. “La Radio TOP 40”, que es escuchada en toda su localidad gracias a los convenios que han logrado adquirir con la municipalidad y la cooperativa D. su comunidad. Esta emisora es trasmitida con gran cobertura gracias a Internet y a los 14 jóvenes quienes trabajan arduamente para trasmitir día a día los programas solicitados por los oyentes.Ahora Elena y su familia desean instalar un canal televisivo desD. donD. ellos podrán informar los acontecimientos D. su comunidad y ciudad y también servir D. mecanismo difusor D. las bondades D. sus artesanos.

loans.use: Secure a rental agreement to broadcast a TV program from her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Yao would like to buy farming hoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in used clothing for a small business.

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is the wife of M. M.. She lives in the city of Borewala, Pakistan, where she owns a two room brick house that she has lived in for the last 30 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her two eldest sons make decorative embroidered dresses. The youngest son works in a workshop. Her husband is a milk seller and has been in this profession for the last 20 years. Irshad baji is a housewife who takes care of her children and does domestic chores. She is applying for a loan to buy more milk to expand the milk business.

Irshad baji is joined in her loan group by a few other members. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy material for her decorative embroidery business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es:
La señora Eloina es de la ciudad de Santani, tiene 62 años de edad, es viuda, con 3 hijos, y se dedica ala venta de frutas y verduras, en el mercado municipal. Trabaja en este ramo desde hace 13 años. Es una señora muy trabajadora, y muy sacrificada, ya que desde tempranas horas de la madrugada ella inicia su jornada para ir a comprar las frutas y verduras frescas para vender.

Gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado que sus hijos estudien, esto representa para ella una alegría muy grande además de ser una inspiración para seguir luchando día a día.

Durante estos años ha sabido ahorrar y tiene como proyecto comprar otro local más amplio en la misma zona, para así poder cargar más mercaderías para la venta.

En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías en cantidad de frutas de estación así como también de verduras
texts.en:
Ms. Eloina is from the city of Santani. She is 62 years old, a widow, and has three children. She sells fruits and vegetables at the city's market. She has been in this activity for the last 13 years. She is very hardworking and devoted, as she starts her day very early at dawn by going to purchase fresh fruits and vegetables, to sell later.

This job has allowed her children to study. This is one of her biggest joys in life and an inspiration for her to keep going day after day.

During these years, she has saved money, and plans to buy another store in the area, a larger one, to be able to offer more products for sale.

She is requesting a loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.


Translated from Spanish by Gabriela Urricariet, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is a wife of U. H. and lives in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historical places. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 35 years. She completed fifth grade in school. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her husband makes and sells furniture. Her first two sons help in their father's furniture-making business. Her youngest son is in seventh grade. Her daughter is in fifth grade. Her husband has been in this business for the last 25 years. He has a good reputation in his community and within the city. Najma baji is a housewife who prefers to do household work and to take care of her family. She is applying for a loan to buy material (woods and nails) for her husband's furniture making business.

There are five people in Najma’s loan group: Fozia baji wants a loan to buy wood for her furniture-making business. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell. Shabana baji wants a loan to buy scrap (iron, steel) for her scrap business. Zaib-un-Nisa baji wants a loan to buy more garments to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood and nails for her husband's furniture-making business

loans.name: Ven

texts.en: Ven S., 46, is a true entrepreneur who works selling fish in the village market and earns approximately US$6 each day. Her husband is a horse-cart driver who usually transports the goods from the farm to the market and also drives people, too. This couple together has two children and they both work as construction foremans. Ven would like to take out a loan of US$1000 to purchase a bigger horse for her husband's cart.

loans.use: Ven would like to purchase a bigger horse for her husband's cart.

loans.name: Anu

texts.en:
Mrs. Anu B. is a tailor in the village of Bhakepati, Kathmandu. She lives with her husband, son, and daughter. Both of her children are in pre-school. Her husband, Mr. Suresh B., went to Dubai for work

Mrs. B. opened her tailoring shop 6 years ago. Before starting her own business, Mrs. B. took a 3- month training course from a tailor shop near her home. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses, like the Kurta Sulwar, which is very popular among Nepali women.

She plans to use the loan of Rs 10000.00 ($150.00) to buy tailoring materials for her business. She wants to use the shop's income to improve her family's standard of living and for her children's education.

loans.use: Buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Khet

texts.en: Khet S., 48, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her four children. She works as a farmer and is typically able to make $1.30 each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have created a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, as food prices have also been high. Khet's husband works as a carpenter and typically makes $1.40 every day. Two of her children are married and no longer live at home, while one is a student and another is a tailor. She has seen an opportunity to expand her children's business and wants to take out a loan to make a few purchases. She is asking for $700 to purchase cloth for her child to make clothes. She feels that this new aspect of her child’s business will allow her to increase her income and to raise the standard of living for the whole family.

loans.use: To purchase cloth

loans.name: Jean Claude

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean Claude H. in Rwamagana, in the Eastern province of Rwanda! Jean Claude is 31 years old.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop where he sells various items like men's and women's clothes and men's and women's shoes. Besides the business, he also grows green peas, sorghum, and beans that he later sells in local markets to increase his income.

He is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws to increase his stock by buying more clothes and shoes. This loan would be repaid over 6 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Increase his stock of clothing for sale

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier O. G. tiene la edad de 49 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa y hijos. La esposa de don Francisco trabaja para ayudarle con los gastos del hogar, al igual que sus hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es lograr mejorar sus cultivos para obtener mejor ganancia. El se siento muy contento ya que a trabajado con AFODENIC durante nueve ciclo y a logrado establecer 4 ½ mz de piña. Este financiamiento que solicita es para aplicarle a sus cultivos los fertilizantes necesarios que se le han recomendado, para obtener una producción buena y poder vender a buen precio en el mercado, así como mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier O. G. is 49 years old and he lives in the county of Ticuantepe with his wife and kids. His wife works to help out with the household costs, as do his kids. Their plan for the future is to have better crops which will earn more money. He is very happy to be working with Afodenic through this new harvest and has been able to get 4.5 acres of pineapple. The loan he would like is to apply the necessary and recommeneded fertilizer to his crops to get a better product and to be able to sell it for a better price in the market, as well as improving his crop.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and products for cultivation/Comprar fertilizante y insumos para el cultivo

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Грезова Мархабо проживает в районе Варзоб. Замужем и имеет двоих детей. Возраст 33 года. Имеет высшее образование . По профессии врач-гинеколог. Планирует получить кредит для покупки гинекологического кресла. Это даст возможность создать условия для работы в поликлинике. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Marhabo G. lives in Varzob. She is 33 years old and is married with two children. She has a university diploma in Obstetrics and Gynaecology. She would like to get a loan for buying a gynecological examination chair. This would improve working conditions at the polyclinic. Marhabo would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase a gynecological examination chair

loans.name: Salijon

texts.en:
A. Salijon is 28 years old. He lives in B.Gafurov region and works, like many rural residents, in the livestock business. Salijon is married and his young wife helps him take care of the animals. Salijon also works as
the stock keeper on the collective farm. He is young but he is skilled in livestock. Salijon has been engaged in livestock for six years and has the appropriate knowledge. Salijon wants to buy six rams to make and sell yarn in the future. He is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of 1600 TJS for 6 months. Salijon thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best.

loans.use: To buy six rams

loans.name: Noura

texts.en: Noura is a 47-year-old woman, living in Shwaifat in Mount Lebanon. She started as a home based tailor five years ago and in 2007 she opened her first shop in her home village. Today, Noura is requesting to borrow $1,100 in order for her to buy new sewing machines to increase her output. She hopes to use her profits to expand her business and continue her growing success.

loans.use: To purchase new sewing machines

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua Appiah-Tuah is 52 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all sons who have completed senior high school and are currently working. Her husband is a farmer. Akosua lives with the husband and the children in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Achiase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Akosua is a trader. She trades in footwear. She sells all sorts of footwear for both males and females. Akosua hawks to sell her goods in her community. She procures the footwear from Accra. She has been in business for two years and desires to expand her business. Akosua says she is also in the palm-oil production business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Kiều's Group

texts.en:
T. Kiều Thị (20206030012) is a 60-year-old woman living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the group leader of a 5-member group loan who are clients of DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Yên Hậu 10 (10).

T. is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock. While not her only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. T. has been engaged in this business for over 8 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 IDR a month from these activities.

T. joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 5,152,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. The loan will be the 1st loan taken out by T. from DINARI. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206030013) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

2. Nguyễn Thị Quyết (20206030014) is a 47-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,808,000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

3. Lưu Thị D. (20206030015) is a 49-year-old woman who is requesting a 3,808,000 IDR loan to support her business in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.

4. Chu Thị Hà (20206030016) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 IDR loan to support her business in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

T. Kiều Thị (20206030012) là 60 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở T. phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các T. viên. Mặc dù mỗi T. viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T. viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Yên Hậu 10 (10).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 IDR. T. đã tham gia DINARI để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. 0 Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 IDR.

Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ DINARI.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1. Nguyễn Thị T. (20206030013) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2. Nguyễn Thị Quyết (20206030014) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.808.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3. Lưu Thị D. (20206030015) là 49 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.808.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4. Chu Thị Hà (20206030016) là 29 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 IDR. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.

Về DINARI:

Nhiệm vụ của DINARI là cố gắng giữ giàn một môi trường cho phép người nghèo và tạo cơ hội phát triển kinh tế xã hội cho những chủ doanh nghiệp nhỏ.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva."

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Munavara

texts.ru: Пирова Мунавара проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 22 года. Замужем, имеет 1 ребенка. Муж находится на заработках в России. Мунавара более 2 лет работала колхозницей. Вот уже более 2 лет занимается выращиванием овощей. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы закупить удобрения и семена для посева овощей. И в дальнейшем для продажи.
texts.en:
Munavara P. lives in the Yavan district. She is 22 years old, married, and has one child. Her husband is working in Russia. Munavara has been working on a collective farm for more than two years, and for more than two years she has been growing vegetables. She is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and vegetable seeds. And for sales in the future.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer purchase

loans.name: Marufakhon

texts.en:
Marufakhon O. is 51 years old. She is married with 4 children. She started her own business 6 years ago because her husband’s salary wasn’t enough for their family expenses. Marufakhon, together with the help of her son (pictured), sells confectionery like candies, cookies, and pastries in the local market. The generated income allows Marufakhon to support her family. She dreams of educating all of her children with a higher education. Today, she is requesting 6000 Somoni that she will use to purchase confectionery for expanding the range of goods. The income she will receive will be spent on the well being of her family, as well as for her children's education.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase confectioneries to expand the range of goods.

loans.name: Kokoè

texts.fr:
Cette dame s’est lancée en 2006 dans le commerce de vêtements, elle vend des articles de mercerie  elle a associé à cette activité le commerce des chemises et des cravates.Ce commerce marche bien pour elle, des employés de bureau viennent acheter les chemises et cravates chez elle, elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossîtes qui font l’importation des vêtements. Elle veut acheter de nouvelles gammes de chemises, cravates et quelques articles de mercerie, elle sollicite alors un crédit pour acheter 15 chemises, 50 cravates, 10 boubous pour homme et divers articles de mercerie.
Elle est mariée et mère d’01 enfant.
texts.en:
This is a woman who got started in the commerce of clothing in 2006. She sells sewing supplies. She has included with this business the sale of dress shirts and ties. This commerce is going well for her. Office employees come and buy shirts and ties from her. She acquires her supplies from wholesalers, who import clothing. She wants to buy new assortments of shirts, ties, and some sewing items. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy 15 shirts, 50 ties, 10 boubous (long, flowing outfits) for men, and various sewing supplies. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies and shirts

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida G. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 40 years old. Aida is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Aida raises and sells pigs. Aida is just starting this business.

In 2008, Aida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Aida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Aida's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions .

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Faaoo

texts.en:
Faaoo T. is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Saanapu Uta.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children.  To make a living, Faaoo raises raises, harvests, and sells bananas.  Faaoo has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 400 Samoan tala (or about $160) a month from these activities.

In 2004, Faaoo joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Faaoo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2200 tala (or about $900) from SPBD.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  Faaoo is now requesting a new loan of 1500 tala (or about $575) which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be Faaoo's fifth.  Faaoo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her farming activites.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
El señor Luis Miguel R. y su esposa la señora Dazally Corina Gutiérrez son un matrimonio joven que tiene dos hijos pequeños, a quienes les quieren dar lo mejor.
Están solicitando un crédito para poder pagar la inscripción, comprar los uniformes y útiles escolares, de su hijo para que pueda ingresar ha la escuela, ya que en esté momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder pagar está necesidad de su hijo.
Don Luis Miguel trabaja como mensajero de una compañía y su esposa como vendedora de una casa de empeño. Son los ingresos y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo.
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son la señora Dazally Corina y su hijo, ya que cuando se realizo la visita el señor Luis estaba en horario de trabajo.

loans.use: Pago de Inscripción, comprar uniformes y útiles escolares

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela vive en el manzano “O”  de la zona Rio Seco   de la ciudad de El Alto.

Vive junto a su madre y sus dos hijas, ya que por circunstancias de la vida tuvo que separarse de su esposo.

Graciela es una persona muy activa, ya que trabaja como profesora de nivel primario en el turno de la mañana, el resto del día lo dedica a la confección de buzos deportivos trabajo que lo realiza con la colaboración de su madre y su hija.


El crédito lo destinará  como capital de trabajo, en la adquisición de materia prima (telas para buzos)  y así aumentar su producción. 
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro  la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Graciela lives in section “O” of the Rio Seco district in the city of El Alto. She lives with her mother and her two daughters. Due to life’s circumstances, she had to separate from her husband.

Graciela is a very active person. She works in the morning as an elementary school teacher. For the remainder of the day, she manufactures sportswear along with her mother and daughter.

This loan will be used as working capital to purchase materials for making sportswear, thereby increasing her production.

This is Graciela’s first loan with IMPRO. Her evaluation indicates she is qualified to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, and elastic for making sportswear

loans.name: Vergelita

texts.en: Vergelita L., a resident of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato, tills her 1-hectare rice farm for a living. She is 42 years old, married and has two children. A member of CEVI since 2007, she thinks its program is very helpful to her and her fellow farmers, noting the lower interest rate offered. Now she is asking for a loan of Php13,000. The loan will be used to finance Vergelita’s farm.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen P. is married and has four children. He has been through junior high school.  Stephen sells electrical appliances and spare parts and is also an electronic repairer at Elmina, which he has been doing since 2002. His wife is a trader.  Steen uses his income to pay school fees and settle other bills.  Stephen will use the loan to purchase electrical appliances and parts to sell. With the new profits from his expanded business, Stephen plans to save and build his own house.

loans.use: Stephen will use the loan to purchase electrical appliances and parts to sell.

loans.name: Juana Aurora

texts.es: Juana Aurora tiene 47 años, no pudo obtener la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios, pero sabe leer y escribir. Ella tiene 4 hijos a su cargo y con mucho esfuerzo han salido adelante. El negocio al que ella se dedica es una pulpería. Inicio hace más de 4 años, por lo que el salario que ella ganaba no era lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos diarios en su hogar y con sus hijos y fue así que ella lucho por salir adelante con esta actividad. El sueño de Juana es lograr ampliar su negocio cada día hasta convertirse en una mini distribuidora. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo e invertirlo en golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Juana Aurora is 47 years old. She did not have the opportunity to finish her studies, but knows how to read and write. She has 4 children in her care and has made a great effort to get ahead. The business that she runs is a neighborhood store, which she started more than 4 years ago. The salary she earned was not sufficient to cover the daily household expenses or support the children so she was struggling to get ahead with this business. Juana’s dream is to expand the business and become a mini-distributor. The loan that she is asking for is for working capital to invest in sweets, bread, natural juices, and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa M. lives in the village of Brgy Vito, Sagay, Negros Occidental. She is 46 years old, and married to Renato M. who is a fisherman and the father of her two children. The children are 10 and 12 years old, and both are attending school. Teresa dreams of uplifting their living and being  able to send their two children to school and get a college degree so that they will have better opportunities for a more comfortable life.

From the time she got married, Teresa was the one who sold his catch to members of their community and sometimes even in the public market. Sometimes they get lucky and the customers are the ones who approach them to buy her husband's catch of the day. Teresa and her husband own their fishing boat, but in 1997, they needed money to do some major repair to their boat. This motivated her to join NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could access the necessary capital to fund their fishing operations. As she paid off each loan, she was able to borrow more funds to further improve their fishing business, buying new nets and other fishing gear. Now she is able to earn a net profit of PHP 10,000 per month from their fishing operations. She saves most of her profits for the education of her family, taking out only the most necessary funds to support their household expenses.

In her previous loan, she borrowed Php 19,500 that she used as additional capital or revolving working fund for her fishing business. The loan was fully paid within her loan term without any delays in any of the weekly installments. Now for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing the same amount of Php 19,500 to be used for the repair of her fishing boat. She intends to use the income from it for the education of her children.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To repair their fishing boat

loans.name: Iliana Lisseth

texts.es: Iliana Lisseth T. G. de 23 años de edad, reside en Sensuntepeque en el departamento de Cabañas, vive junto a sus dos hijos de ocho y cinco años, su esposo reside en Los Estados Unidos. Ella posee una tienda de productos perecederos, la cual con muchos esfuerzos ha logrado sacar adelante. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar productos como pan, leche y jugos, productos los cuales son más solicitados y generan mayores ganancias. A pesar que su esposo reside en Los Estados Unidos, Iliana recibe pocas remesas, es por esto que debe trabajar mucho para poder mantener a flote su negocio.
texts.en:
Iliana Lisseth T. G. is 23 years old, and lives in Sensuntepeque, in the Cabañas State. She lives with her 2 sons of eight and five years old. Her husband lives in the United States. She owns a store of perishables (fresh foods), which with a great deal of effort, she has managed to get ahead. She is asking for a loan to enable her to buy products like bread, milk, juices, and products which are in high demand and generate the most earnings. In spite of that fact that her husband lives in the USA, Iliana receives only a little income, and for that reason she works a lot to be able to keep her business afloat.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase food and products

loans.name: Julia Magaly

texts.es:
La señora JULIA MAGALY B. M. tiene 40 años, vive en el distrito De La Esperanza , provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad – Perú y pertenece al Banco Comunal NUEVA ESPERANZA. 
La socia presenta estudios secundarios completos, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de los cuales 2  dependen económicamente de ella porque se encuentran en edad escolar. 
Julia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos como: talcos, cremas, perfumes, colonias, labiales, delineadores, rimer, etc. y con su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles comprò productos como: labiales, colonias, perfumes, desodorantes, shampoos los cuales se encontraban en oferta, por tal pudo aumentar su stock y vender con màs frecuencia.
En la actualidad solicitarà un crédito de 2,300.00 nuevos soles con los que comprará màs cosméticos como: labiales, cremas, perfumes, desodorante, etc. 
Ella sueña con alquilar un stand en un centro comercial para así aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Ms. JULIA MAGALY B. M. is 40 years old and she lives in the De La Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department- Perú. She belongs to the Community Bank NUEVA ESPERANZA. The member completed her secondary education; she has a live-in partner and 3 children, 2 of which depend on her economically because they are school-aged. Julia sells cosmetics like: talcum powder, crèmes, perfumes, colognes, lipsticks, eyeliners, mascara, etc. With her first loan of 300.00 nuevos soles, she bought products like: lipstick, colognes, perfumes, deodorants, shampoo that she found on sale, so that she could increase her stock and sell more often. Now she is requesting a loan of 2,300.00 nuevos soles. With that money, she will buy more cosmetics like: lipstick, creams, perfumes, deodorants, etc. She dreams of renting a stand in a mall so she can increase her sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lauren Jackson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy  lipstick, creams, perfumes, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena S., age 58, is a farmer from South Cotabato. She tills a 2-hectare (~ 5-acre) rice field to feed her family. She is married to Loreto and has 6 children. She lacks capital to buy necessary supplies for her farm, so she has sought help from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to meet the needs of her business. 

Magdalena has requested a loan of 15,000 Php to buy fertilizer and farm supplies. With the low interest rate on this loan, it is advantageous for her to take the opportunity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Crecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo  “Crecer” esta representado por la señora Rossy y conformada por 15 miembros los cuales van cursando un ciclo mas dentro D. la institución demostrando siempre honestidad, responsabilidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.  Una gran Mayoría D. los miembros del grupo se dedican a la venta D. comidas D. toda índole como hamburguesas, platos típicos, chicharrón D. pollo y otros, los demás miembros en una minoría se dedican a la venta D. ropa, al servicio D. chaparía y al transporte público D. pasajeros. 

Del grupo son la presidenta (Rossy) y Luisa quienes se dedican a la venta D. ropa una desD. hace 2 años y la otra tiene más experiencia ya que se dedica a este grupo desD. hace 36 años atrás. Por otra parte son Adelia, Aracely, Ana Maria, Sonia, Mercedes Maria, Sarah, Maria Jesus y Teresa las que se dedican a vender comida D. diferente tipo y en variados lugares la experiencia promedio D. estas señoras es D. 7 años en el rubro. Por último tenemos a Fernando que es Chapista con 5 años en el rubro, Sandiver promotor con 4 años en el rubro, Brigida que es empleada doméstica desD. hace 5 años y el que más experiencia tiene en el grupoes Don Wilson que es chofer desD. hace 84 años. 

Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es alta pero con su entusiasmo y experiencia las socias saben como salir adelante para mejorar sus ingresos e incrementar su capital D. trabajo. El destino del financiamiento es para el incremento D. mercadería para las socias que venden ropa y cosméticos, para el resto D. los socios es para la adquisición D. materia prima como verduras, carne y otros para la elaboración D. sus comidas y los socios varones destinaran su crédito a la compra D. herramientas y a la reparación D. sus vehículos. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya trabajaron con la institución demostrando capacidad para la administración D. los fondos otorgados y las ganas D. sacar adelante a sus familias con esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
The group "Crecer" ("To Grow") is represented by Rossy and is composed of 15 members who, in their first cycle in the institution, have demonstrated honesty, responsibility, and punctuality with their payments. The majority of the group members sell food of all natures, such as hamburgers, typical plates, and chicken chicharrón; the rest of the group (the minority) sell clothes and proviD. vehicle repair and public transportation services. In the group, the president (Rossy) and Luisa both sell clothing (one has 2 years of experience, the other has 36 years of experience). Adelia, Aracely, Ana Maria, Sonia, Mercedes Maria, Sonia, Sarah, Maria Jesus and Maria sell different types of food in a variety of locations. The women have an average of 7 years of experience in this line of work. Finally, Fernando is an auto body mechanic with 5 years of experience, while Brigida has been a domestic worker for 5 years and Sandiver has been working as a promoter for the past 4 years. The most experienced group member is Don Wilson, who has been working as a driver for 84 years. Within the commercial scope the competition is high, but with their enthusiasm and experience, the members know how to stay afloat to improve their earnings and increase their working capital. The use of this loan is to increase the merchandise for the members who sell clothing and cosmetics, and for the rest of the group to acquire raw materials such as vegetables, meat, and other ingredients to make their food; the male members will use their credit to buy tools and repair their vehicles. In regards to credit experience, the members have already worked with the institution, demonstrating the capacity for management of their funds and the desire to move their families ahead with effort and work.

Translated from Spanish by Cara Gutterman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es tejedora de camas y estos productos los vende en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en la calle Ch. zona El Progreso de la ciudad de El Alto

 Tiene tres hijos los cuales todos ya son independientes y casados. 

El crédito lo destinará a la compra de lana para tejer más camas y poder mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Paula makes weavings, and she sells her products in the fairs in the city of El Alto. She lives on Che Stree in the El Progresso area of El Alto. She has three children who are all married and independent. The loan is to buy more wool to make more weavings to be able to improve her income. This is her fourth loan with IMPRO. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more wool for her weaving business

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke is a teacher and a dry cleaner. She combines these two jobs to enable her to support her family. She is married with 2 children, both of whom are excelling in school. Her youngest child is 6 years old. She hopes to expand her laundry business in the future. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 80,000 to purchase more laundry soap. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more laundry soap

loans.name: El

texts.en:
Mrs. El M., a 28-year-old married mother, lives with her husband and children in a small house located in a village near Phnom Penh. There, she earns a living selling clothes door-to-door. She and her husband awake early each morning to prepare their clothes and then deliver them by motorbike to sell, generating on average $8 each day which they use to support their family needs and especially to ensure that one of their young children is able to attend school.

In order to make more revenue, El M. is requesting a loan both to purchase a motorcycle trailer to enable her husband to begin a passenger service and to improve her clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle trailer and improve her business

loans.name: Korb

texts.en: Mr. Korb C. is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to support his family. Aside from this, he is a fisherman and his wife, Mrs. Sarun Korl, is a pig breeder in the local house. This couple has a child who is too young to go to school. Now a day, they are living in Kdei Tnaot village in Takeo Province. They have a problem because their field was ready to plow, but they did not plow. Thus, in order to improve the rice production, Mr. Korb C. decided to ask for a loan to buy two oxen to plow their field. His wife is on the left in the picture.

loans.use: To buy two oxen for plowing their field

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela O. is from the village of Dalipuga, Iligan city. She is 50 years old. Adela is married and has two adult children. Adela owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different primary goods in the local community. Adela has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Adela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Adela is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Adela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Champika

texts.en:
Champika is a 26-year-old married woman living with her husband and son in the town of Telijjawila in the Matara area of Sri Lanka.  She is a hard working woman.  Her husband cultivates crops and Champika provides support to her husband in this business. They are very close and work well together.  

Additionally, Champika sells clothes as a second business, something she has been doing for a long time. She manages this business alongside helping with the crop cultivation.

Champika has requested a 60,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her and her husband's crop cultivation business.  They plan to use the loan to help purchase agricultural equipment. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy crop cultivation equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy salchipapa (fried potato and sausage) ingredients.

loans.name: Muyurina Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Muyurina inicia su ciclo 19 con 18 socias, que son D. la comunidad D. Muyurina que se encuentra a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, es un valle pequeño y la mayoría D. sus pobladores se dedica a la agricultura D. verduras.
Raquel es la presidenta del Banco Comunal y durante el tiempo que esta en su Banco aprendió valores y ahorrar, Raquel es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos D. 8, 6 años, vive en la casa D. sus suegros y su mayor sueño es construir su casa para lo cual ya esta ahorrando en su Banco Comunal. Raquel junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura D. verduras como lechuga, culantro, para lo cual arriendan terrenos pues no tiene terreno propio, sus productos los transporta a la ciudad D. Ayacucho en donD. lo comercializa al por mayor en el mercado D. abastos. Además Raquel cría animales como gallina, cerdo que venD. en su misma comunidad. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. abono y semilla.
texts.en:
The communal bank Muyurina begins its 19 cycle with 18 members from the community of Muyurina, located about 20 minutes outsiD. of Ayacucho. Muyurina sits in a small valley and most of its residents work growing vegetables. Raquel is now the president of the communal bank, and during her time with the bank she's learned about values and saving. Raquel is 34 years old, and married with 2 children ages 6 and 8. They live in the home of her inlaws. Raquel's dream is be able to construct their own home, which is why she is saving with the communal bank. Together with her husband, Raquel works cultivating lettuce and cilantro, though they do not have their own land. Their products are then transported to the city of Ayacucho where they are sold wholesale in the market. Raquel also raises animals such as hens and pigs, which she sells in the community. Her loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: La Almendra Group

texts.es:
El grupo “LA ALMENDRA”  nombrado así por que enfrente de sus casas hay una planta de Almendra. Es integrado por 2 mujeres y 2 hombres. Los representa doña Martha Alicia Méndez D. tiene 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de comida, refrescos, bisutería realizando sus pedidos en la ciudad de Nacajuca, para vender en el parque principal del mismo municipio. Doña Norma tiene 2 hijos, tiene su venta de refrescos. Don Jesús Lázaro Álvarez se dedica a la mudanza y fletes para esto tiene su camioneta para realizar su actividad y Jesús Lázaro Pérez se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.   

Doña Marthita como así la conocen, comprara más refrescos como coca cola, Fanta, jumex,  agua, Chivacola, sabritas, mamut, además vende comida en su domicilio, bisutería, trabaja también por las mañanas de cocinera, sueña con tener un puesto de comida y  que sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Son muy trabajadores y sus actividades son diferentes, es un grupo solidario y se conocen desde hace años y todos son vecinos.  

Agradecen el apoyo que le brinda la Fundación y KIVA por darles la oportunidad de ser  clientes que se suman a la lista de ser  apoyados mediante un crédito para poder realizar sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The “Almendra” (Almond) Group is aptly named because the members have almond trees in front of their houses. Two women and two men make up this group. Doña Martha Alicia Méndez D. has two children. She sells food, soft drinks, and jewelry by order in the city of Nacajuca, primarily from the main municipal park. Doña Norma has two children and sells soft drinks. Don Jesús Lázaro Álvarez has a moving business and owns a truck for hauling cargo. Jesús Lázaro Pérez buys and sells cattle.

Doña Marthita, as she is known, plans to buy more refreshments such as Coca-Cola, Fanta, Jumex, water, Chiva Cola, Sabritas (a brand of snack food), and Mamut (a brand name of marshmallow chocolate cookie). She also sells food and jewelry out of her home. In the mornings she works as a cook, but she dreams of having her own food stand and seeing her children study for a college degree.

Despite engaging in different business activities, they are a close-knit group of hard workers who have known each other for years and are neighbors. They are grateful for the support provided by Fundación Realidad and Kiva and for having the opportunity to be among the list of clients who have received the help of a loan to maintain their small businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks & snack foods

loans.name: Lurn

texts.en: Mrs. Lurn S. is 33 years old and is a villager who lives in Knhaok Pong village, Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Seiha Heng, are white wine makers who are able to earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. Aside from being a white wine maker, Mrs. Lurn S. also sells Khmer cheese in the local market. In order to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Lurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding. This couple has three children; one is attending in the local school while the others are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

loans.name: Naidanjav

texts.en:
Naidanjav C. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter in their own house in Arhangai province, central Mongolia. Her husband is retired and her daughter is a student. Naidanjav manages a business selling satellite antennas in her town.

Naidanjav began a clothes selling business in 2000 with working capital of 700,000 MNT and gained much experience. Based on her many years in business, she made a contract with a local company in order to supply satellite antennas which she imports from Ereen, a border city inf China. Now her working capital has reached 3,800,000 MNT. Naidanjav is a modest, energetic and optimistic person. She says, “I wish I could afford my daughter's tuition fees and create new success for my family." Naidanjav is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of satellite antennas for her business.

loans.use: To purchase satellite antennas to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita V. is a married woman who lives in Purok Isda-an, Brgy. Cartagena, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  fishing/fish vending and running a general store. Her 52-year-old husband, Jesus V., works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 8 children who are 11 to 26 years old. 

Teresita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 7 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Teresita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, thus, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to purchase fishing nets and other fishing materials so that she can continue to save up for the future and for the education of their children. Teresita V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing nets and other fishing materials

loans.name: Ana De Jesus

texts.es:
Ana reside en barrio san Carlos el transito departamento de Morazán, está casada vive con su esposo y dos hijos uno de ellos tiene 10 años y el más pequeño tiene 6 ellos dependen de los ingresos que Ana obtiene de su negocio los dos estudian.
Comenzó con el negocio gracias al apoyo de una cuñada quien le enseño a vender pupusas y le sugerio que colocara su propio negocio para mantener a sus hijos y darles el estudio, así fue como Ana inicio su negocio, empieza  la elaboración de pupusas a las tres de la tarde y termina de vender a las 9 de la noche.
El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz leña y bebidas carbonatadas y productos para hacer refrescos naturales, y más ingredientes para las pupusas.
Esto le ayudara a mejorar sus ingresos y a satisfacer las necesidades que el cliente requiere y de esta forma ella salir adelante con sus hijos dándoles mejores condiciones de vida.
Sus aspiraciones es que sus hijos estudien se gradúen y sean profesionales y ampliar su pupuseria para obtener mejores ingreso ya que la situación económica cada día es mas difícil.
texts.en:
Ana lives in the San Carlos district of the town of El Transito in the Morazan department. She is married and lives with her two sons who are 10 and 6 years old. The children go to school and are supported by the income from Ana's business. She started her business thanks to her sister-in-law who taught her how to sell "pupusas" (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese or vegetables). Ana got started when her sister-in-law suggested she should start her own business to support her sons and put them through school. She starts making "pupusas" at 3pm and is finished selling them at 9pm. WIth the loan she will purchase corn, fuelwood, sodas, products to make natural fruit juice and more ingredients for the "pupusas". This will help increase her income, meet her client's needs and move ahead in improving her children's life conditions. Her aspirations are for her children to go to school and graduate to be professionals. She also aspires to grow her "pupusa" shop to increase her income since the economic situation gets harder every day.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, fuelwood, sodas, products to make natural fruit juice

loans.name: Judy

texts.en: Judy P. is a married woman who lives in Barangay 8, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store business. Her husband, Luis P., who is 51 years old, works as a laborer and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is now 23 years old. Judy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she wished for something better for her family. With the help of her past three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, she has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 8,000 PHP, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 4th loan, Judy is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock for her general store so that she can continue to save for the education of their child and to have their house repaired. Judy is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Pegn

texts.en:
Pegn P. is 48 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are garment factory workers. They live in Takeo province. She is a farmer who works for less than $1 USD each day, while her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes $4 USD a day.

Pegn P. would like to take out a loan of $1200 USD to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting purposes

loans.name: Mwarua

texts.en:
Mwarua H. M. is a young married man. His wife stays at home to take care of the household chores. They do not have any children yet. 

Mwarua makes such things as cupboards from timber and then he sells them to the local people. He also sells timber to other carpenters within the area. His business is located at a residential area in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many, many tourist attraction sites as well as its Indian ocean white beaches. 

Mwarua says that this business is profitable. His major challenge is that there are other people in the area with the same kind of business as his, and this ends up reducing prices due to competition. This, therefore, hinders profit maximization. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

Mwarua is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (Kes) to add to his stock of timber in order to expand his business and meet the market demand. He hopes that in the future, he will open a big hardware store. He describes himself as a very aggressive businessman.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Balakhan

texts.en: Balakhan H. is 52 years old and married with one son. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as candies, cookies, preserved foods, soft drinks, juice, tea, and many other items in the grocery store he built many years ago. Today, Balakhan is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more goods to increase profit

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg is 42 years old.  She is a single mother, living with her son in Ulaanbaatar, capital of Mongolia. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent.  Her son Gantulga is 28 years old.  He works as a plumber for a construction company.  He works only in the summertime.  She operates a meat trading business at Kharkorin, the most crowded market in Ulaanbaatar. She has been operating this business since 1998 and has expanded her business with a loyal customer base.  She says: "it has been very difficult these past years and now my business is getting better."  Battsetseg is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials for her old house. This is her only income.  She is a very intelligent and patient person.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for her old house.

loans.name: Kavuo

texts.en:
Kavuo is a 32 year old businessman. For a living, he operates a bodaboda (motorcycle transport) business in Nairobi. He has been in this business for three years and hopes to expand it in future.

Kavuo also runs a retail shop in partnership with his wife. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a motorbike. He describes himself as hardworking and his business has been good.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 30-year-old Mrs. Un S.’s daily duty in the garment industry. Un S. started in her job in 2008 and has a formal salary. She has a life partner in her husband (pictured) who is a security guard. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their two children, both of whom attend school. 

Un S. wants a plowing machine so she can provide a plowing service for other farmers who lives in and around her community. Because she needs money to buy one, Un S. is requesting a loan from Kiva. Un S. will use these funds to buy a plowing machine to begin providing her service.

loans.use: To buy a plowing machine to provide a plowing service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire more merchandise to satisfy demand

loans.name: Manuel Augusto

texts.es:
Manuel Augusto R. O. tiene 57 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos que son solteros, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

Manuel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y pago a los jornaleros. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un  de terreno.

Le gusta criar animales y dar de comer, festejar las festividades de carnaval.
texts.en:
Manuel Augusto R. O. is 57 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children, who are single, in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He has 6 children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in farming.  This is their source of family income.  They grow corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.

Manuel grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays.  He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and to pay day laborers.  The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially.  Manuel faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy land.  He enjoys raising animals, feeding his animals and taking part in carnival celebrations.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and pay day laborers

loans.name: Fredrick Kibet

texts.en:
Fredrick Kibet L. is a 37 year old man, married to Salome Jerotich and together they have two children.  Salome is a business lady in Kitale, and Fredrick has several business such as a hardware shop, retail shop, butchery.  He has been in these business for ten years now and he gets a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings. 

This will be fredrick's first loan from KADET LTD, and he intends to add more stock to the retail shop mostly food commodities like sugar, cooking fat, maizeflour, etc. 

With the income that he will get from the business he plans to further diversify his businesses and start dairy farming. In future he wants to educate his children in the best school in Kitale and also buy land and build rental houses which will add to his income.

loans.use: To buy food commodities for resale

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: El señor Félix nacido en la ciudad de Chuquisaca soltero se dedica a la agricultura tiene sus tierras en Surutú a 40 km del Torno. Tiene tierras en la provincia Cordillera donde también se dedican a la agricultura ellos siembran en esas tierras maní en cantidad y compro una motosierra para hacer madera para carpintería y así poder ofrecer sus productos a los carpinteros de la localidad, el dinero del crédito comprara una motocicleta para poder transportarse ya que le será de mucha utilidad ya que el estado malo de la carretera no le permite transportarse en auto, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superación y esta profundamente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Felix was born in the city of Chuquisaca. He is single and he is an agriculturist who has land in Surutu, about 40 km from Torno. His land is in the province of Cordillera where other agriculturists also harvest the land. He purchased a chainsaw to make wood for carpentry and to be able to offer his products to the carpenters in the region. The funds from this loan will be used to purchase a motorcycle for transportation. It will be very useful for him because the rugged conditions of the roads will not permit vehicles. He is a very young person with a great wish for self-improvement. He is profoundly thankful to the organization for the support given to him.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Santiago Bladimir

texts.es: Santiago Bladimir tiene 32 años, su actividad es el servicio de moto. Hace más de 9 años que tiene este medio de vida. Inicio por cuenta propia, siempre ha sido una persona luchadora y que disfruta de su negocio tiene un hijo de solamente un año de edad él se preocupa por proporcionarle los ingresos necesarios. Santiago tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días para lograr obtener ganancias necesarias para su hogar. El financiamiento es para la compra de diferentes repuestos para su unidad.
texts.en: Santiago Bladimir is 32 years old.  His source of income is his moto-taxi service.  He has been earning his living this way for over 9 years.  He began it with his own money, having always been a fighter and enjoying his work.  He has a one year old son, which is why he worries about making enough money.  Santiago wakes up very early every day in order to be able to earn enough money to cover his household's costs.  This loan is for the purchase of different parts for his vehicle.

loans.use: Purchase parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Pauline has operated a vegetable stall for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Pauline faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Pauline plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase building materials to finish three rental rooms. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to finish three rental rooms

loans.name: Zenith

texts.es: Zenith S.  D. 58 años, Vive en el municipio D. galapa y se dedica a la venta D. comidas corrientes;  sus principales clientes son sus  vecinos, trabajadores del sector que en este primer semestre   del año, en el cual estárn realizando actividades D. construcción en   vías publicas que se encuentran en estado D. reparación; su venta es diaria y D. contado en su mayoría correspondiente a un 60%,  aunque también maneja  créditos D. recuperación semanal, su promedio D. ventas es D. 20 almuerzos diarios y también venD. mucha sopa al menudeo medida en tasas. Zenith hace jugos naturales  para acompañar las comidas que le generan otros ingresos. Ella adquirió D. su hermana la experiencia en este oficio, hace cuatro años  porque esta última  también se dedica a vender alimentos.   Zenith inició en un barrio donD. vivía anteriormente y hoy esta en el está ella sola a cargo del hogar y D. la obligación D. sus 3 hijos.   Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el comprará insumos para la preparación D. sus comidas y  2 juegos D. mesas  con sus respectivas sillas,  porque atienD. a su clientela en su propia terraza pero cuando aumentan las   ventas, debe usar su comedor familiar; Su sueño es adecuar su restaurante   organizandolo en el patio donD. dispondrá D. unas hermosas cabañas para el deleite y reposo D. sus clientes después D. consumir las comidas.  Su negocio es D. mucho impacto para ella porque además D. genérale una utilidad  entre el 46 al 47% fortalece su autonomía que le ha permitido vivir cómodamente en su propia casa , donD. apoya los gastos rutinarios que se presentan en su familia.
texts.en: Zenith S.  is 58 and lives in the municipality of Galapa, she sells food; her main clients are neighbors, workers of the area that in this first semester of the year are doing construction work in the roads that are being repaired; she sells daily and her sales are approximately 60% cash, she gives credit repayable weekly, the average sales are 20 daily lunches, she also sells a lot of soup by the cup.  Zenith makes freshly squeezed juices in addition to food which brings her extra income.  She gained experience in the business four years ago from her sister, who also sells food.  Zenith started selling in a neighborhood where she used to live and now she is fully in charge of her home and taking care of her three children.  This is her first loan with "Foundation Mario Santo Domingo" and she will buy ingredients for food preparation as well as two table sets with chairs because she sells to her clients in her terrace, but when it gets busy she has to use her family dining room.  Her dream is to set up a restaurant in the terrace with tents for the liking and comfort of her clients to enjoy her food.  Her business has high impact in her life because it generates profit between 46%-47% which strengthens her autonomy and has allowed her to live comfortably in her own house where she covers the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for food preparation and to buy two table sets with chairs

loans.name: Jocob

texts.en:
Jocob is 34 years old, married and blessed with two children who are in school. For four years he has been operating a retail shop where he sells vehicle spare parts.

Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by getting business loans, and this has helped him to grow his business. He hopes to have a fully established business in the future. He has requested a loan of 30,000 Kes to buy shock absorbers, suspension arms and a steering wheel.

loans.use: to buy shock absorbers, suspension arms and a steering wheel.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai T. N. is 35 years old. She lives with her family in Dai Bi commune. She is a tailor who focuses on making traditional dress. There are a lot of different designs in her shop, so she is always busy with customers' orders. She earns 4,500,000 Vietnamese dongs (VND) per month, which improves her family’s living conditions greatly. 

Since joining SEDA (Small Enterprise Development Assistance) in 2004, Mai T. N. has invested effectively in her shop. She is requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND in this loan cycle to buy more cloth.

loans.use: to buy more cloth

loans.name: Alberto Dionisio

texts.es:
El sr. Alberto Dionisio B. tiene 41 años y está casado con la sra. Blanca Mendoza de 32 años, tienen 3 hijos, uno de 16 que está cursando la secundaria y dos menores de 9 y 5 años respectivamente que están cursando sus estudios primarios. Viven en la ciudad de Villa Elisa.
El sr. Alberto se dedica a la venta de leña y metros de maderas a la empresa Cerámica San Isidro de la ciudad de Nueva Italia. El paga por hectáreas al propietario del inmueble en el cual podan los árboles, de los cuales hacen luego la leña y el metro. Para ello cuenta con motosierras y un camión mediante el cual traslada su mercadería hasta la localidad de cerámica.
Alberto solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en capital de trabajo, pagando las hectáreas en las cuales trabaja y así no fallar en su trabajo ni a su familia, ya que él los mantiene dignamente.
texts.en:
Alberto Dionisio B. is 41 years old, married to Blanca Mendoza, 32 years of age, and they have 3 children.  One is 16 and in secondary school, and the two younger ones are 9 and 5 and in primary school.  They live in the city of Villa Elisa.

Alberto dedicates himself to selling wood to the Cerámica San Isidro corporation in the city of Nueva Italia.  He pays the owner of the land from which he takes the lumber by the hectare.  He has trucks that he uses to transport his merchandise to the ceramics business.

Alberto requests this loan to use as working capital, paying for the land where he works.  This way, he won’t fail in his business or for his family, who he supports with dignity.

loans.use: to pay for leasing hectares of land for wood.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es un señor de  71 años de edad, soltero. Vive en una casa propia en la parte rural del distrito turístico de Túcume- Lambayeque.

La actividad que desarrolla Santos, es la confección de prendas de vestir. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 19 años en su domicilio. Santos conoce a la perfección los gustos y las tallas de sus clientes, pues tiene una clientela ya establecida que no deja de pasar por su casa para darle los usuales encarguitos: subir bastas, entallar, remallar, coser, etc. Santos además cuenta con ingresos adicionales por la cría y venta de animales.

Santos solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para la compra de telas, hilos y agujas. Debido  a que Santos no tiene competencia, la demanda que tiene es mayúscula y es por ello que él no puede abastecer por si sólo los gastos requeridos.

Santos,  es un cliente antiguo  para Edpyme Alternativa, su crédito anterior fue cancelado con puntualidad.
texts.en:
Santos is a 71-year old man who is single. He lives in a house which he owns located in the rural section of the tourist district of Tucume, Lambayeque.

Santos' business is the production of clothing. He has been operating this business from his home for the past 19 years. Santos perfectly knows the personal styles and sizes of his clients. He has an established clientele who never fails to visit his house to place their orders, including: hemming, sizing, darning, sewing, etc. Santos also has an additional source of income by raising and selling livestock.

Santos requests a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles to purchase fabrics, threads, and needles. Given that Santos does not have any competition he has an increased demand and that is the reason why he cannot meet the required expenses.

Santos is a long time client of Edpyme Alternativa. The previous loan was paid off on time.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Mahabat's Group

texts.en:
Mahabat is the leader of this group. She is 34 and married to a security guard. Together with her husband she is bringing up two daughters. Both children study at school. 

Eleven years ago, Mahabat’s husband saved 5,000 KGS and purchased cattle. Since that moment the family has been breeding cattle. With money received from the loan, Mahabat wants to purchase a calf for breeding.  

In the future, she wishes  to provide a good education for her daughters. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
