This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf.

loans.name: Erman Heleodoro

texts.es:
Erman Heleodoro tiene 49 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el Recinto Agua Clara Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SANTA ROSA DE AGUA CLARA, está ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 20 socios es el segundo crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao y yuca, además se dedican al comercio.

Erman se dedica a la agricultura siembra de cacao, arroz, maiz y soya. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es educar a los hijos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Erman Heleodoro is 49 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children.  They live in the precinct of Agua Clara, which is part of the Chillanes district.

V.R.C. ROSA SANTA in AGUA CLARA is located 20 minutes from the office in Chillanes and consists of 20 members. This is the second loan request for the cooperative.  The members of this group are dedicated to agriculture, planting cocoa and yucca.  Additionally they are engaged in trade.

Erman works in agriculture, planting cocoa, rice, corn and soybeans. Purchases are made ​​in Chillanes and San Pablo and he sells at the Sunday market in Chillanes.

The loan will help him with the purchase of supplies for the crops.  The loan is the means to increase crop production. He has faced challenges such as workers' illnesses, pests and crop disease. His dream is to educate his children.  He likes to go for walks with the family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for crops

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 35 years old and is married with 1 child, aged 16. She runs a clothing store in Kissy near Freetown.

Sarah has been in this business for 13 years and sells clothes, shoes, bags and jewelry at her store. Her business is her only source of income. She says that her main business challenge is that sales of clothes and other items depend on the season.   

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more shoes, bags and jewelry. Sarah says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve the standard of living of her family. In the future, she would like to import goods from overseas by container.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes, bags and jewelry

loans.name: Amen Group

texts.fr: AMEN est un groupe de deux personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante du groupe, Afiavi Nadine(dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Afiavi Nadine est mariée à un certain Ernest. Le couple a trois enfants à charge, dont deux sont les leurs. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. Afiavi Nadine et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses charges du foyer. Afiavi Nadine a appris la coiffure et exerce cette activité depuis sept ans environs. A côté de cette activité qui lui procure des revenus non négligeables, Afiavi Nadine vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches dans son atelier. Afiavi Nadine achète ses produits au Bénin et au Nigeria. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Afiavi Nadine sollicite un deuxième crédit avec les membres du groupe AMEN. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: AMEN is a two-person group whose members live in the same neighborhood in Benin. The group’s representative, Afiavi Nadine (raising her hand in the photo), is 32 years old and lives in Benin. Afiavi Nadine is married to a man named Ernest. They have three children in their care, two of whom are their own. All children go to school. Afiavi Nadine and her husband live together with their children and jointly provide for various household needs. Afiavin Nadi is a learned hairdresser and has been working in this trade for about seven years. In addition to this work, which brings her significant income, she also sells cosmetics and hair extensions in her salon. Afiavi Nadine stocks up in Benin and in Nigeria. Striving to meet her clients’ needs, Afiavi Nadine is seeking a second loan as part of the AMEN group. This loan will help group members better meet customer demand and increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics

loans.name: Julia Elena

texts.es:
Julia tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y  3 hijos en una pequeña comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

Julia se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, en corrales espaciosos ubicados en la parte trasera de su vivienda. Ella cuenta con clientela establecida que son principalmente los pobladores de su comunidad y alrededores. Además, Julia cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual cosecha limón semanalmente, para luego comercializar en el mercado local.

Ambas actividades le permiten mantener su hogar y para continuar con un buen desarrollo de estas, Julia solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y fertilizantes para su cosecha de limón. 

Julia tiene muchos deseos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y este crédito le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Julia is 39 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a small, rural community in the district of Tambogrande-Piura.

Julia is dedicated to raising and selling pigs in spacious pens located in the area behind her house. She has an established customer base that are mainly the residents of her community and surrounding areas. Additionally, Julia has farm land where she harvests lemons weekly which she then sells in the local market.

Both activities allow her to support her home and, to continue with the good development, Julia is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 500 new "soles" to buy feed for her animals and fertilizers for her lemon crops.

Julia has many wishes to improve the quality of life of her family and this loan would be a great help.

loans.use: to purchase feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Being the head of the family is a big responsibility for a parent. Nguon is a cake seller in a market near her village. She is always concerned about her family, never taking time off to go visiting others. She earns about $2 a day.

As for her husband, he doesn’t laze around home. He sells secondhand goods around his and other villages. He also earns perhaps $2 a day. Both of them would like a loan of $750 to purchase more secondhand goods to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand goods to sell.

loans.name: Giovana Elizabeth

texts.es: Giovana, de 28 años, convive hace 3 años con Marcelo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que quieren y cuidan en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Sus días se centran en el trabajo arduo. Desde hace algún tiempo comenzó en la venta de golosinas, bebidas y comida; en el cafetín de la escuela de su localidad donde obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que es la única que abastece a todos los estudiantes y profesores. Además de dedicar sus tiempos libres a tejer chompas de lana muy coloridas y vistosas; que gracias a su creatividad logra vender a intermediarios de la zona que comercializan los tejidos a la ciudad de Oroya, donde tiene mucha acogida por las bajas temperaturas. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo; que trabaja trasportando verduras, papa y frutas por todo el país, esto lo realiza manejando un camión, le va muy bien en su trabajo, por ello para el futuro está planeando ahorrar lo necesario para comprarse uno propio.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Giovana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra dulces al por mayor para surtir su tiendita.
texts.en:
Giovana is 28 years old and has been in a common-law marriage with her husband Marcelo for three years. They both love and take care of their three young children. Giovana and her family live in a rented house in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. Her days involve hard work. Some time ago, she began selling candy, beverages, and food at a local school cafeteria to earn a good income. Her business was the only one that catered to all of the students and teachers. In addition, she weaves colorful and vibrant wool sweaters. Thanks to her creativity, Giovana began selling to local brokers who sold her woven articles in the city of Oroya. Her handiwork is well-received because of the cold weather. She also receives the support of her husband, who transports vegetables, potatoes, and fruit all over the country with a truck. Her husband has done very well in his job, so he plans to save enough money to buy a vehicle of his own.

Giovana is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazón de San Pedro” (Heart of San Pedro) and this will be her first loan with MFP. She hopes to receive everyone’s support so that she can continue with her goals. In addition, she promises to complete her payments on time. With the support she will receive, Giovana will invest the money she requested in the purchase of candy in bulk so that she can restock her small store.

loans.use: to buy candy in bulk to sell in her store.

loans.name: Estherlin Ericka

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS ” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en el  mercado Virgen Asunta en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Estherlin tiene 30 años de edad,  la socia es casada; la socia tiene 2 hijas de 9 años y 11 meses, la socia trabaja en su tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene su local en su propia casa y vende todos tipo de productos desde los de primera necesidad como fideos, azúcar, arroz, leche entre otros; también vende diferentes artículos librería como son lapiceros, borradores, reglas, papel entre otros. La socia requiere el crédito para implementar su tienda de abarrotes, ella desea comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Siempre Unidos" ["Forever United"] communal bank. The bank is located in the Huanchac district, in the Virgen Asunta market in the Province and Department of Cusco.

Estherlin is 30. She is married and has 2 daughters ages 9 years and 11 months. She works in her grocery store, which is in her own home. She sells all types of products: basic staples such as pasta, sugar, rice and milk; and various stationery items, such as pencils, erasers, rulers and paper. She needs this loan to stock her grocery store. She wants to buy basic staples such as rice, sugar and pasta.

She is grateful for the support that we are providing and promises to pay off her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples such as rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Mohamed Desmond's Group

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above are members of a primary school in Marampa village, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of 3,800,000 SLL from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to meet their immediate financial challenges. At the end of each month, they will repay their loans out of their monthly salaries. 

Mohamed is the leader of this group of borrowers. Born in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone, Mohamed is 44 years old.  He is married and has 5 children. Mohamed has been in the teaching profession for 19 years now. He has requested a loan of 800,000 SLL in order to invest it in a business. He will use it to buy rice, palm-oil, etc. for resale.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm-oil, etc., for resale

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Cesar es padre D. familia se distingue por ser muy responsable con sus obligaciones ya que tiene que dar el ejemplo a sus 4 hijos. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene gastos escolares, que es comprar  útiles escolares que son cuadernos, carpetas, libros, plumas y lápices. Cesar por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar estos gastos, y no quiere que sus hijos se queden sin su material didáctico ya que es L. forma que podrán recibir una mejor educación y un mejor porvenir para el futuro. Para poder sostener los gastos del hogar trabaja en una maquiladora D. L. ciudad y su esposa le ayuda con los gastos realizando L. actividad D. empleada domestica.
texts.en:
Sr. Cesar is a father who has distinguished himself as being very responsible with his obligations so that he can set an example for his four children.

He is requesting a loan to buy school supplies. Cesar plans to purchase notebooks, folders, books, pens, and pencils. At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds to pay for these expenses but he does not want his children to go without the materials that will help them receive a better education and have better prospects for the future. In order to proviD. for the household expenses, Cesar works at a factory in the city and his wife helps out through her job as a housekeeper.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school supplies.

loans.name: Vanroeun

texts.en:
Vanroeun (in the photo), 26, and her husband, Channa, 31, live in a village along National Road number five approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2001 and have two young sons.

Vanroeun sells gasoline at home. Her husband is a driver who drives for a company. She is asking for a loan of $600 to buy her neighboring land to expand her land property.

loans.use: To buy her neighboring land to expand her land property.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN RUMIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Elena; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de bar, ella vende cervezas y gaseosas, ella trabaja desde las 4:00 p.m hasta las 1:00 a.m y por medio de esta trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de bar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar gaseosas y cervezas al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the 'Hatun Rumiyoc' community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Elena is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her bar where she sells beer and soda.  She works from 4.00pm to 1.00am and, through this work, she supports her children.  Elena would like to expand and improve her bar business.  She is requesting this loan to buy beer and soda wholesale.

Elena is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to invest in buying beer and soda wholesale

loans.name: Peris

texts.en: Peris is 27 years old and earns a living by working very hard at making detergents, soaps and shampoos. She has been in this line of work for four years, and has done well in a very competitive environment because she provides excellent customer service. She hopes to become a major supplier of soap and detergents in her region in the future, and is applying for a loan for 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy the supplies she needs to make more soap and detergents to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make soaps and detergents.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with six children; four attend school, while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a coconut-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major high cost of transportation and seasonality. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES),  she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Hol

texts.en: Hol, 45, is married and resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Hol is a farmer. She is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a new tuk-tuk for her son to operate transportation services in the city. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a tuk-tuk for her son to operate transportation services in the city.

loans.name: Marata

texts.en:
Marata, age 54, provides alteration and tailoring services to local community members. She has four years of experience in this business. Marata needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve and expand the business. She and her husband have four children.
 
In 2007, Marata joined SPBD* in order to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Marata's fifth loan with SPBD. 
 
*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score." For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD:
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Meet 48 -year-old Oscar from Krootown, central area in Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 17 years and 24 years. She has 6 additional dependents that live with her at home.  In 1996, Oscar established her building materials store in Krootown. She began her business because she was working as a secretary, but the salary she was receiving was insufficient for her to support her family. She works at the business from Monday until Sunday, 7 days per week and 12 hours a day from 7:00am -7:00pm. She also earns income from another business selling pork. She says that the main challenge to her business is high cost of transportation.

Oscar requires a loan in order to purchase more building materials such as switches, plugs, pump heads, nails, sinks, and wash hand basins. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to secure more goods for the store. In the future, Oscar plans to have a bigger building materials store in the country. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more switches, plugs, pump heads, nails, and sinks

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Elizabeth; continua con su negocio de compra y venta de materiales de construcción, la socia sigue siendo proveedora en las diferentes tiendas, ella vende cemento, clavos, arena entre otros materiales, ellla continua trabajando en forma independiente en esta ocasión la socia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción.
texts.en: Elizabeth continues her business of buying and selling building supplies to supply different stores.  She sells cement, nails, and sand among other things.  She continues to work this way on her own and needs this loan to buy building materials.

loans.use: to buy building materials for resale

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
Bilal is a 33-year-old married man and a father of two children. He has worked selling home products for five years. Bilal used to work in a hotel, but he insisted on running his own business, which will help a lot in improving his standard of living.
Bilal is a hard worker who is well known in his region. Most of his customers are friends, neighbors and retail shops. His business is growing, but it needs an external push to move forward. That's why Bilal has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital with new home products collections.
Bilal hopes to open a big wholesale store and expand it to offer many useful household goods affordable to anyone.

loans.use: to increase his business capital with new home products collections.

loans.name: Blanca Flor

texts.es:
En el cantón 24 De Mayo Provincia de Manabi, se reúne el Banco Comunal Nuevos Horizontes este lugar es conocido por sus paisajes hermosos y por su gente trabajadora dedicada a la agricultura y cría de animales.
 
En este lugar vive la señora Blanca, tiene 42 años, está separada pero de esa relación tienen dos hijos ambos mayores de  edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella.

Para ganarse el sustento diario ella se dedica a la cría de pollos, para lo cual tiene una pequeña granja en la cual mete hasta cien pollos por temporada, nos cuenta que compra los pollos pequeños en una distribuidora en la ciudad para luego alimentarlos y cuidarlos por tres meses, tiempo necesario para que estén grandes y poder entregarlos a los comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa para llevarlos a los mercados de la ciudad y la provincia. Ella además trabaja en una casa haciendo labores de limpieza. Nos cuenta que gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio y es así como puede salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas para los mismos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos empezó su negocio. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su vida y su negocio.
texts.en:
In the canton 24 de Mayo, Manabi Province, the members of 'Nuevos Horizontes' communal bank meet. This area is known for its beautiful scenery and it's hard-working people who are engaged in agriculture and animal husbandry.
 
Blanca, 42, lives here. She is separated from her husband and has two older children from the relationship, one of whom still lives with her.

To earn her daily bread, Blanca raises chickens and has a small farm where she breeds 100 chickens per season. She says that she buys baby chicks from a distributor in the city and after feeding and caring for three months they are big enough and she is able to sell them to large traders, who come to her home to take them to the city and provincial markets. She also works as a cleaner in another house. Blanca is thankful for the loans that have helped her to start her business, and through them she has been able to succeed.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens, and food and medicine for them. Blanca has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because thanks to the loans she was able to start her business.

Blanca's dreams are to continue to succeed in life and in her business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, and food and medicine for them.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 5 children. 

Angeles has a small store that sells different kinds of viands. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients in making viands like meat, vegetables and spices.

Angeles is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making viand

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 21-year-old married woman who lives in the Bagamoyo district with her husband.  Maria is a Camfed Learner Guide, who volunteers in her nearby ward secondary school. She teaches life skills, and helps students learn how to study. Maria has committed to two and half hours per week. She has requested a Kiva loan to start a poultry business near her community. Maria will use the profit obtained from the loan to rent a store for her chickens.

loans.use: to start a poultry business near her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stock of drugs.

loans.name: Mativa

texts.en: Mativa, 29 grew up in the village of Sogi, a community where crab fishing is a major source of income. Delicious crab is the most abundant item on the seafood menus in many Samoan restaurants. Overseas, crab meals are very expensive, but in Samoa, the crab dishes are fresh and inexpensive and attract many tourists at mealtime. Mativa's business is successful because of her expertise in the art of fishing and hunting for crabs at the right time. She sells to locals and businesses around town. Sometimes she caters family events. She is requesting a capital loan in the amount of  $875.00 to purchase materials that will increase her crab catch.

loans.use: To purchase additional crab traps, googles, torches, and nets

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is a married father of three originally from the town of Rocheachi in the Tarahumara Mountains. According to tradition, natives of the region consume Pinole, a product made from corn, as part of their daily diet. For the last six years Antonio has been making and selling this traditional dish with his family. When they started the business, the baking was all done by hand, but the y now have a tiny grind and a corn toaster, which has helped them increase production and allow them to teach others in the community this time-honored tradition.

Antonio is asking for a loan of $375 to help him buy raw materials to increase his business. He plans to repay within four to eight months. You can help add to the well-being of his family and also support the local economy of his impoverished region.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Don Antonio es originario de una comunidad en la Sierra Tarahumara llamada Rocheachi, cerca de Guachochi, en Chihuahua, al norte de México. Él esta casado y tiene tres hijos, los cuales le ayudan en su negocio. Cuenta que la tradición entre la comunidad de los Rarámuris (nativos de aquélla región) es consumir el Pinole de maíz como parte de su dieta alimenticia diaria, es por eso que desde hace más de seis años el y su familia se dedican a la elaboración y venta de este producto original, el cual elaboran de acuerdo a la forma tradicional de tostar el maíz; sus hijos y su esposa, le ayudan pesando, moliendo y etiquetando el producto. . Cuando iniciaron su negocio, llevaban todo el proceso de elaboración en forma manual, hoy en día ya cuentan con un pequeño molino y una tostadora de maíz, lo cual le ha ayudado a incrementar su producción y poder abastecer con su producto a los albergues escolares de educación indígena que hay por esa comunidad.

Antonio esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de $375 USD para apoyo en su capital de trabajo, el cual piensa pagar en un plazo de 4-8 meses. Tú puedes contribuir al bienestar de Antonio y su familia, apoyándolo con el préstamo y de esta manera estarás apoyando la economía de la comunidad que vive en la Sierra Tarahumara de México.

loans.use: Buy raw materials like corn

loans.name: Lourdes Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lourdes is very hardworking woman. Her husband is retired, but his income is not enough to cover their family expenses. For this reason, she had to help to her husband. She was working in a company before she was laid off. With her severance pay, she bought a sewing machine and began to make some little items her neighbors, who then and then recommended her to others, and she picked up clients. Along with this, she started making uniforms for kids and masqueraD. costumes for kids for dances and special school events.

Lourdes is requesting for a loan of $650 to purchase cloth, needles and zippers to make her products. She plans to repay this loan within 6 months. She and her family are very grateful for your support.

Translated from the original Spanish text

Lourdes es una mujer muy trabajadora, su esposo esta pensionada y con estos ingresos no les era suficiente para poder cubrir sus gastos familiares, por lo que ella necesitaba ayudar a su esposo. Ella trabajaba antes y fue despedida, con su liquidación compró una máquina D. coser y empezó haciendo arreglos D. ropa entre sus vecinas, quienes la fueron recomendando y ahora ya tiene varios clientes, además D. eso ella comenzó a hacer uniformes para niños y también disfraces para eventos especiales en los colegios donD. tenía acceso por la elaboración D. dichos uniformes y por lo general son en épocas D. eventos especiales como la primavera o cuando hay bailes típicos.

Lourdes esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad D. US $ 650 para compra materia prima que consta D. telas, hilos y cierres para la elaboración D. sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase cloth, needles and zippers

loans.name: Grâce

texts.fr:
Mrs. Grace F. is a 40-year-old married women and mother of three (3) children. With a high school education and training in cooking, she launched into a private initiative. Today, she manages a little restaurant where she also offers pastries which make her successful. She is very much in demand with customers who have become very loyal.

Unfortunately, Grace hasn't got the necessary equipment to satisfy her customers' demands. For that reason, she is soliciting a US$ 1000 loan to help her buy the needed equipment for her restaurant. This loan will allow her to increase her sales and improve living conditions for Grace and her family.

Translated from French by Bijou Kuzimbu, Kiva Volunteer.

Agée de 40 ans, Madame F. Grâce est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Avec un niveau d’instruction du cours secondaire, et une formation en cuisine, elle s’est lancée dans une initiative privée. Elle tient aujourd’hui un restaurant où elle fait aussi de la pâtisserie qui lui réussit bien. Elle est très sollicitée par une clientèle devenue très fidèle.

Malheureusement, elle n’a pas l’équipement nécessaire pour répondre aux vœux de cette clientèle. C’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui servira à acheter du matériel d’équipement pour son restaurant. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire et améliorer ses conditions de vie.

loans.use:
Purchase of equipment for her restaurant
 (Achat de matériel d'équipement pour son restaurant)

loans.name: Geidy Xiomara

texts.es:
Hello my name is Geidy, my main activity is the commerce. I own a store in the center of my community called "Children of Christ". I have been in this business for several years to help my husband with our family expenses. At this moment I do not have enough capital to statisfy my customer's demand which is greater every day.

Translated from Spanish by Yvette Diaz, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Geidy, mi actividad principal es el comercio, cuento con un negocio de venta de golosinas llamado como Golosinas "Hijos de Cristo" ubicado en el centro de mi comunidad, tengo varios años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genra ingresos para ayudar a mi esposo con los gastos de mi familia. Actualmente no cuento con capital suficiente para satisfacer la clientela ya que la demanda cada día es mayor.

loans.use: Purchase of butter, potatoes, meats, vegetables and refreshments

loans.name: Faleaoga

texts.en: Faleaoga E. of Mainoa village helps run her family's plantation.  Together with her unemployed husband, they are working hand in hand to make a living.  They applied for this loan in order to purchase chemicals and fencing wire to improve their plantation.  Expanding their plantation will improve their lives as they lay a foundation for their family; they are newly married.  Aged 29, Faleaoga is grateful to be in the SPBD progamme.  It has helped her in time of need.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Sayamah

texts.en: Sayamah is a 40-year-old woman. She sells eggs door-to-door around the village. She usually earns about US$ 15 per week. Her husband, M., has no fixed income. She very much wants to get a loan of US$ 150 so that she can earn more income for her children’s education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion  of her ambulant egg-selling business

loans.name: Kime

texts.en:
U. Kime is a 44-year old mother of three children. At the same time she is the main bread-winner in the family.

For 5 years already Kime has been breeding cattle. Currently she is breeding 4 cows. Her son is helping her and her husband is selling the meat from the cattle in the market and this family business brings a stable income for the family. 

Kime is planning to expand her business and to purchase 2 more cows and fodder. For this she requests 1000.00 US Dollars. Kime is confident that she can pay the loan back on time.

loans.use: To purcahse two cows and fodder.

loans.name: Mujeres Chuisequec Ii Group

texts.en:
The women of the community bank Mujeres Chuisequéc enter their meeting at the Friendship Bridge office, their strong faces colored by the wind and the sun they daily endure as they take care of their farms.

They have traveled an hour from their community of Concepción, where the soil is rich and the climate good, allowing for year-round farming. All but two of the eighteen women have small farms, where they grow potatoes, carrots, onions, radishes, beans, broccoli, cauliflower, tomatoes, lemongrass, and chamomile (quite a variety!).

They whisper to each other in their native language Kaqchiquel, eagerly awaiting approval of the loans they have requested.

Eight of the women are asking for a group loan of 18,500 quetzales ($2425), ranging from $150 to $400 each. Of the eight, six will invest in seeds and fertilizer for their farms.

One woman is an artisan, weaving beautiful ‘huipiles’, traditional Mayan blouses known for their intricate and colorful designs. She will invest in thread for her weavings.

Another woman is a ‘comerciante’ (commerce women), buying a variety of goods in bulk and selling them at local markets. With her loan, she will buy a greater quantity of each item, lowering the price per item and increasing her profits.

Each woman of Mujeres Chuisequéc has a family to take care of; some even have up to ten children.

They express that everything they do is to improve the lives of their children so they can receive an education and learn to read and write. This will open them new opportunities and avoid them the suffering their mothers have had to endure.

As they go to sign their names, all but two sign with a thumbprint, indicating they cannot write. But they sign with pride, knowing that with this loan they are doing everything in their power to give their children the right tools to learn and later on sign their names with a pen.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer, as well as thread for weaving and goods in bulk

loans.name: Beni

texts.es:
Sandra has always been drawn to cosmetology, a field in which she is very skilled. When she was a little girl she dreamt of having her own beauty salon and therefore didn't have to think twice when deciding what career to pursue. After saving for quite some time, she rented a space in a popular shopping center in the city of Juliaca. Through much hard work, she has been able to set up her own salon and her abilities and excellent customer service have now started bringing her regular customers. This outgoing and resourceful woman now wishes to expand her beauty salon into a larger business and she is working hard towards this goal. Her work brings her much satisfaction and the promise of a positive future. In order to make her plans a reality she will need to invest a large amount of money in her business, and therefore asks for your support. She is requesting a loan, which will allow her dreams to take shape.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra siempre demostró una gran vocación y agilidad por el noble trabajo que desempeñan las cosmetólogas de su país desde niña soñó con tener su propio salón de belleza, es por ello que sin pensarlo dos veces decidió dedicarse completamente a esta actividad.Con el ahorro que durante mucho tiempo reunió, decidió alquilar un local en un concurrido centro comercial de la ciudad de Juliaca, y así poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo está logrando implementar su salón.Actualmente, gracias a la agilidad y habilidad de sus manos y sobre todo al buen servicio que ofrece está logrando acoger asiduos clientes, el deseo que anhela conseguir esta alegre y emprendedora dama es convertir su salón de belleza en un gran centro de estética, con ese fin se esfuerza y persevera en esta labor, que le va generando mucha satisfacción y expectativa. Para concretar sus planes requiere invertir una buena cantidad de dinero, con ese fin recurre a tu solidario corazón, para pedirte un préstamo. Este dinero le permitirá iniciar la cristalización de sus sueños.

loans.use: Increase of capital in order to make improvements to her beauty salon

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor started her embroidery work out of great love for her children and thanks to the advice and support of her best friend. Because of her hard work and daily efforts she is able to contribute to her children’s upbringing, which gives her such joy and satisfaction. Flor would like to increase the number of embroideries she makes, for which she needs capital to invest in fabrics and thread in different colors.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Anderson, Kiva volunteer.

Flor, emprendió su labor de bordados movida por el inmenso amor de sus pequeños niños y gracias a los consejos y ayuda de su mejor amiga, gracias a su desempeño y esfuerzo diario contribuye con el desarrollo de los suyos y ha ido albergando en su corazón muchas alegrías y satisfacción. Ha planeado mejorar la cantidad de su producción de bordados para lo cual requiere de un capital de inversión que será utilizado en la adquisición de tela e hilos de diversos colores.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics and thread in various colors

loans.name: Magleth

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 49 year-old Magleth N.. She is married, and has two children aged . In 2005, Magleth established her crop wholesaling business. Magleth requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. This serves as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice in bulk.

loans.name: Nurbibi

texts.ru:
Nurbibi Rajaabova lives in the area Gissar. She lives with her family and is married with 3 children. Her husband has traveled to Russia to earn money. Nurbibi works as a waitress in the dining room/ restaurant area. Other than this Nurbibi trades eggs in her free time. She brings the goods from the Shakhrinau area, buying them from a factory. For this business she plans to receive a loan. She wants to develop her business a little. She plans to extinguish the loan within the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Раджабова Нурбиби проживает в районе Гиссар. Проживает со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Сама же Нурбиби работает официанткой в столовой района. Кроме того в свободное от работы время занимается торговлей яиц. Привозит товар из района Шахринау , покупая на фабрике . Для этого бизнеса и планирует получить кредит. Хочет немного развить свой бизнес. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Alimata C. is 35 years old and lives in a polygamous family with her four children, her husband, her co-wife, and other relatives in Pélengana, one of the quarters of the city of Ségou in Mali. From a very young age, she got involved with income-generating activities of all sorts, but she finally decided to specialize in the selling of various items, focusing on food products, and has been doing so for the past three years. Her shop, “Une Munie Alimentation” is easily accessible, being situated near the main street of the city, linking Bamako to Burkina Faso. Mrs. C. has been involved with Soro Yiriwaso for three years. After having taken out four group loans with an association from her quarter, she is on her second individual loan, and all her previous loans were repaid with no problems. She stocks up on site in Ségou and sometimes in Bamako. With a client base comprised of people of all ages and both sexes, she sells her goods for cash and on credit, spread out on shelves. She plans to use this loan to buy 10 sacks of sugar, 1 refrigerator, 5 crates of beverages, 10 bags of carbonated beverages of the brand “American Cola”, and she hopes to make a profit of 200,000 CFA (about $475) with she will use to pay the interest on the loan as well as invest in her business. She hopes to open a larger store someday.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Alimata C. est âgée de 35 ans, et vit dans une famille polygame avec ses 4 enfants, son mari sa coépouse et d’autres parents à Pélengana un des quartiers de la ville de Ségou République du Mali. Depuis sa tendre enfance elle commence les activités génératrices de revenus de toutes sortes, mais décide finalement de se spécialiser dans la vente d’articles divers avec un accent pour les produits alimentaires il y a de cela trois (3 ans). Sa boutique (une munie alimentation) est d’accès facile située près de l’artère principale de la ville, reliant Bamako à la République du Burkina Faso. Elle est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 3 ans. Après 4 prêts solidaires avec une association de son quartier elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et tous les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou et quelques fois à Bamako. Avec une clientèle composée de tous âges et sexes, elle vend ses marchandises au comptant et à crédit sur des étagères. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour l’achat de 10 sacs de sucre ; 1 réfrigérateur ; 5 casiers de boissons ; 10 sachets de boissons gazeuses de marque « American Cola »et espère réaliser un bénéfice 200 000 CFA qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt et investir dans l’activité. Elle envisage ouvrir un super marché c'est-à-dire une boutique plus grande.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Lucila Antonia

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 55 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Ramos” de Catac, quien se quedo viuda hace 10 años, ha tenido que hacer crecer a sus cinco hijos, dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, principalmente corderitos, los cuales después los vende a diferentes compradores, en la actualidad su hijo menor tiene 21 años, así que trabaja solo para ella misma y de ves en cuando cuida a los nietos ya que vive con su hijo.

Con el préstamo de S/ 700 soles, que pagará en 4 cuotas, ella comprará cuatro corderos que los alimentará y luego los venderá, aunque su ganancia no es muy significativa, ya que por cada cordero vendido gana de 30 a 40 soles, ya se acostumbró a este negocio y no piensa cambiarlo ni dejarlo.

loans.use: Compra de ganado (corderos).

loans.name: Nelly Caro

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad.

Nelly es casada, tiene 36 años y 3 hijos, Nelly tiene un colegio Adventista Unión, que se ubica en la Urb. Jardín en un local alquilado, el colegio tiene 2 años de funcionamiento y recién este año esta a su cargo, para lo cual la iglesia adventista realizó la transferencia a Nelly, Actualmente funciona inicial, secundaria y cuenta con 60 alumnos en total. Además Nelly trabaja en una Organización no Gubernamental como asistente proyectos, actividad que realiza por las mañanas y por las tardes se encarga de supervisar las actividades del colegio.

Nelly necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una computadora para la implementación del colegio. Nelly sueña con tener un local propio para el colegio y que sus hijos sean cristianos, profesionales al servicio de los demás.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the Bank Communal Amor y Verdad. Nelly is married, has 3 children and is 36 years old, Nelly has a school called Adventista Unión, which is located in the Urb. Garden in a rented space. The school has been in operation for two years. Recently this year, the Adventist church made the transfer to Nelly, and she became in charge of the school. The school currently has primary and secondary schools and has 60 students in total. In addition Nelly works in an NGO as a project assistant in the mornings; in the afternoons, she is responsible for supervising the activities of the school. Nelly needs a loan of $675, which she will invest in the purchase of a computer for the school’s use. Nelly dreams of having her own location for the school and that her sons will become Christian professionals in the service of others.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a computer for a school

loans.name: Phe

texts.en:
Phe S., 38, works growing rice and various kinds of vegetables on her paddy. From selling her outputs to the people in the village as well as at a market, she can typically generate around $3/day of income. Her husband is striving to earn the family income by charging batteries for the people in his village. The government electricity source has not reached his community so the people in the village use batteries to generate electricity instead. From his business he can earn around $5/day of income for his household.

Phe S. and her husband are really happy to see their businesses growing, but they still need more capital to enable them to purchase a bigger machine that can charge a lot more batteries at a time. A new machine can save them a lot of time.

loans.use: To buy a machine that can charge more batteries.

loans.name: Flavia C.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Flavia K. from Mbeya. She is married with 4 children, between the ages of 5 and 15. Flavia has been running a tailoring business since 1998. Her business is to make clothes for her customers.

She works at the business for 4 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her daughter. She currently earns about $50 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $500 in order to purchase additional stocks of clothes and materials for making more clothes. In the future, she plans to open another business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of clothes and materials for making more clothes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr: Né vers 1978 dans l’arrondissement de KESSOUNOU de la commune de DANGBO, monsieur A. Daniel est marié et père de 4 enfants dont 2 scolarisé. Il est un cultivateur dans le village de GLAHOUNSA de la vallée de l’Ouémé et est membre du groupement  GH MISSIMAHOU DE GLAHOUNSA. Les habitants de ce village font les travaux champêtres à la décrue du fleuve ouémé. Leurs terres sont riches et les offrent un bon rendement.  Leurs spéculations principales sont la culture du maïs, du piment, des légumes, du gombo, de la tomate et du manioc. Le problème de ces habitants riverains du fleuve est que, en période de crue, ils n’ont plus d’activité et dépensent tout le revenu issu de la campagne écoulée à la consommation. A la décrue ils n’ont plus d’argent pour payer la main d’œuvre indispensable pour emblaver la superficie à eux disponible.  La pratique dans le milieu qui consiste au bradage des récoltes ne les sécurise pas et les runes d’avantage. Cette pratique est la vente à un prix dérisoire de la récolte future a un nantis pour disposer de la somme nécessaire aux travaux champêtres. Fatigués de cette pratique il a sollicité un prêt de 100 000 FCFA pour l’exploitation d’environ 1hectares des spéculations susse indiquées.
texts.en:
Born around 1978 in the district of Kessounou in the town of Dangbo, Mr. Daniel A. is married and the father of 4 children, of whom two are attending school. He is a farmer in the village of Glahounsa in the valley of the Ouémé River and a member of the GH Missimahou Group of Glahounsa.

The inhabitants of this village work as farmers when the river level is low. Their land is rich and gives them a good harvest. Their principal crops are maize (corn), hot peppers, vegetables, okra, tomatoes, and manioc. The problem for these people who dwell along the river is that when the river is in flood, they have no more work and spend all the money they earned during the last farming season on foodstuffs. When the waters recede they have no money left to pay laborers who are indispensible to them in cultivating the land they own.

The custom of borrowing against the new harvest does not make them more secure and indeed leaves them worse off. They sell their future harvest at a laughable price to weathier persons so that they have the cash needed to do their farming. Weary of this practice, Daniel A. has requested a loan of 100,000 F CFA which will allow him to farm about 1 hectare, growing the aforementioned crops.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: farming of 1 hectare, in corn (maize) and hot peppers

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is 32 years old, married, with 4 children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her family in the Rongo District of Kenya.

Mary sells kerosene and second hand childrens and men’s clothes in the Achutti Market. She has had a stall there since 2006. Mary purchases her stock in Kisii and Awendo and sells to her local community in the market. 

The business has allowed Mary to send both her children and herself to school. With her profits, Mary was able to attend college and she is also able to pay for her childrens school fees. 

She has applied for a loan of KSH 11,250 (approximately USD $150) in order to purchase more kerosene and used clothing. Mary wishes to expand the range of clothing items that she sells using the loan money.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothing and kerosene

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mr. Lun D., 22, and his wife, Mrs. Samut Yorn, 24, were married in 2007 and have one daughter. They live in a small house next to their parent’s house. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lun has been repairing motors, bicycles, and motorcycles for one year. His wife is a garment factory worker. She just gave a birth and started her job one month ago. Lun is requesting his first loan. He is asking for $700 to purchase a motor and a machine for renting musical instrument to his villagers so he can earn extra income. He will also use part of the loan for his motor repair shop.

loans.use: To buy a motor and a machine for renting musical instruments, and to repair his motor repair shop.

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Mrs. Luningning D. Cruza is 34 years old and has lived in Guintas, Hamtic, and Antique, Philippines. She is married and blessed with 5 children, 3 in elementary level and one in high school. 

She owns a variety store and received a P14, 000.00 loan last January 29, 2009 to purchase groceries for her store. With a greater variety of inventory she now attracts many more customers. Aside from this business she also has piggery and raises poultry. For the future she hopes to have mini grocery store and to complete her son education so that he will not have to experience the poverty that she has

Mrs. Luningning D. Cruza is very thankful to ASHI because of the trust they had in her, especially the initial capital to establish her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for a Variety store

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 46-year-old Angelina W. M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with one child who is 18 years old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can not take care of them. Angelina has been running a butcher shop business since 2008. Her business is to buy the cows and butcher them. She works at the business for five hours per day, seven days per week and is assisted by two employees and her husband. Angelina currently earns about 200USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a cow. In the future, she plans to open another business. Angelina thanks you for your support!
	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy a cow.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 26 year old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with his wife. Hussein has owned a barber shop for six years. He is requesting a loan of 1300 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new seat, an air conditioning unit and a washing machine. This is the first time that Hussein has requested a loan. Hussein is special in his field of work because he is highly skilled and is aware of innovative styles and techniques. His clients are people from his local community. When he first started his business, he didn’t face any difficulties. Hussein decided to start his business because of his experience in the field. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Hussein will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his work.

loans.name: Ametauna Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Ametauna 1º ciclo, está ubicado en el barrio El Pajonal donD. todas son del barrio y se conocen entre ellas. Todas las señoras tiene sus negocios propios como ser: promotoras D. cosméticos, venta D. comida, peluquería, venta D. joyas, venta D. masetas. Las socias aceptan que existe gran competencia D. créditos en las diferentes entidades financieras, y algunos créditos individuales. Las socias D. dicho banco sacaron el crédito con el objetivo D. hacer crecer su negocio y aumentar su capital. Parte D. ellas trabajan en otras instituciones financieras.
texts.en:
The cooperative bank Ametauna First Cycle is located in the El Pajonal neighborhood, where the women know each other. They all have their own businesses, such as cosmetics sales, food sales, hairdresser’s, and jewelry sales. The members realize there is great competition for loans with the various financial institutions, as well with some individual credit. The members of said bank took out credit with the objective of helping their businesses grow and to augment their working capital. Some of them work in other financial institutions.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson B. manages a small rice field. He is 50 years old and has four children. He started by tilling a small parcel of land. He knows that by hard work, he can provide for the needs of his children. His harvest is what his family uses for food and in buying all their needs. Now, Nelson needs a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy complete fertilizers, urea, and seed. The loan will help Nelson have a better yield and income. CEVI aims to help small business grow. It gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy complete fertilizers, urea, and seed

loans.name: Waziran Riaz Ahmad Group

texts.en:
Waziran mai and Saiqa baji are both citizens of Multan, Pakistan, a city famous for its shrines.

They are both involved in a decorative-embroidery business. They take orders from the clothes shops and prepare an embroidered dress in fifteen days to earn income. Their families are very happy with them. They respect each other a lot. There's just one difference between them otherwise they are equal: Waziran baji is the leader of Saiqa baji.

They both are applying for a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and cloth) to expand their decorative-embroidery business.

loans.use: To buy material for preparing embroidered dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing maize

loans.name: Nimia

texts.en:
Nimia G. F. is a member of the communal bank “Cesar Vallejo” and lives in the city of Pucallpa.  She has a small business selling candies, cold drinks and popsicles from her home.  She also does a bit of sewing work on the side.  

Nimia has been working with Manuela Ramos for 11 years and was a founding member of her communal bank.  She is widowed and has six adult children.  Although Nimia could stop working at this point, she has worked her whole life and feels she would become bored if she stopped.  Nimia plans to use this loan of 1000 Nuevos Soles to purchase more candies and to invest in used clothing for sale.  Nimia has seen that as people are purchasing more used clothing than hand-sewn goods, she is better off investing in this area than in purchasing more materials for sewing work.  

Nimia feels that she has been helped by Manuela Ramos and has used her loans over the years to purchase many things.  It is very important to Nimia to make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase candies and used clothing for sale

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha G. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Martha sells second hand clothing in Abura, which she has done since 2001. Martha uses her income to pay for food and to pay bills. Martha will use the loan to buy second hand clothes for resale. Martha plans to reinvest the new profits from her expanded business.

loans.use: Martha will use the loan to buy second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ala

texts.en: Ala S. (0) is a 35-year-old woman living in the town of Sinamoga. She is married and has three infant children. Ala owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 500 WST a month. In 2009, Ala joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her first from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia is thirty – six years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. All are still in school. She works very hard to support her husband to provide for the family. Afia lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a trader. She trades in vegetables such as tomatoes, pepper, etc. on a table top at the market square. She supplies to food vendors in her community. Afia procures her goods from nearby communities at moderate prices. She has been in business for over twenty – five years now and wants a loan to buy vegetables in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Dibor

texts.fr: Dibor D. est une dame mariée de 60 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle fait un commerce de mil, maïs et arachide. Son objectif est d’améliorer les conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Dibor D. is a married lady, 60 years old, and the mother of six children. She does commerce in millet, corn, and peanuts. Her goal is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in millet, corn and peanuts

loans.name: Leilila

texts.en:
Leilila is a 58-year-old married woman from South Cotabato. She lives with her husband and their six children. She cultivates a hectare of rice field, which produces harvests three times a year. When it’s not time for harvest, Leilila maximizes her time by raising hogs to make up for her family’s daily needs.

Leilila has been with CEVI for more than two years now. She maintained her membership because the lower interest rate has been helpful to her. Now she is requesting a loan of 15 000 PHP. She will use this loan to finance her farm.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Tasneem

texts.en:
Tasneem is a professional photographer who grew up in Saudi Arabia thinking she would one day become an airline pilot. She discovered the world of photography while a college student in San Jose, California: “Right away, I knew photography was absolutely my passion, my talent, and my greatest ambition.” As a Saudi Arabian woman attending a predominantly Latino university, her love for photography grew alongside her love for Latino culture. She was struck by the many similarities between Latino families and Saudi families: love of family, food, ritual, and celebration.
 
After graduating from college, Tasneem pursued a career in photography. In 2008 she opened her own photo studio, Foto Clara, and quickly developed a client base within the Latino community she had connected with as a student. “A lot of photographers miss the point of taking family pictures. They work too much with Photoshop and lose what it is that’s special about the family.”

While Tasneem’s portfolio of work continues to grow, she still runs her business out of her apartment, relying on her trusty old camera and a temperamental computer. In need of a loan, Tasneem approached her own bank but was turned down because she only began a credit history when she came to the U.S. for college. A $6,000 loan will allow Tasneem to purchase a new camera, a new laptop computer, and new photo editing and business accounting software. “I see so much potential to grow a business here, especially as a woman, that I couldn’t experience in Saudi Arabia.”

loans.use: To buy a new camera, laptop computer, and photo editing and business accounting software

loans.name: Deysi Janet

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Olmos, ubicado una hora y media al norte de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años es propietaria de un pequeño negocio que brinda servicio de fotocopias, tipeos en computadora, impresiones y venta de artículos escolares. Su establecimiento se encuentra ubicado frente a un colegio estatal del distrito por lo que resulta de mucha ayuda a los estudiantes de la zona. Con el dinero que percibe de este negocio ayuda al sostenimiento de su hogar.

La constante demanda de los estudiantes por su servicio hace que constante mente tenga que renovar el material que necesita para trabajar con los tipeos, copias e impresiones (hojas bond, tinta, toner, etc). Comprar estos productos por unidad le resulta muy caro y poco rentable para su negocio, por lo que se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra al por mayor de estos productos y de esa manera tener un stock permanente con el cual pueda seguir trabajando.

Su sueño es estudiar la carrera de psicología en una universidad de la región y brindar este servicio en su distrito. Ella es una joven trabajadora, alegre y responsable.
texts.en:
Deysi is 18 years old, single, and lives with her parents in the Olmos district, located an hour and a half north of Chiclayo.

For two years, she has had a small shop that offers photocopying, typing, and printing services and sells school supplies. Her business is located across from a high school, which means there are many students nearby. The money from her business helps to sustain her household.

The great number of students that frequent her shop means that she constantly needs to replenish the supplies needed for her photocopying, typing, and printing services (bond paper, ink, toner, etc.). Buying these items individually is very expensive and not lucrative for her business, so Deysi is seeking her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She will invest the 700 Peruvian nuevos soles requested in the purchase of wholesale items, and in this way she will be able to maintain a permanent stock of products for her business.

Deysi's dream is to study at a local university to become a psychologist and to bring this service to her district. She is a hardworking, happy, and responsible young woman.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Josè tienen 30 años de edad. Es casado y tiene 3 hijos menores de edad. Toda su familia vive en la casa de su suegra quien le proporcionò unos cuartos. Èl  se desempeña como operario de construccion hace 10 años. Se inicio en esta actividad desde muy joven. Su conyuge se dedica como trabajadora del hogar para apoyar en los gastos de la unidad familiar. José es una persona responsable y puntual en el trabajo. Actualmente está trabajando encofrando una casa muy cerca a su domicilio. Su esposa cuenta con experiencia en la venta de juguetes por campaña navideña.  Por ese motivo, se están financiando para capital de la venta de juguetes para aumentar sus ingresos durante esta temporada y mejorar la calidad de vida.

Josè tiene muchas metas y objetivos, uno de ellos es darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose is 30 years old. He is married and has 3 minor children. His whole family lives in the house of his mother-in-law, who provides them with some rooms. He has worked as a laborer in construction for 10 years. He began this activity when he was very young. His wife works as a domestic worker to support the expenses of the family. Jose is a person who is responsible and punctual in his work. Currently, he is working putting up formwork (for pouring concrete) for a house very close to his home. José's wife has experience selling toys during the Christmas season. The couple has decided to use this loan for working capital in order to increase their income during this season and improve their quality of life. Jose has many goals and objectives; one of these is to give a better quality of life to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for the sale of toys

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.en:
The loan for this committee will be used to purchase clothing and lingerie for subsequent resale; to buy milk, herbs, sugar, oil, flour - all ingredients for pastries; meat, chicken, cassava, fruits - all in bulk for subsequent resale or for cooking; and selling baked goods and ready prepared food.

The committee "La Esperanza" was formed when there was such great interest to participate in the Female Entrepreneurship program, that there was not enough space in other committees for all the women who wanted to get involved. La Esperanza was formed by a group of passionate and hard-working women dedicated to improving their livelihoods.

Nora S. runs a massage salon. Angelica P. sells groceries. Ada M. sells fruit. Araceli Fariña sells groceries. Juliana V. sells fruit. O. Cross Ma sells fruit. Marta Lagraña owns and runs a pantry. Maria Teresa S. sells candy. Tomasa R. sells groceries. Silvia F. sells fruit. Teresa R. sells groceries. Lidia F. sells groceries. Petrona G. sells vegetables. Cristina B. sells groceries. Ada M. sells fruit. A. Myrian trades goods. P. Fermina sells cleaning products. T. Lidia trades goods. Mirian Peña sells groceries.

loans.use: Merchandise and foodstuffs

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille T. is from the village of Butuay. She is 40 years old. Lucille is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Lucille owns & operates a health & medical business venture. The main source of income for the business comes from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Lucille has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lucille joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucille has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lucille is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase construction materials for their house renovation. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lucille from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house renovation

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
Pulpería Martha es el negocio cuya propietaria es la señora Martha Diaz estando ubicada en el municipio de Telica en León donde a diario llegan sus clientes a realizar las compras en la pulpería.
Este negocio tiene 8 años de existir y ha logrado ir mejorando gracias al gran sacrificio que a diario hace la señora Martha. Actualmente está solicitando un crédito porque le urge la compra de los productos tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne de res, azúcar y leña. Con esta compra logrará surtir el negocio y de esta manera mejorará sus ingresos. También es importante destacar que ella realiza alimentos para venderlos.
texts.en:
“Pulpería Martha” is the business owned by Sra. Martha Diaz. It is located in the town of Telica in León where customers come by on a daily basis to do their grocery shopping.

This business has been existence for eight years and has been improving thanks to the great sacrifices that Martha makes every day. She currently is requesting a loan because she needs to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, chicken, beef, sugar, and firewood. These purchases will enable her to restock her business in a manner that will improve her earnings. It is also important to mention that she prepares food for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou S. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Depuis 3 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de TOULY et y a eu 7 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait un petit commerce de fruits de saison. Elle participe aux différentes charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Fatou S. is a 59-year old woman who is married and has six children. For the past three and a half years she has been a member of the village bank in TOULY, and she has had seven loans which she has managed well and repaid. She has a small business selling seasonal fruits. She contributes to the various household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain her income-generating activity

loans.name: El Milagro Group

texts.en:
In the city of Paraguarí, 15 kilometers from the neighborhood of San Roque, a group of women met in order to form a committee and take out a loan. They wanted to hear more about the program, and chose to join because of the various benefits afforded to them by the program. 
 The group is call El Milagro (“The Miracle”), and is currently in its 9th loan cycle, with an excellent credit rating. The group is made up of 19 hard-working women, who strive their hardest to improve their quality of life, both for themselves and for their families. All of the group members are hard-working women and have invested their loans in their respective businesses. 
One of these women is Mrs. Dionicia C., who sells “yuyo” remedies (natural herbs used in teas for certain ailments).  She sells these remedies in the local market, where she has a small stand. She starts working very early each morning in order to offer her products to her clients. Her work requires a lot of sacrifice, but she is grateful for her job, because it helps support her family and allows her children to go to school and get ahead in life. She is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for this loan, which she will use to buy certain products her clients have requested, like natural skin creams, natural cough syrups and other items.

loans.use: Buy natural skin creams, cough syrups and other products.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 52 years old, is from Sto. Nino, South Cotabato. She has a farm, which she hopes can provide her family with their daily needs. She has two children. Aside from the farm, she has also ventured into a hog-raising business. She wishes to sustain her livelihood and moreover, to be able to improve their family's economic condition. 

Victoria wants to apply for a loan of Php 15,000 through Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika L. is 55 and married with 6 children (ages 9 - 18).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Veronika has many years of experience in this business.  Veronika needs a loan of WST $3000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2005, Veronika joined SPBD.  This is her 5th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Veronika's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Veronika L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.5 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.4 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.5 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.6 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en: Tony takes great pride in being a business owner. Like many little boys dream, Tony wanted to be a race car driver. Instead, he joined the military to defend his country and pursued a career in aviation. Tony was a crew chief in the Air Force for four years. He took advantage of all the Air Force had to offer and teach him. Now a veteran of aviation, he currently works as a helicopter inspector. With the support of his wife and family, he decided to also pursue his dream of being the first African-American supercar manufacturer. When Tony’s 6’ 6” body could not fit in the traditional supercars, he built his own in 1990. Tony says, “If one door closes I just look for another opening; I don’t give up.” With much patience and hard work he continues to expand his business and hopes to make it a full-time job.
