With his ACCION USA microloan he has hired two designers to work with him part-time and has purchased a laptop. He is proud to set an example of entrepreneurship for his four children and is determined to continue fulfilling his vision. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: For new staff and a laptop

loans.name: Taatai Ole

texts.en:
Taatai ole N. is 29 years old and married to Jackline N.. Together they have one school-going child. 

Taatai is a farmer and he does wheat farming; this he has done for the last four years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a Kadet registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant 20 acres of wheat. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat production and buy some sheep for fattening to sell later.

His dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and keep more sheep.

loans.use: To plant more wheat and buy sheep.

loans.name: Los Alegres De Anyaypampa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Los Alegres de Anyaypampa inicia su ciclo 1 con 10 socias. Las socias son de la comunidad de Anyaypampa, Distrito de  Vinchos. Las actividades principales de la comunidad son la crianza de truchas, agricultura y ganadería.
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como es el caso de la Señora Margarita que es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, Margarita junto a su esposo se dedican a la crianza de truchas en su comunidad, ella menciona que antes de este negocio su esposo solo se dedicaba a la agricultura y era difícil mantener a sus hijos, fue así que comenzaron con la crianza de truchas en el río de su comunidad, empezaron con una poza actualmente tiene 18 pozas, sus ventas al inicio lo realizaban en la ciudad de Ayacucho, actualmente venden en la misma comunidad porque vienen los compradores. Margarita junto a otras familias conformaron una asociación y esperan seguir creciendo con su empresa. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de alimento balanceado para truchas. Los sueños de Margarita son tener un restaurante para vender las truchas.
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos de prestamos como 100 soles, 300 soles, 500 soles haciendo un total de 4,800 soles.
texts.en:
The Happy People from Anyapampa village bank is beginning its first cycle with ten members, all from the community of Anyapampa in the Vinchos District. Most of the people in the community engage in fishing, agriculture and raising cattle. The members of this group work in various businesses as is the case with Margarita. She lives with her partner with whom she has 4 children. Together they raise trout in their community; she recounts that before they started this business, her partner only worked in agriculture and it was difficult to support their children, which is why they started to raise trout in the community river. They began with one deep pool and now they have 18. They first started selling in the city of Ayacucho but now sell in their own community because the buyers come to them. Margarita formed a group with some of her relatives and they hope to keep growing the business. Her loan will be used to buy balanced feed for the trout. Margarita dreams of having a restaurant where she can sell her trout. The group members need different amounts of loans like $35, $100, or $175 for a total of $1700.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of nutritionally balanced fish food

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn C. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in P. Villanueva St., Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. Jocelyn has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon for three years now and earns a living by running a sewing business.
Jocelyn is purchasing a solar lantern with a 3,100 PHP loan from NWTF to extend her productive hours and, at the same time, cut fuel costs and save money in the long run.

About NWTF’s Green Loan Products
Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation believes that the key to poverty alleviation for the poorest is to provide services beyond just credit. To that end, NWTF offers green energy products designed to save its clients money. In a partnership with SunTransfer and Arc Finance, NWTF distributes solar-powered lanterns that also function as a charging station for mobile phones. Families normally use kerosene lamps to light their homes. The solar lantern offers a free, environmentally-friendly renewable source of energy, which allows them to reduce their monthly fuel costs.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To purchase a solar lantern

loans.name: Gloria Azucena

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria Azucena S. se dedica la venta de ice cream y conos, su negocio opara bajo el nombre de  "LA GLORIA" esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, Gloria es casada y madre de 3 hijos, 2 dependen de su matrimonio y estudian en la primaria de los centros educativos publicos de la ciudad de danli. 
La  Sra.Gloria  tiene  experiencia en el manejo de este tipo de negocio ya que son 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de helados que hacen bien en estos tiempos de tanto calor, sus clientes estan satisfechos con su esmerada
y fina atencion. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas ice cream y conos,
tiene la ayuda de su esposo para atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria Azucena S. sells ice cream and cones. Her business operates under the name "LA GLORIA", and is located in her own home. Gloria is married and the mother of three children, two of which depend on her still and study in the elementary school of the public schools in the city of Danli. Gloria has experience in the management of this kind of business, since she has been selling ice cream for three years, which do well in these times of such heat. Her customers are satisfied with her merit and attention to fine detail. The loan will be used to purchase more ice cream and cones. She has the help of her husband to serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ice cream and boxes of cones

loans.name: Kasusu Twekambe S & C Group

texts.en:
Christine is a 30-year-old lady married to a driver and together they have three children, ages 9, 4 and 1 year old. She lives with eight people in her family and has a dream of constructing a permanent house so they can move out of the semi permanent one they are currently occupying. Christine is a tailor and also has a small retail shop. She has been in business for 10 years now, having started by selling tomatoes, yellow bananas and old clothing before becoming the tailor she is today. She says that taxes are high and an untrustworthy clientele also affects her business operations. She intends to purchase cloth for making T-shirts.

Christine is in a group called Kasusu Twekambe Savings & Credit Group which has 12 members. They use a solidarity kind of borrowing where each of the members is a guarantor to the others to ensure that they all meet their obligations on time and in equal amounts. In the picture, Christine is raising her arm.

loans.use: To purchasing clothing material for men's shirts

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a lady of 55 years and is a single mother with three children. She dream of constructing her own residence as she is now staying in a house owned by her brother.

Margret operates a retail shop in Hoima and has been in the business for sixteen years. Previously, she was employed as a nurse at a local health unit.

Margret says she wants to have a big wholesale shop one day. She is to purchase sugar, juice and cooking oil to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, juice and cooking oil for her shop

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. is from the town of Banga. She is 42 years old and married with 3 children. To make a living, Virginia farms rice and corn. Virginia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous CEVI loan and now requests her second loan, for 8000 PHP, to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Oscar Joel

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Joel Martínez D. es casado, tiene su domicilio en el Barrio Yvoty de la cuidad de Caacupe.

  El señor Oscar se dedica a la fabricación de helados, venta de empanadas, tiene su local de ventas en su domicilio. También tiene varios vendedores que recorren con sus carritos de helados en forma ambulante.

  Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos para helados y productos para la elaboración de las empanadas.    
                                                                     
   Agradece a la Fundacion Paraguaya y kiva por el apoyo  obtenido para su actividad, mediante ello su negocio está creciendo cada día, brindando un buen producto y puesto de trabajo a  la comunidad.
texts.en:
Mr. Oscar Joel Martínez Domínguez is married and has his home in the Yvoty neighborhood in the city of Caacupe. Oscar makes ice-cream and turnovers. His sales shop is in his home. He also employs several vendors who sell ice-cream in the streets from their carts. He is asking for funding to buy ingredients for ice-cream and products needed to make turnovers. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and to Kiva for the support given to his activity which has allowed his business to grow every day providing a good product and a source of employment for the community.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for ice-cream and for turnovers.

loans.name: Roberta

texts.es:
Roberta tiene 48 años de edad, reside en El pedernal, Municipio de Chilanga, departamento de Morazán, es casada, vive con el esposo y cuatro hijos entre las edades de 9-14 años, ella tiene un molino y una pequeña tienda de venta de productos de primera necesidad.
Ella tiene dos años de iniciar el negocio de la tienda y el molino seis meses, atiende ambos negocios de 6:00am- 5:00pm ofreciendo los servicios a los vecinos de la zona, el negocio fue por la necesidad que generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades de la familia, ella solicita un préstamo para compra de productos para abastecer la tienda ella va invertir en compra de azúcar, frijoles, golosinas, para fortalecer el negocio. Esto contribuirá contar con variedad de producto y mejorar los ingreso atrevas de las ventas.
Los sueños son manejar un negocio estable y exitoso para mejorará las condiciones de vida de sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Roberta is 48 years old and lives in El Pedernal, in the Chilanga municipality of the department of Morazán. She is married and lives with her husband and 4 children, who are between the ages of 9 and 14. She owns a mill and small grocery store. Roberta started the store 2 years ago, and the mill is 6-months old; she attends to both business from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., serving her neighbors in the area. Roberta started her businesses to generate income to cover her family's expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy products to stock her store with. She will buy sugar, beans, and candy for the business. This will contribute to the store's product variety and improve her income through sales. Roberta's dream is to build a stable, successful business that will improve the lives of her 4 children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, beans and candy to stock grocery store.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en: Claris K. is a 24-year-old lady who is married and has four children. She sells fish in Sita, Malindi. This lady was introduced to KADET by a friend who happens to be one of her customers. She is taking out her first loan of 5,000 Kenyan shillings and she plans to stock more fish to sell. Claris hopes to grow her business with this loan and wishes to use the anticipated profit to help educate her children. Her customers are mostly people from Sita where her business is situated.

loans.use: To buy more fish for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and blocks of ice to sell.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena P. is a married woman who lives in Lower Brgy. Pandan, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: General (Sari-sari) store and Tricycle business. Her husband Artemio P., who is 51 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 5 children who are 15 to 25 years old. Rowena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rowena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stocks for the general store so that she could continue to save up for the education of her children. Rowena P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en: R. Nigora is 29 years old. She is divorced and has no children. Nigora has a tailoring business at a tailoring shop. Her business is sewing national women's dresses. Her workmanship is very good and, being young, she has a good eye for design. She is very organized and has a good head for business. She has had this business for 12 years and this is her second loan from IMON International. With her loan, Nigora will buy more material for sewing dresses. Nigora smiles when asked what her dreams are for the future. She quickly replies that she plans to open a workshop, hire seamstresses and expand her business. With her spirit, she will surely succeed. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of materials for sewing women's dresses.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz, age 37 (shown holding the Asasah Passbook in the picture) is a homemaker with many household responsibilties. She makes every attempt to make her family's life better through her work. She and her husband have two sons and two daughters. The family lives in Sahiwal, a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. Their eldest son operates a Punjabi food stall business in the market. Their other children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

Shahnaz's husband is a noodle salesman by trade. He supplies noodles to different departmental stores and businesses and earns a good profit from his work. Shahnaz has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan to purchase packs of noodles in larger quantities in order to fulfill larger orders on time. Shahnaz is confident that an investment for her husband’s business will be a good step toward his business growth.  

Shahnaz is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client and has never missed a meeting.

loans.use: To buy packs of noodles in larger quantities to offer for sale

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is a 28-year old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: motorcycle transport (habal-habal) and rice dealing businesses. She lives in Purok 4, Brgy. Bongalonan, Basay, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her motorcycle transport (habal-habal) and rice dealing businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,500 PHP. Jocelyn is now borrowing 15,000 PHP so that she can continue to fund the operations of her motorcycle transport business. This will be her fourth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 5,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jocelyn aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operations of her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge  N. P. vecino de la Comunidad de Canalete de Alajuela, muy conocido por sus trabajos de Soldadura. 
Hace pocos años,  el aprovechando sus conocimientos en soldadura y con unos cuantos ahorros inicio su propio taller de soldadura, con el que dado todo tipo de soldadura en su comunidad. Ha sido todo un éxito, sin embargo ya sus pocas herramientas no le permiten satisfacer las exigencias de sus nuevos clientes. Es por eso que Don Jorge necesita un préstamo de ₡600 000(seiscientos   mil colones) para la compra  de nuevas herramientas y de mayor  material que le permita brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Jorge N. P. lives in Canalete de Alajuela community.  He is very well known for his welding work.

A few years ago, taking advantage of his knowledge of welding and using some savings, he set up his own welding workshop through which he has been able to offer all kinds of welding work in his community.  It has been a real success but his few tools no longer allow him to satisfy the demands of his new customers.  For this reason, Jorge needs a loan for 600,000 colones so that he can buy new tools and more material which will allow him to provide his customers with a better service.

Jorge is a member of 'Empresa de Crédito Comunal Canalete' (Canalete Communal Credit Company) which is one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: Welding materials

loans.name: José Cristobal

texts.es:
José Cristobal L. C. tiene 44 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los hijos, vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C SOLIDARIOS CHIMA CHICA se encuentra ubicada A 30 minutos de la Oficina San Miguel, perteneciente al cantón San Miguel, esta ventanilla se dedica a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos familiares, siembra maíz y en pocas cantidades las papas y el fréjol.

José se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y papas. Compra sus productos en Ambato,  Quito y  San Miguel y los vende en la feria de San Miguel los días jueves.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta bailar en las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
José Cristobal L. C. is 44 years old.  He is married and lives with his wife and children in San Miguel canton, in Bolívar province.  He has three children.

The members of the Solidarios Chima Chica community bank are located 30 minutes from our San Miguel office, in San Miguel canton.  The members of this group work in farming.  This is their source of income for their families.  They grow corn and also, in small quantities, potatoes and beans.

José is a farmer.  He grows corn and potatoes.  He buys his products in Ambato, Quito and San Miguel and sells them in San Miguel market on Thursdays. 

José is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies.  The support of this loan will help him to cover his needs financially.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy some land.  He likes to dance during carnival celebrations.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
N. Ruth, 42 years old, has been running a poultry business for 4 years in Walukuba-Jinja. The widowed Ruth says she took over this business immediately after her husband's demise. She and her husband had 4 children together.

Ruth has mostly been selling broiler chickens, which are in high demand, especially in the many trading centers around Jinja. To make headway in this business, Ruth has had to summon up a lot of perseverance. She also runs an outside catering business. The business generates 300,000 UGX monthly, and with this loan, Ruth is going to buy more broilers to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more broilers for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 28 años, hace pocos meses se ha casado, ahora vive con su esposo en casa de sus suegros. Ella tiene como profesión la de docente de nivel primaria, pero desde hace 2 años ha visto conveniente elaborar trabajos didácticos que son vendidos a sus alumnos y al de otras aulas. Es así que su tiempo lo distribuye, por la mañanas se dedica a la docencia y por la tardes se dedica a la venta de estos materiales didácticos. Le gusta este negocio, pues le ha generado buenas rentas, sin mayor esfuerzo, además que le gusta mucho armar figuras y cuanto más grandes es mejor su trabajo. En estos dos años de experiencia; ya es muy conocida por los alumnos y en adelante desea construir su casa propia, ya que se ha comprado su terreno. Es el 8avo crédito con MFP, y se ha comprometido en  pagar sus cuotas puntualmente pues quiere acceder posteriores ayudas para continuar progresando. Mary tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de materiales que necesita como: corrospum, tecnopord, pinceles y plumones, que necesita para continuar en su negocio sin problemas.
texts.en:
María is 28 years old and was married a few months ago. She now lives with her husband at the home of her in-laws. María is an elementary school teacher by profession, but for the past two years she has been making educational materials that she sells to her students and to other schools. Her time is devoted to teaching in the mornings and then selling educational materials in the afternoons. She enjoys this business because it has generated good profits without great effort. In addition, she likes assembling large figures which is the best part of the job. With two years of experience, María has become well-known among the students and would like to move forward by building her own house since she has already purchased the land.

This is her eighth loan with MFP. She promises to submit her payments on time because she wants to access subsequent loans so that she can continue making progress. María plans to invest the loan in the purchase of materials such as craft plastic, Styrofoam, brushes, and markers because she needs to continue her business without problems.

loans.use: Purchase craft plastic, Styrofoam, brushes, and markers for making educational materials

loans.name: Silvana Carla

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Monserrate. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí conocimos a Silvana, tiene 25 años de edad. Ella vive en casa de sus padres, en su casa viven tres personas. Lleva en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres  ciclos,  y le gusta porque con los créditos a podido solventar sus gastos y sus estudios ya que actualmente está estudiando en colegio.

Se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos de Avon y  Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja los fines de semana casi todo el dia y su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ya que ella visita a sus clientes  para mostrarles  sus productos y las revistas para que ellos decidan que comprar, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes.  Lo que es ropa los compra en Guayaquil y los otros  productos los recibe en su casa.

Este crédito es para comprar todo tipo de ropa,  perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y otros productos. Sus sueños son graduarse y seguir en sus estudios hasta terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Communal Bank “Virgen De Monserrate” meets every fifteen days. This area is known for its traditional culture. In addition, the city is located a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province – San Jacinto and San Clemente.

It is here one can find Silvana. She is 25 years old and lives at the home of her parents. There are three people who live at her house. Silvana has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the fact that the loans have helped her cover her expenses and her studies. She currently attends college.

Silvana is a merchant who sells clothing and products made by Avon and Yanbal (brands of beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women’s accessories). Silvana works almost all day on the weekends. She sells by going door-to-door and visiting her customers in order to demonstrate her products and present them with catalogs so that they can decide what to buy. Her products are offered on credit and she collects payments weekly or every fifteen days depending on how her customers decide to pay. She buys the clothing in Guayaquil and the other products are shipped to her home.

This loan will be used to buy all types of clothing, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and other products. Her dreams include continuing her studies so that she can finish her college degree and graduate.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, perfumes, crèmes, cosmetics, and other products

loans.name: Mrs. Pach Phally Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people from Trapeang Roka village in Takeo province are members of this group loan.  They will use their portion of the loan in varied ways to improve their family living.   The members have selected Mrs. Pach P. to be the group president. 

Mrs. Pach P. is a noodle seller in the local village where she is able to earn some money to support her family.  She is also a pig breeder.  Her husband, Mr. Vannareth Vat, is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land where he grows rice to sell to support the family. 

In the rice field, this couple has problems because their land has infertile soil, is located far away from an irrigation system, and has a lot of insects.  To improve their rice production, Mrs. Pach P. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide. 

Mrs. Pach P. is a mother of three children, two of whom are students and the other is still only 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and pesticide

loans.name: Zoila Natalia

texts.es:
Zoila de 43 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm vendiendo víveres y abastos. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso sigue trabajando para darle una buena vida a sus 6 hijos ya que está separada de su esposo. Vende en su tienda, lácteos, bebidas, arroz, dulces etc.  Para seguir trabajando y continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de construcción para su vivienda como cemento, bloques.
texts.en:
Zoila, age 43, is a hardworking woman who has a small store in the front part of her house. She works from 6am to 9pm, selling food and supplies.

Zoila has many aspirations for her business, so she continues to work hard in order to provide a good life for her six children. She is separated from her husband. Zoila sells dairy products, beverages, rice, sweets, and other products from her store. To continue working in her business, Zoila wants to use this loan to buy construction materials for her home such as cement and blocks.

loans.use: To purchase cement and blocks for her home.

loans.name: Maria Marlene

texts.es: La Señora Maria Marlene, tiene 36 años y es madre de 2 hijos, ambos a su cargo. Maria es una mujer eficiente y capaz, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y serigrafía, nos cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en su negocio. Su puntualidad, orden y optimismo le ayudó a crecer como mujer independiente y está muy orgullosa con lo logrado. Con este crédito para comprar camisas, pantalones, faldas, trajes de baños, bolsos, calzado entre otros. Se siente una mujer realizada por lo que agradece esta oportunidad. Este medio de vida le da la tranquilidad a ella y a su familia ante cualquier situación que le pueda ocurrir.
texts.en:
36-year old Sra. Maria Marlene has two dependent children. She is an efficient and capable woman who sells general merchandise and silk-screen prints. Her business is doing very well. Her punctuality, discipline, and optimism have helped her become an independent woman, and she is proud of what she has accomplished.

With the loan Maria will buy shirts, pants, skirts, swimsuits, bags, and footwear etc. She feels fulfilled and is grateful for the opportunities she has had. Her job gives her and her family peace of mind that they can overcome any problem that occurs.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, swimsuits, bags, and footwear etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to repair her son's truck

loans.name: Seak

texts.en:
Seak N. is 29 years old and married. She resides in Takeo province, Cambodia. Seak weaves traditional silk to sell and earns an income of about 2 USD per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about 4.3 USD daily. Each month, the family has to spend 110 USD on necessary expenses. 

Seak is requesting a loan of 600 USD to buy silk to weave into traditional products to sell. This will be her second first loan from CREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy silk to weave into traditional products to sell.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 56 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 12 años se dedica en la venta de ropa, mercadería que ofrece a sus vecinos y amigos, que viven cerca de su casa. Su estrategia de ventas se basa en visitar de casa en casa, llevando las prendas para mostrar, de esa manera sus clientes eligen el diseño a su gusto y el pago lo hace a crédito. Este trabajo le ha generado las ganancias para mantener a su familia, por ello se ha propuesto vender accesorios y zapatos. Es su crédito número 15 que tiene con MFP,  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque significa para ella una experiencia positiva de crecimiento como persona de la cual se siente orgullosa y se compromete en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en prendas de vestir.
texts.en: Teodora is 56 years old. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in a house which they own. She has been selling for more than 12 years. She offers her merchandise to her neighbors and friends who lives near her house. Her sales strategy is to visit door to door, taking the articles of clothing to show. This way her clients choose the style according to their liking. She completes her sales on credit. This business has generated the income she needs to support her family, which is why she has decided to also sell accessories and shoes. This is her fifteenth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She enjoys being part of her communal bank because it represents a positive experience for her to grow as a person, something that she is proud of. She is committed to making her payments on time. She will invest the loan that she requests in the purchase of more clothing merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase articles of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Marufjoni

texts.ru: Маъруфчон проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 20 лет. Холост. Он проставляет услугу. У него имеется дилерский центр, где он пополняет счет, продает мобильные телефоны, карты для пополнения счетов, зарядные устройства и панели телефонов. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для приобретения новых моделей мобильных телефонов и зарядных устройств.
texts.en: Marufjoni lives in Rudaki. He is 20 years old and single. He provides a service. He has a kiosk where people can add money to their cell phone debit accounts, and he sells mobile phones, cards with minutes, chargers, and phone cases. He has been doing this for two years. He is taking out a loan to buy new models of mobile phones and chargers.

loans.use: to buy new models of mobile phones and chargers.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Francisco, tiene la edad de 54 años, está casado  y vive con su hijo y su esposa que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los fertilizantes para la asistencia de su cafetal. El cuenta con la propiedad y es adecuada para la buena explotación de este cultivo, además ya la tiene sembrada y lo que necesita es asistirla para así obtener mejores resultados. El quiere generar los recursos necesarios para seguir adelante con su proyecto y darle cada día a su familia un mejor bienestar económico.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Francisco is 54 years old.  He’s married and lives with his son and wife who are his greatest priority in life.  He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer for his coffee plantation.  He has a piece of land that is well conditioned to grow this particular crop.  Besides, he already has it planted and what he needs is to help it along to obtain the best results.  He wants to generate the necessary resources to move forward with his project and provide his family every day with better economic wellbeing.

This is the first loan he’s gotten from FUDECOSUR.   He hadn’t had previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Duo Las Margaritas De San Bartolome Group

texts.es:
Duo margaritas de san Bartolo.
la señora maría transita de 60 años  de edad y su compañera Zoila edina de 26 años de edad, decidieron  enfrentar un nuevo reto  al solicitar un crédito a fape para engrandecer su negocio. Ambas personas se dedican al comercio, en el caso de doña transita se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, con el surtido de gran variedad de golosinas, durante los fines de semana trabaja en la venta de comida,  para poner otras variedades de comida, así como aumentar el número de raciones para la venta.
En el caso de dona Zoila edina, trabaja en una pequeña tienda de su propiedad, de autorizarse el crédito, pondrá más variedad de artículos para el consumo diario, doña zoila al igual que doña transita se dedica a la venta de comida como actividad secundaria, solo que su especialidad son los antojitos, como chuchitos, tostadas, rellenitos y atoles, los fines de semana por las tardes, como también trabaja en pedidos para determinadas personas, ambas personas trabajan en su domicilio por su propia cuenta.
texts.en:
Duo Margaritas de San Bartolo ("Saint Bartolo's Daisies Duo"). Maria Transita is 60 years old and her partner Zoila Edina is 26 years old. They decided to tackle a new challenge by requesting a loan to FAPE to expand their businesses. Both of them work in commerce. Maria Transita sells fruit and vegetables, as well as an assorted variety of sweets. At the week-end she also sells cooked food. She wants to offer new kinds of food and increase the number of portions she is able to sell. 

Zoila Edina runs a small shop of her property. If the loan is authorised she will be able to offer a greater variety of daily staples for sale. Zoila, just like Transita, also sells food as secondary activity in the afternoons during the week-end, only her specialties are snacks such as tamales, toast, stuffed pasties and atole drinks. She also works on orders for some private individuals. Both of them are self-employed and work from home.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables and to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has six children. Her husband is a farmer. She has been through senior high school. Abena buys fresh fish to smoke for sale at Jukwa market near Abura in Cape Coast. She wants to sell other types of fish and so needs a loan to buy varieties of fish to smoke for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy varieties of fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: Julio Daniel

texts.es:
Julio Daniel tiene 32 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con dos hijos de 8 y 3 años, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luis de Zapotal, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Julio Daniel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es aumentar la produccion.

Le gusta fuhar indor.
texts.en:
Julio Daniel is 32 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children ages 8 and 3 in Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.

The members of the “OUR LAND” cooperative bank can be found located in the precinct of San Luis de Zapotal, which belongs to the canton of Ventanas.  This area dedicates itself to farming tasks related to short cycle crops such as corn and rice.

Julio Daniel is a farmer who plants corn and rice.  He buys his products from the AGRIPAC corporation, and sells them at the wholesale market of Ventanas.

He requests the loan to plant corn and rice, so he can purchase seeds and fertilizers for corn and rice.  The support from this credit would help him financially in order to supply his needs.  He faces challenges such as crop plagues and a lack of funds to pay for more workers.  

His dream is to augment his production.

loans.use: buy seeds and fertilizers for corn and rice.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 25 years old. She is married, has two little kids, and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Annabelle has been growing crops of different classes for two years. By doing so, Annabelle makes a monthly income of 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP).

In 2009, Annabelle joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She is applying for a loan of 5,000 PHP to pay for preparing the land. She hopes to expand her agricultural business and make the best production possible.

loans.use: To pay for preparing land for farming

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 35 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jeana, Philippines.  She is married with four children. 
Alona has a pottery business and earns approximately PHP 2,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan  PHP 10,000 to purchase  clay for pottery making and the labor cost for a pottery worker. 
Alona has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future,

loans.use: To  purchase clay for pottery making and the labor cost for a pottery worker

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El Sr Jaime es electricista y nos informa que tiene la necesidad de solicitar un crédito con nuestra institución para comprar herramienta ya que debido a que le falta ha tenido que rechazar algunos trabajos porque no cuenta con ella para realizarlos, nos informa que el mismo ha mantenido su vivienda  en buenas condiciones y eso es gracias a que puede trabajar, pero si compra mas herramientas económicamente le ira mejor.
texts.en:
Sr. Jaime is an electrician and says that he needs a loan from Credituyo in order to buy tools that he is lacking. He has had to turn down a few jobs because he did not have the necessary equipment to perform the work.

Jaime says that he has been able to keep his home in good condition because he is able to work, but buying more tools will allow him to do better financially.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl, natural de la ciudad de santa rosa, tiene 38 años, es un hombre alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Rebeca de 34 años y sus 03 hijos, a quienes les brinda una adecuada educación. Raúl es un hombre entusiasta de carácter amable, trabaja sus tierras con mucho ahínco para sacar adelante su producción. Él especialmente siembra cacao, café y árboles frutales, plantas originarias de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Menciona que la clave de su éxito radica en la perseverancia y las ganas de trabajar, a la vez sus plantas están trabajadas de manera tecnificada porque recibe capacitación y talleres de manejo de poda y control de plaga de insectos, y eso hace que su producto la mejor calidad. Raúl normalmente trabaja  por cuenta propia, pero en tiempos de cosecha contrata jornaleros, para que de esa manera avance con mayor celeridad en la extracción y selección de su producto. Con el crédito solicitado contratará jornaleros para que le apoyen en las cosechas y desmonte de malezas. Pero al culminar con su faena, trata de no ausentarse de las festividades costumbristas que suelen realizarse en su ciudad, por ello participa jovialmente en las conmemoraciones como se aprecia en la foto. Este será su segundo crédito y se siente muy contento de saber que contará una vez mas con el apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de seguir prosperando y esta dispuesto a devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles que solicita contratará peones para que le apoyen en las cosecha y sacar la maleza de sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Raúl, who is a native of the city of Santa Rosa, is 38 years old.  He is a happy and hard-working man who lives in his own house together with his partner Rebeca, aged 34, and their three children for whom he provides an adequate education.

Raúl is an enthusiastic man with a friendly personality.  He works his lands with much effort so as to progress his production.  In particular, he grows cocoa, coffee, and fruit trees; plants that originally come from the jungle area of the Río Apurimac valley.  He mentions that the key to his success lies in his perseverance and desire to work.  All his plants are worked in in a technical manner, as he has received training in managing pruning and controlling insect infestations, and this makes his crops the best quality.

Raúl normally manages his work himself, but at harvest time he hires workers so as to be speedier in gathering and selecting his product.

With the requested loan, he will hire workers to help him with the harvest and clearing weeds.  But once work is finished he tries not to miss the traditional festivals that take place in his city.  He participates cheerfully in the celebrations, as you can see in the photo.

This will be his second loan.  He is very happy to know that he will once more get financial support, as with this he will feel secure in continuing to prosper, and he is willing to make his scheduled repayments punctually.

With the 3,000 New Soles that he his requesting, he will hire workers to help him with the harvest and clearing the weeds from his plantations.

loans.use: to hire workers.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is married with one child. Jaime is 45 years old and lives in Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur.  To earn a living, Jaime is engaged in a transportation business, serving in his community and he had been in this kind  of business for seven years. Each month, he earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of Php 12,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle and a portion of his loan will go to purchase additional goods to sell in his sari-sari (general) store.

Jaime has been a member of GDMPC for one year.  In the future, Jaime  hopes to purchase another motorcycle for transport.


About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC: people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Maryline

texts.en:
Maryline is 30 years old and married to Peter. They have two children who are in school.

Maryline has a beauty salon that she has been running for sometime and is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy hair conditioners, a blow dryer and shampoos to add to her stock.

She hopes to expand her business by opening a boutique alongside her beauty salon.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, a blow dryer and hair conditioners to add to her stock.

loans.name: Muache

texts.en:
Muache is a married woman with one school-going child. Her husband is employed and contributes in providing for the family's basic needs. Muache has a house with piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Muache has operated a vegetable grocery for the past three years; she also sells piped water. Her potential clients are her neighbors. Muache faces a major challenge of competition from other vegetable grocery operators. She dreams of buying a water tank for her water business.

Muache plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, potatoes and onions for her grocery. She decided to join Yehu because it enables small businesswomen to expand their businesses through loan lending.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as carrots, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Ainur's Group

texts.en:
Ainur is the leader of this group. She is 40 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She brings up three sons and a daughter. Ainur lives and a rural area, therefore she earns money by breeding livestock and reselling it after fattening. She started this business 12 years ago with an initial investment of 1,000 KGS and now her monthly profit is about 10,000 KGS. With money received from the loan, Ainur wants to increase the number of livestock, which will lead to an increase of commodity turnover. In the future, Ainur plans to purchase a vehicle because school, a hospital and the shops are far away.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man, aged 32 living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in the bricklaying business for 6 years and in a bid to increase his income sources, he has also ventured into the transport business. He wants this loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business, which is commonly known as bodaboda by locals.

He dreams of educating his four children and buying a taxi.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
"Determination and patient are the principles of my life," according to Ferdinand, a 39 years old man.  

He lives in the village of La Salette province of Isabela.  His spouse is a full time wife who manages the house and their three children.  Ferdinand and his wife run a farm.

Ferdinand is asking for a loan of P 35,000 to buy sacks of seeds and fertilizer for his farm. 

He dreams that someday his farm will expand so he can offer his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en:
Byambajav, 26, lives with her two brothers in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Dornod province, Mongolia. Her elder brother is a herder and her younger one is a college student. 

Byambajav started her hairdressing business in 2005 by renting a space in the market. Since starting her business, she has become well experienced and has many customers. However, her hairdressing equipment is getting old, therefore she is requesting a loan of 700,000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) to buy equipment from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to buy equipment from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, casual tops, pants, and lingerie.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La señora Juana Francisca es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace 15 años quien vende cabeza de chancho, pesebre, menado…todo lo derivado de chancho desde. Ella inicio este negocio  el crédito lo invertirá en cerdo, chiltoma, tomate, cebolla, vinagre, leña y sal.
texts.en: Señora Juana Francisca is a hard-working and enterprising woman who as sold food for 15 years. She sells pigs' heads and other products from pigs. She will invest this loan in pork, sweet pepper, tomato, onion, vinegar, salt, and firewood.

loans.use: to invest in pork, sweet pepper, tomato, onion, vinegar, salt, and firewood..etc.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Oumar  est né vers 1980 à Bananso préfecture de KADIOLO, il vit avec son épouse et leurs deux garçons à LOULOUNI dans la  troisième région administrative du Mali (Sikasso).
Monsieur  Oumar  fait des prestations de services avec les activités de réparation des mobylettes et bicyclettes. En plus il mène également les activités d’achat et de vente de pièces détachées. 
Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso et à Bamako, acheminées à Loulouni les pièces sont stockées dans une boutique au garage à gauche du goudron près du dispensaire.Il vend au comptant et en détail.
Il est en collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis deux  ans, il est à son deuxième prêt et le prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.  
Il compte acheter, des jantes, des rayons, des pistons, des joints, des pédales et des chambres à air. 
 Il compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 120 000 FCFA, permettra de mieux faire face aux dépenses familiales,  une partie sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts de son prêt et le reste sera investis dans son activité.
Dans l’avenir il envisage d’ouvrir un magasin digne de ce nom avec un hangar d’où il travaillera.
texts.en:
Oumar was born around 1980 in the Bananso prefecture of Kadiolo. He lives with his spouse and their two sons in Loulouni in the third administrative region of Mali (Sikasso).

Oumar has a business providing service and reparing mopeds and bicycles. He also manages the buying and selling of parts. He gets his supplies in Sikasso and in Bamako, heading for Loulouni the parts are stocked in a shop in the garage to the left of the asphalt near the community clinic. He sells for cash and retail. 

He has been collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for two years; he is on his second loan and the previous loan was correctly repaid. 

He plans to buy wheel rims, spokes, pistons, joints, pedals and inner tubes. He plans to make an average monthly profit of 120,000 FCFA with this loan, which will allow him to better take care of family expenses. Part will be used to pay the interest on his loan and the rest will be invested in his business. In the future he envisions opening a store deserving of this name with a shed where he will work.

loans.use: to buy parts.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a married woman who has five children. She is 43 years old and resides in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Mercedita owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and she has been in this business for 8 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase additional products to sell. In 2011, Mercedita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Mercedita wants to build a house and to ensure her children finish their study .

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Moisson Plus Group

texts.en:
Adele is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Moisson Plus”, which means “Harvest” in English. The group is composed of 24 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Adele, 43, became a micro-entrepreneur in 2009. She manages her own general store in the east of Kinshasa. She works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a large store in her area. Her business brings in $40 per week. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by purchasing soaps, cans, sacks of beans and sugar, and milk and reselling them at a profit. Adele is married and the mother of five children whose ages vary between 4 and 15 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to buy soaps, cans, sugar, beans and toilet items to resell at a profit

loans.name: Javier Abdul

texts.es:
Javier, tuvo un efecto positivo con su crédito anterior; tuvo una cosecha más abundante y mejores ingresos, por lo que hoy solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar abono, insecticidas, semilla y la preparación de la tierra para la siembra de plátano y maíz.
Ha logrado mantenerse activo en su actividad económica, cubrió parte de las necesidades de su familia. Anhela seguir aumentando las cosechas para cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Javier's previous loan had a positive effect giving him an abundant harvest and more income.  Therefore, he is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and seed and to prepare the land to plant bananas and corn.

He has been able to stay in business and cover his family's needs.  He wants to continue increasing his production in order to meet his commitments.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Elisabeth, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans est mariée à un ferrailleur nommé Grégoire. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Elisabeth vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Elisabeth et son mari. Elisabeth a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Elisabeth vend des produits de mercerie et des divers produits à son domicile. Elisabeth s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Elisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits de mercerie.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 23 years old. She is not married and lives in Iringa District, Tanzania with her mother. She is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches secondary school students life skills, which helps them to improve their academic performance. Juliana requests a Kiva loan to open up a clothing shop where she can sell a variety of clothes near her village. The profits will help Juliana to buy many clothes and help her mother in paying for household expenses.

loans.use: to open a clothes shop

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde’s husband worked as a truck driver but in 2000 he was fired. Because of this, economic problems appeared for Matilde's family.

Matilde's husband did not get a job and Matilde knew how to build bricks so she told him that it was necessary to build a furnace in her house to make the bricks. They invested part of the money they had and started their microbusiness. Matilde has three sons and now everyone in her house knows how to build bricks because they all work together in the business.

Matilde is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to invest in raw material. She comments that if she invests right now she could be prepared for December and January because these months increase her demand according to her past experience.

**This text has been translated from the original business description.**

El esposo de Matilde se desempeñaba como Trailero, pero en el año 2000 lo desemplearon y con ello se vinieron los problemas económicos. No lograba volver a contratarse con ninguna empresa. Matilde conocía el oficio de fabricación de ladrillos, por lo que lo convenció para construir un horno en el patio de su casa y ponerse a fabricar ladrillos. Fue así como invirtiendo parte de la liquidación iniciaron su microempresa. Tiene 3 hijos y ahora todos conocen el oficio de la fabricación de tabiques, pues todos trabajan en el negocio. Matide esta solicitando apoyo para poder invertir en materias primas, necesita un crédito por la cantidad de US$925 el cual piensa pagar en 6 meses. Esta inversión le permitirá solventar la inversión inicial, pues existe todo un proceso de fabricación y hacia diciembre y enero, la demanda aumenta, por lo que necesitan estar preparados con suficiente mercancía. Comenta que la experiencia de años anteriores le ha enseñado a sacar ventaja de la oportunidad que se le presenta.

loans.use: To purchase raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add more stock of electronics, accessories utensils and crockery

loans.name: Ni

texts.en: Ni is 53 years old, and is single. She provides for her 86-year-old mother and her mentally ill sister. They have no land aside from the 30 square meters for their home. Ni’s family earns only $5 per person per month from Ni's small grocery store. Ni requests a loan of $75 to increase the items she can sell in her store and grow her business.

loans.use: To supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Tran

texts.en: Mrs. K. is 44 yrs. old and together with her husband she lives in Ngoc Thanh commune, a rural area in Hung Yen province, approx. 50 miles south of Hanoi. They have 2 children, 24 and 18 yrs. old, who are both at school (college and university). A long time ago they realized that education is expensive in Vietnam, so they started saving. Their income is $62.50 per month and education is $80.00 per month. They have rice paddies, raise pigs, and make clothes, but their main business is making rice wine. The loan will be used to buy rice, so they can make more wine and increase their income.

loans.use: To buy more rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Kneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Kneang N. is 39 years old and the mother of one school-going child. To service her family’s living expenses, she rents rooms to the people in her area, which earns her around $7 each day. Her husband (pictured here because Kneang N. is not available) is a motor-taxi driver, earning on average $3/day in revenue.

Mrs Kneang N. hopes to used this $1,000 loan to open a shop selling soft drinks and some kind of grocery products to earn more income. In the future, she would like to expand her business and save enough money for her child’s education.

loans.use: To open  a shop selling soft drinks and grocery items

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
Ni MAde S. is a model of extraordinary mother and wife. In her daily life, she helps her husband as a construction labor, runs a farm. These works are done just to supplement her family's income and pay tuitions for her two children. She has run her pig farm for a while, however high cost for feeds and piglets makes it impossible for her to expand her business. She understands that pig farm can be promising financially. The profit from the difference of selling revenue and daily cost and additional revenue stream from selling excrement as fertilizer is quite promising. This increases her motivation to expand her farm and increase her pigs. With additinal funding and training from DINARI, Ni Made S. can add 2 more pigs to her farm so she can have 3 pigs at a time. Piglets costs her $33 each and feeds supply for 4 months costs her $55,so she can earn $100 per 4 month periods. With this additional business income, Ni Made S. can afford to send her two children to school.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Made S. merupakan potret seorang ibu sekaligus istri yang luar biasa. Dalam keseharian hidupnya ia mampu membantu suami dalam pekerjaan membangun rumah , bertani sekaligus beternak babi. Pekerjaan itu ia kerjakan semata-mata untuk menambah pendapatan keluarga sekaligus membiayai sekolah kedua orang anaknya. Usaha beternak babi telah lama ia geluti, akan tetapi harga pakan dan bibit yang tinggi membuat istri dari I Wayan Kariasa ini tidak dapat mengembangkan usahanya. Ia paham betul beternak babi sangat menjanjikan, keuntungan dari selisih penjualan dan biaya yang dikeluarkan sekaligus limbah berupa pupuk kandang membulatkan tekadnya untuk menambah jumlah babi yang dipelihara. Dengan tambahan modal dan pelatihan dari DINARI, Ni Made S. bisa menambah populasi babi lagi 2 ekor. Sehingga total ia memelihara saat ini sejumlah 3 ekor. Dengan harga bibit Rp. 300.000.- / ekor dan biaya pakan selama 4 bulan pemeliharaan sebesar Rp. 500.000.- maka ia akan mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 900.000.- / 4 bulan. Dengan tambahan pendapatan dari usaha ini, Ni Made S. mampu menyekolahkan kedua orang anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase piglets

loans.name: Sum

texts.en: Mrs. Sum K. H., 47, is a mother of four children and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She runs a stand in front of a secondary school selling various kinds of biscuits and candies to students passing by. She can earn on average around $4 per day of profit, while her husband is employed as a high school teacher, making around $2 per day. Mrs. Sum K. H. is humbly requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing a food cart and icebox to also sell sugar cane juice on the street in front of the school. (Her husband who is a teacher is pictured because Sum K. H. was unavailable).

loans.use: To purchase a street cart to sell sugar cane juice

loans.name: Ayayi

texts.fr:
Mr. Ayayi A. is 32, married, and the father of three children. He lives in Bè-kpota, a neighborhood in Lomé, the capital of Togo, and runs a little restaurant where he prepares only pork, a dish the local inhabitants dearly love. Very ambitious and intent on improving his little business, he is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to refurbish his restaurant and hire some new waitresses so as to better satisfy his clientele. He would also like to sell drinks since his customers are asking him to do so. This will allow him to earn more and thus support his family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur Ayayi A. est âgé de 32 ans. Il est marié et père de trois (03) enfants. Il habite le quartier de Bè-kpota et détient un restaurant où il prépare uniquement la viande de porc très apprécié par la population. Très ambitieux et voulant rehausser son activité, il sollicite un financement de $1000 pour l’aménagement de son restaurant et acquérir de nouvelles serveuses pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Il veut aussi associer la vente de boissons sur demande de ses clients. Ceci lui permettra d’accroître son revenu pour le mieux être de sa famille.

loans.use:
Refurbishment of his restaurant

Aménagement de restaurant

loans.name: Thi Lan

texts.vi:
Mrs Lan is 24. She has a young child. Her family raises poultry and sells eggs, this is their main income. On average, they make 3-5 USD a day. It's enough to make ends meet. She has never borrowed money before. When she learned of Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) and its loan condition, she has applied for a loan of 150 USD to invest in her poultry business. She will use the loan to buy feed for her poultry thus raising her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lan, 24 tuổi, có một con nhỏ. Cuộc sống của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi gà, vịt và bán trứng. Thu nhập trung bình của hai vợ chồng từ 50000-70000đ/ngày. Nói chung cũng tương đối đủ sống. Chị chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu, nhưng được biết tới những tiện ích mà Chương trình Tài chính vi mô binhminh cdc đem lại, chị đã vay 2006000đ để mua thức ăn chăn nuôi, tăng gia sản xuất.

loans.use: To buy feed for poultry

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel started selling chicken by chance. 28 years ago, together with her husband, she would breed chicken and hens. Nevertheless, at some point she sold the eggs that she had in excess and later on she also started selling chicken.

Nowadays, she only breeds chicken on special occasions, like Christmas, when she receives special orders from her clients. Thanks to her business, to the help of her husband and to her inner-strength, she has been able to support her children and provide them with an education.

Isabel just turned 60 and she would like to open a store at her home to sell the chicken.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Vender pollos solo fue una casualidad para Isabel. Hace 28 años ella, junto a su esposo, se dedicaba a criar pollos y gallinas ponedoras de huevo. No obstante, en un tiempo tuvo la oportunidad de vender ella misma huevos, ya que los tenía en grandes cantidades.

Poco a poco fue incluyendo a sus ventas los pollos que ella criaba. Hasta que se dedico por completo a la venta de pollos y dejo de lado la crianza de ellos. Solo por temporadas vuelve a la crianza, como en Navidad que lo hace porque recibe pedidos de algunos clientes. Gracias a su negocio, a la ayuda de su esposo y a la fuerza que nunca la abandona, ella ha podido mantener a sus hijos y darles educación.

Isabel acaba de cumplir setenta años y está pensando abrir una bodega en su casa.

loans.use: To open a  butcher shop at her home (to sell chicken)

loans.name: Satupaitea Satufia 2 Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
After four weeks of rigorous business training, these four women of Satupaitea Satufia on the island of Savaii, passed theirwritten tests on the SPBD principles (business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee) to ensure their first group loan from SPBD. Over the next year, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

Faleieiroma S., 23, is married to a farmer and has two children. She grows cabbages and tomatoes in her vegetable garden. She wishes to use her loan to purchase a weed killing sprayer and pesticides, vegetable seeds, fertilizer and 2 bush knives. She will sell her produce three days a week to the public and people from her village.

Aveina T., 32, married, has five children. She has over three years of experience baking donuts and pork cakes and growing taro. She will use her loan to purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, a knife, a filing, cabbage seeds and fertilizer.

Fuatino U., 33, is divorced with three children. She maintains a taro plantation and sells her produce at a fair price twice a week. With her loan, she will purchase a weed killing sprayer, pesticides, 2 bush knives, a spade, a shovel, a knife filing. This will also pay for her transportation needs.

Loimata A., 28, is married with two children. With over two years of experience, she grows cabbage and cucumber and sells them twice a week. She will use her loan to purchase pesticides, a wheel barrow, 2 knives, a shovel, a spade, a filing and laborers.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Santos Margarito

texts.es:
Santos O. has been a farmer for 15 years in the municipality of Condega in Estelí, Nicaragua. Through his many sacrifices he is characterized as a great worker who has helped maintain his household.

Mr O.' family has passed through some very difficult economic times. Ceprodel has helped him with credits that have allowed him to improve his situation through the purchase of and investment in fertilizer for his crops. Once again Mr O. asks for a loan to purchase fertilizers and other products to improve his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Santos O. se dedica al negocio agropecuario desde hace 15 años en el municipio de Condega en Estelí de Nicaragua. Con mucho esfuerzo se ha caracterizado por ser un gran trabajador que ha logado mantener su hogar compuesto por su esposa e hijo.

Es de mucha necesidad recalcar que a través de los años la familia del señor O. ha atravesado difíciles circunstancias económicas sin embargo, Ceprodel le ha apoyado con créditos que le han permitido mejorar dicha situación por medio de la compra de semillas para siembra e inversión en los cultivos. Una vez mas el señor O. solicita un préstamo en Ceprodel para la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos que den lugar al trabajo en el cultivo.

loans.use: To improve his crops

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 24 year-old Ester S.. She is married, and has two children ages 1 and 18 months. In 2007, Ester established her takeaway kiosk business. Ester requires a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of soda, candy, snacks, and phone credit vouchers. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of soda, candy, snacks, and phone credit vouchers for her takeaway kiosk.

loans.name: Sokona

texts.fr:
Ms. Sokona S., age 22, is the mother of two and currently lives with her children in her aunt's home in Sanoubougou, one of the districts of the city of Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). At a young age, she started earning money because she quit school due to social reasons. Two years ago, she became specialized in a sector where there is a strong demand, that is, the sale of clothing and articles for women.

Because of difficulty obtaining sufficient financial resources, she joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and is on her first loan.

She gets her inventory in Bobo Dioulasso (a city in the Republic of Burkina Faso, in West Africa). Then she displays her goods in her shop in Sikasso. She sells retail as much as she does wholesale. With this loan, she intends to buy two lengths of Wax-brand, one length of men's fabric, three dozen of Gel, four dozen of beauty cream, one dozen women's hair extensions, and one box of bath soap. This business is run year-round. Her high business turnover enables her to realize a monthly benefit of 100,000 francs CFA. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA. Thanks to this profit, she will pay the loan interest, ensure covering her own expenses, and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Mademoiselle Sokona S. agée de 22 ans est mère de 2 enfants et vit actuellement avec ses enfants chez sa tante à Sanoubougou I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la République du Mali). Elle a commencé très jeune les activités économiques en raison de l’abandon de l’école pour des raisons sociales. Elle s’est spécialisée dans un secteur ou il ya une forte demande à savoir la vente des habits et articles feminins il ya de cela deux ans.

En raison des difficultés d’obtenir des ressources financières suffisantes, elle intégra le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et est à son premier pret .

Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (une ville de la République de Burkina Faso en Afrique de l’ouest). Ensuite elle expose ses produits dans sa boutique à Sikasso. Elle vend aussi bien en détail qu’en gros. Avec ce pret elle compte achéter 2 Pièces de Wax, 1 pièce de tissus pour homme , 3 douzaines de Gel, 4 douzaines de crème de beauté 1 douzaine de Mèche pour femmes et 1 carton de savon de toilette. Cette activité est menée durant toute l’année . La rotation de son activité élévée, lui permet de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA.. Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA par mois. Grâce à ce bénéfice elle paiera les interets du pret; assurera certaines de ses propre dépenses et investira le reste dans son activité..

loans.use: To buy cloth and various items for her shop

loans.name: Benkadi (L’Union Fait La Force) Group

texts.fr:
The members of the Benkadi Group are all married and average 41 years of age and five children.
