On his mother’s land, Frankin raises cattle and cultivates potatoes. Meanwhile, he also works in construction in the city of Pimampiro. Since he was very young, he has dedicated himself to his cattle, agriculture and construction work. He works alongside his common-law wife in caring for the cattle. 

Franklin is seeking this loan to purchase a young bull, potato seeds and tools. He has been working with FODEMI for three years and reports that his life has changed a lot because he was able to increase his ability to purchase cattle and make returns on his investments. In the future, Franklin’s goals are to fix up his house and continue to increase his herd of cattle. 

The photo shows Franklin on his day job working in construction. He works many jobs and has many responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy a young bull, potato seeds and tools for construction.

loans.name: Muhabbatshoh

texts.en:
For the past six years, Muhabbatshoh has worked in agriculture, raising cattle. He raises cattle, which he cares for greatly since thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. Muhabbatshoh showed us his animals with great happiness as his cattle were about to be vaccinated against the various sicknesses that affect that type of livestock. For Muhabbatshoh, it is very important to work at raising his animals. That is why he is currently seeking a loan to purchase additional cattle to earn more money. That will help his family to generate additional income. Muhabbatshoh appreciates your support for his project.      

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Dometila has a food shop that sells snacks like rice and pancakes. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Dometila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Dometila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Edy Moises

texts.es:
Moisés nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 29 años de edad. Actualmente, él vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde realiza sus actividades económicas. Él se dedica a la venta de libros educativos por mayor y menor, él viaja a la ciudad de Lima una vez al mes a comprar sus productos y después distribuye a diferentes ciudades como por ejemplo Quillabamba, Puerto Maldonado y Sicuani. En esta oportunidad Moisés requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como revistas educativas. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen de Chapi” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Moisés was born in the city of Cusco (Perú).  He’s 29 years old.  He currently lives in the city of his birth where he carries out his economic activities.  

He sells educational books at wholesale and retail.  He travels to the city of Lima once a month to buy his products that he then sells in various cities like Quillabamba, Puerto Maldonado and Sicuani, for example.  On this occasion, Moisés wants the loan to buy more merchandise like educational magazines.

The “Virgen de Chapi” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is well known for being a very touristic and commercial zone, for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like educational periodicals.

loans.name: Bimarck Antonio

texts.es: Bismarck Antonio se dedica a la carpintería. Tiene más de 11 años que tiene este negocio. El se encuentra muy agradecido con este medio de vida que le ha proporcionado los ingreso necesarios, tiene 3 hijos menores de edad a su cargo,  pues necesitaba obtener más ingresos para mantener a su familia. El es un hombre muy responsable que ha adquirido cierta experiencia con su negocio y sus clientes. Este crédito es para la compra de pega, clavos, madera, cepillos, serruchos, cierra entre otros.
texts.en: Bismarck Antonio is a carpenter. He has had his business for over 11 years.  He is thankful for the standard of living that his income has allowed.  He is raising three children, so it has been necessary to increase his income to support his family.  He is a very responsible man who has learned from his experience with his business and his customers.  This loan is to buy varnish, nails, wood, brushes, saws and more.

loans.use: to buy varnish, nails, wood, brushes, saws and more.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en:
Farming is the top one of many sectors in Cambodia.   Duk is a person who earns a low-income from this business. She has learned this skill from her parents . She and her husband who is a taxi driver have three children. Her husband has an income of about $5 a day.

Her children always pay for a motor taxi when they need to go to school or anywhere in and around their village. To reduce  traveling costs, Duk has decided to request a loan from HKL partner with Kiva in order to purchase a new motorcycle for her children to use to drive to school as well as for traveling needs. Mrs. Duk hopes she will use the funds saved to enlarge her house and to help her children to finish a high level of education.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her children to drive to school.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She has a business selling beer and local waragi in South Sudan. She has been in this business for three years.
Viola requested this loan through Kiva partner, BRAC South Sudan, with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that in the future she will use the extra income from this loan to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beer and local brewery waragi for sale.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with four school-going children. Her husband is a chef who contributes in providing for the family's basic needs. Hadija has a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Hadija has operated a charcoal and firewood sales business for the past three years; her potential clients are the local residents. She faces a major challenge of transportation from the point of purchase to her place of sale. Hadija dreams of expanding her business.

Hadija plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale. She decided to join Yehu because it helps small entrepreneurs through loan lending.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal and firewood for resale.

loans.name: Massamba Ndour

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme agé , marié et père de 4 enfants qui sont tous à l'école.Il est chauffeur dans une boulangerie de sa localité .En meme temps, il exerce le commerce de tissus et d'article de fete.Il sollicite un pret de 150000f pour acheter des tissus "thioub" et "ganila" à l'occasion de la fete de "Tabaski".Il ambitionne d'acheter un véhicule et de me mettre en location.
texts.en: The borrower is an older married man, father to four children who are all in school. He is a delivery man for a bakery in his town. At the same time, he does business as a seller of fabrics and party products. He is asking for a loan for 1150000F to buy "thioub" and "ganila" fabrics for the Tabaski festival. He aspires to buy a vehicle and put it up for rentals.

loans.use: to buy "thioub" and "ganila" fabrics

loans.name: Obed

texts.en: Obed is a thirty-five-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in the supermarket business for six years. He acquired capital from savings he earned as a teacher. His hardships are high fuel and transport costs and few customers. His personal goal is educating his children and his business goal is expanding his business into new markets. Obed needs the loan facility to buy soda and eggs for sale

loans.use: To buy soda and eggs for sale

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en: Modesto is 48 years old and is a married man with two children. Modesto is a farmer working in Talibon, Bohol. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Modesto also runs a rice mill. He requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor of farmers he hired to till his land. Modesto works hard to improve his business and his family's quality of living. He also desires to have his children finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old.  He is married and has three school-aged children.  They live in Angadanan, Isabela where he manages their corn field.  He has been doing his farming business for ten years.  Richard only received P3,000 with his last crop because of an unexpected typhoon.  His wife also engages in a hog-raising business for extra income.  They are both thankful because the income they generate from their businesses helps them to provide daily needs and to be able to send their children to school.

Right now, Richard is requesting a loan of P40,000 to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his farming business.  He hopes that he can get the amount he requested and he is promising to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his farming business.

loans.name: Cora De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Doña Cora, reside  en el departamento de Masaya. Es casada y su negocio lo tiene desde hace 8 años. El negocio consiste en  la compra y venta de productos de ropa, la clientela que ella tiene es de Masaya y por la demanda  ella quiere invertirle más a su negocio ya que está teniendo muchos pedidos.

Se acerca a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de pantalones, camisas, shores, blusas, faldas, camisolas, brasear, bóxer, calcetas y calcetines de varón y mujer. 

Considera que con esta ayuda que le proporciona Ceprodel  aumentará sus ingresos, y por ende mejorará las condiciones de vida en la familia.
texts.en: Cora resides in the department of Masaya, Nicaragua. She is married and has had her business for the past eight years. Her business consists of buying and selling articles of clothing. Her clientele is from Masaya, and because of the demand she wants to invest more into her store because she is getting a lot of orders. She is turning to Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, skirts, brassieres, boxers, stockings and socks for men and women. She thinks this support will increase her revenue, which in turn will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, shorts, blouses, skirts, brassieres, boxers, stockings and socks for men and women.

loans.name: El Ciruelito Group

texts.es:
Mariana cuenta con 55 años de edad es casada su esposo se llama narciso es campesino tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando Jacqueline esta en la prepa al igual que David y Ruth esta en la secundaria.

Ella es comerciante hace mandiles y los vende sale a venderlos a pueblos cercanos ya tiene 15 años con el negocio el préstamo lo invertirá en comprar tela para hacerlo y ella espera buenos resultados con el negocio ya que le gusta mucho su trabajo.

Mariana pertenece al grupo el ciruelito que esta integrado por 11 mujeres trabajadoras que a continuación serán mencionadas: MA Elvis, Carmela, Evelia, Isabel, Elia, Prajedis, Lina Ivett, Joaquina, Enoemi, mariana, Alejandra, todas realizan una actividad comercial como son: venta de frutas y verduras, ropa, abarrotes, etc.,
texts.en:
Mariana is 55 years old and married. Her husband is named Narciso and he is a farmworker. They have three school-aged children. Jacqueline attends secondary school along with Ruth and David.
Mariana is a businesswoman. She makes aprons and sells them in the neighboring villages. She has been doing this for the past fifteen years. With this loan she will buy fabric. She is hoping for a good outcome for her business as she likes to do this work.
Mariana belongs to the group called "El Ciruelito". It has eleven members that we would like to name. They are MA Elvis, Carmela, Evelia, Isabel, Elia, Prajedis, Lina, Ivett, Joaquina, Enoemi, Mariana and Alejandra. They run various businesses such as selling fruits and vegetables, selling clothes, selling groceries, etc.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: C13018 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Francoise is 28 years old and has one child who is 5 years old. She sells charcoal from 6 am until 6 pm every day. She is the leader of the group called "C13018 Twitezimbere" in the local language. Francoise has 5 years of experience in this business. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by buying more charcoal to sell. With the profit, Francoise will be able to reinvest in her business and to pay medical insurance for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Basit

texts.en: Basit is married and a father of three children. He is 33 years old and lives in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Basit used his last loan to buy snack items to resell. His business is flourishing. Now he is busy with his other business, which is running a general store. Now he is taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand his product offering. In the future, he hopes to become prosperous in business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand his product offerings

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
8 de Diciembre es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, las señoras están muy esperanzadas en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras, es por ello que se unieron y de esa forma trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras. Son personas muy emprendedoras y trabajadoras, que desean poder ayudar a sus familias.
Maria es una de estas mujeres trabajadoras, ella comenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser de chanchos, gallinas y patos. Ella dice que su trabajo es muy sacrificado y cansador, pero que pese a ello le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues es un trabajo digno y honesto, además de eso es el sustento principal de su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de pollitos y patos pequeños, además de alimentos para estos, lo cual será de mucha ayuda para ella. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la gran oportunidad de progreso que le da.
texts.en:
The December 8th Group is from the city of Curuguaty. The women have put a lot of hope in the program for women in business. For this reason they got together to work and help one another. They are very entrepreneurial and hard-working people who desire to help their families.

Maria is one of these hard-working women. She shares that she works raising and selling animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks. She says her work requires a lot of sacrifice and is tiring, but she really enjoys what she does, and it is a dignified and honest job. Additionally, it is her family's main source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy chicks and small ducks, and food for these birds. This loan will help her a lot. She is thankful to the foundation and Kiva for providing the opportunity to get ahead..

loans.use: To buy chicks and young ducks to raise and food for the animals.

loans.name: Sav

texts.en: Sav is 61 years old. She is a mother of four children and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She farms rice and raises animals. She earns about $2 per day. Her husband is a retired teacher--his pension is about $3 per day. Three of her children are soldiers. They earn about $9 per day. Due to her family's difficulty in commuting, Sav is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a motorbike. This purchase would enable her to use the money saved on her transportation expenses to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to commute.

loans.name: Vumila

texts.en: Vumilia is 27 years old. She is married and she has one child. Vumilia is a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills at her nearby secondary school. Apart from volunteering teaching life skills, Vumila also runs a pharmacy business. Vumilia requested a Kiva loan to expand her business. Profit obtained from the loan will help Vumilia to buy varieties of medicine for her pharmacy.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Kanoti's Group

texts.en:
Kanoti is 24 years old, has one child, and lives in Pap Ndege village in Ndhiwa sub county Kenya. Kanoti works as a peasant farmer for a living. His community of Pap Ndege village does not have access to clean water. The water that is used for drinking and cooking is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause diarrhea and other water-borne diseases.  Kanoti is a friendly member of the community, and has been elected Promoter by his village to help its members obtain safe drinking water.

As a volunteer Promoter, Kanoti represents the community on Kiva’s website and educates the community on how to protect their families from unsafe drinking water by using a chlorine dispenser system. Kanoti and two other promoters in his community - Francis and Lucia - need a loan to cover the costs of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. Kanoti wants to be a promoter because he believes that the chlorine dispenser will make water safe for use.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community, through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce their carbon footprint will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Kanoti’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To allow his community to treat water to make it safe to drink using chlorine dispensers

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.en:
In my country, “pupusas” are one of our favorite meals, and so are French fries. For this reason, I have a few years of making and selling these. I sale right outside the room where I live, in one of the main streets of my community. People are always asking for something different, and this helps me to have good sales, especially during the weekends. Currently, one of my children is going to college, and I help him with his expenses. My income helps me pay for utilities, healthcare and food.

Loan Use: Corn flour, cabbage, potatoes, butter, wood, spices, and others.

En nuestro pais las pupusas es uno de nuestras comidas favoritas, al igual que las papas fritas, por lo que tengo algunos años de dedicarme a la elaboracion y venta de estos alimentos. Mis ventas las hago frente a mi casa de habitacion en una de las principales calles de mi colonia. Las personas siempre quieren comer algo diferente lo que me ayuda a tener buenas ventas, especialmente los fines de semana. Actualmente tengo 1 hijo estudiando en la universidad y le ayudo con sus gastos, mis ingresos me ayudan a pagar los servicios publicos, mi salud y alimentacion.

loans.use: Harina de maiz, repollo, papas, manteca, leña, condimentos y otros.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Susan would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence W. is a 41-year-old man; he is married and has 3 children. He is also taking care of his niece whose mother passed away and of his brother who was crippled by polio. He helps the Saidia Furaha Children’s home and teaches them tailoring skills.          
After finishing secondary school, Lawrence enrolled at Kiti Nakuru training center in the Rift Valley Province of Kenya where he took a Diploma course in clothing and textiles for 4 years. After completion of this course, he went back to his rural home to do farming due to lack of money and other employment opportunities. He worked very hard at his parents’ farm, but later decided to move back to Nairobi in search of other work. He managed to land a job in a tailoring shop at Kitengela, a town in the outskirts of Nairobi, where he worked for one year. He was later employed at the Saidia Furaha Children’s home as an instructor of tailoring. From the salary he was getting he managed to save Ksh 20,000.00 (US$330) and to start his own textile shop while still working at the children’s home. Lawrence has a loving heart and decided to voluntarily work for the children’s home, which he still does today. 
Lawrence needs a loan of US$700 to expand his business. The loan will enable him to purchase a stock of cloth materials, lining and binding materials, zips, buttons, etc. for his textiles shop. He will also employ people from his community, thus creating employment. Lawrence will also be able to help fund the children’s home and serve his customers more efficiently. The repayment period for this loan will be 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for a textiles shop - cloth, lining materials, zips, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Tra

texts.en: Mrs Tra L. T. is experienced in selling food products. She is 43 and is living in Marcory a suburb in the south of the Abidjan region. She started selling on Marcory’s open market since the very beginning of its opening in 1987. Divorced, she lives with her 8 children at their apartment. Ground nuts, corn, apples, salt, ginger, fish powder and rice are usual products she sold to customers. She needs a loan to extend her activity in order to increase revenues and care to her children education expenses. She is an honest woman who has always reimbursed her loans in good manners since she joined AE&I microcredit program in May 2005.

loans.use: Tra Lou Toe will use the loan to pay education expenses

loans.name: Noeun

texts.en: Mrs. Noeun V., 30, is a mother of two school-aged children and lives with her husband in SiemReap province, Cambodia. She works in her laundry shop, earning around $4 each day in revenue, whilst her husband works as an officer at an institution where he can earn around $3 each day.  Mrs. Noeun V. hopes to use this loan to purchase a washing machine, so that her business would be better, faster, and easier.

loans.use: To purchase a washing machine to facilitate her business

loans.name: Chhean

texts.en: Mrs. Chhean M., age 45, works with her husband in their rice paddy growing crops, earning collectively around $3 per day from selling their crops. They have four children, one who works at a company as a driver, one who is a mechanic, and two who are unemployed. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase yams from the grower and then resell them at the market for a good profit. This will enable her to generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase yams from the grower and then resell them at the market for a good profit

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
Señora Wilma is 36 years old, she lives with her partner and has two children aged 12 and 8: the two are studying at the local public school. They live in their own house which they managed to build with considerable sacrifice.

Wilma has a well-stocked grocery store in her house, from here she sells all sorts of essential goods and supplies, such as sugar, rice, meat, dairy products, bread, tinned goods, etc.

The loan that this client is asking for will be used to purchase merchandise for her business wholesale, as she has already been offered a good price from her suppliers for the end-of-year festivities.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Wilma tiene 36 años, vive en pareja y tiene dos hijos, de 12 años y 8 años, los dos estudian en una escuela publica de la zona, viven en una casa propia que la construyeron con mucho sacrificio.

Wilma tiene una despensa bien surtida en su domicilio, donde vende todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad tales como azúcar, arroz, carnes, lácteos, panificados, productos enlatados, etc.

El crédito que solicita el cliente es para la compra de mercaderías al por mayor para su negocio, ya que se le presento una buena oferta de sus proveedores por las fiestas de fin de año

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, rice, flour, tinned products and soft drinks.

loans.name: Kabawo I(C) Group

texts.en:
This group has been together for one year. Betty is 40 years old, married and has five children. Her husband sells used clothes. Betty has a brick laying business. She usually earns 170, 000 shillings in profit each week. She wants to use the extra profit to reinvest in the brick business and also to improve the welfare of her family.

Aisha, Irene and Hadija all have poultry businesses and want to use the loan to construct more poultry houses.

Agnes sells soft drinks and intends to increase her stock with the loan.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: to invest in their businesses

loans.name: Mileidy Del Socorro

texts.es:
Farming is exhausting work, exposed to the sun and worn out from the effort it requires. Aware of this, Mileidy has earned a living farming for more than 10 years in the "municipio" of Achuapa near the Nicaraguan city of Leon.

Mileidy is a very hard-working person who thanks to the great sacrifices she's made has managed to improve her house, lacking only an investment in electric lighting, having only had lanterns for night lighting up to now. To meet this need, she's asking that a solar panel be installed at her house. She's looking for a loan from Ceprodel to get the money she needs to cover the debt and gain the benefits of being able to light her house at night.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

El trabajo de agricultura requiere de mucho esfuerzo por la exposición al sol y el desgaste físico que este trabajo provoca. Consiente de esto la señora Mileidy C. se dedica a este negocio desde hace mas de 10 años en el municipio de Achuapa en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua.

Mileidy se caracteriza por ser una persona muy trabajadora que gracias a los grandes sacrificios que ha realizado ha logrado mejorar su casa de habitación faltándole solamente invertir en la iluminación ya que lo hace con candiles por la noche. Para suplir esta necesidad, solicita que le implementen un panel solar en su hogar y al obtenerlo se ve en la obligación de pagar este panel. Es por tal razón que busca créditos en Ceprodel para obtener el dinero necesario para cubrir esta deuda y de esta manera continuar esforzándose grandemente y sacarle mas provecho a los días por medios de las actividades que le permite realizar la energía eléctrica por medio del panel solar.

loans.use: Pay for solar panel.

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.ru:
Sheraly B. lives in the region of Rudaki. He is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. Sheraly graduated from high school; he does not work anywhere. The only source of income for his family is an animal rearing business, which works out well in the rural area. Sheraly has a small cow barn where he grows calfs for sale. He purchases young animals on local markets, takes care of them for about 40-45 days, when animals get bigger he sells them on the same markets. Now is the season of animal trading, therefore the client needs additional help. He needs additional money, and this is why he came to us in order to obtain a loan. Additional resources will help him not only to purchase more animals, but also to receive profit, which he needs. This will help his family to have a little bit of a better life. The client plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобокулов Шерали Акмирзоевич проживаетв района Рудаки. Возраст 34 года. Женат .Имеет двоих детей. Образование среднее, нигде не работает . Единственным источником дохода его семьи является занятие частным предпринимательством в сфере животноводства, что актуально в сельской местности. Имеет небольшой коровник, в нем он разводит бычков для продажи. Покупает молодых животных на рынке , откармливает их около 40-45 дней , после того как они подрастут , клиент их продает там же , на тех же рынках. Сейчас начался сезон торговли животными , поэтому клиенту нужно как –то увеличить товарооборот. Для этого ему необходимы дополнительные деньги, а для этого он обратился к нам и хочет получить кредит. Дополнительные средства помогут ему не только увеличить товарооборот , но и получить доход в котором он так нуждается. Это поможет его семье немного улучшить свою жизнь. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase calfs

loans.name: Happy

texts.en: Happy is thirty-six years old and a divorced mother with five children. All her children are in school. She has been selling used ladies' bags, belts and purses for the past ten years. Happy buys her wares from Accra to retail in her town. She wants to use her loan to buy more bags and purses to increase sales and income so as to increase her savings to enable her take care of the children’s education. She is a member of the group called Royal Priesthood. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more used ladies' bags and purses.

loans.name: Twelwike

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26 year-old Twelwike M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 5 months and 8 years.

In 2000, Twelwike established her cocoa business. Now, she needs a loan in order to buy the cocoa in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility, as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy cocoa in bulk.

loans.name: Soumba

texts.fr:
Mrs. Soumba Koné is 58 years old and lives with her husband and her 7 children in an extended family household in the 1st district in the town of Ségou.

Since her youth, she has been interested in business activities, notably commerce. It was her husband who gave her the idea of specializing in the purchase and sale of fruits 10 years ago.

She supplies herself in the villages of Gara and Baguineda and sells her fruits at the market in Ségou everyday. It is on Mondays, the town fair days, that she realizes the most sales.

In order to increase her working capital, she decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso by taking part in a solidarity loan association in her district. After 7 rounds of solidarity loans, all repaid without problems, she is on her first individual loan.

She intends to use this loan to buy 10 loads of mangoes and 5 loads of zaban and thereby realize a monthly profit of 150,000 CFA. With this profit, she will pay off the interest on her loan and contribute to the family expenses (education, health, food, etc.)

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Soumba Koné a 58 ans et vit avec son mari et ses 7 enfants dans une famille élargie au 1er quartier de la ville de Ségou.

Dès son jeune age elle s’est intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce .C’est son mari qui lui a donné l’idée de se spécialiser dans la l’achat vente des fruits et cela depuis 10 ans.

Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages de Gara,de Baguineda ;et vend ses fruits au marché de Ségou tous les jours.C’est le Lundi, jour de foire de la ville, qu’elle réalise le plus de vente.

Afin d’accroître son fonds de commerce elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso en intégrant une association de crédit solidaire de son quartier. Après 7 cycles de prêts solidaires, tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son 1er prêt individuel.

Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 10 chargements de mangues ; 5 chargements de « Zaban » et ainsi réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 150 000 CFA. Avec ce bénéfice, elle paiera les intérêts du prêt et contribuera aux dépenses de la famille (éducation santé nourriture etc.)

loans.use: To buy fruit

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
This group was formed thanks to Lucia G. and Marta Domínguez, who contacted the foundation interested in the program Committee of Enterprising Women. They are from the La Conquista settlement within the La Lomita neighborhood.

These women, along with the other ladies who make up the group, comprise part of a faction of people denominated as “without roofs”. These people have nowhere to live (neither a house or land) and, together with hundreds of other people in the same situation, joined together to fight for their rights. Today, they live in a settlement which they created a year ago which the government subsequently bought to be able to build them homes so they could live there legally.

In this settlement live several families looking to get ahead. The women play an important role since, in many cases, they are the head of household. It’s in this way that 15 women from the settlement gathered together to form the group called La Esperanza (which means “hope”). They carry out a variety of activities: the sale of garlic, medicinal herbs, food sales, some have stores, others sell blankets, sheets, clothing, toys, housewares, cleaning products, etc.

Given that the settlement is in a remote area, they must travel to get to the nearest clinics. It’s for this reason that Marta decided to take courses in medicine and it is she who gives injections, takes blood pressure readings and provides immediate medical care for those who need it.

It is a very unified group and the women, in addition to dedicating themselves to their particular activities, also carry out extra tasks to earn more funds to help improve the neighborhood.

Today they need a loan to invest in their businesses, especially to buy merchandise to offer for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Este Comité se formo gracias a la señoras Lucia G. y Marta Domínguez, quienes llamaron a la fundación interesadas en el programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, ellas son del Asentamiento “La Conquista” del Barrio “La Lomita”.

Estas señoras, al igual que las demás mujeres que comprende este comité, forman parte de un grupo de gente denominado “sin techo”. Estas personas no poseían un lugar (ni casa ni tierra) donde vivir, y que unidos entre cientos de personas en igual situación, lucharon por su derecho y hoy día viven en un asentamiento que tomaron juntos el año pasado y que posteriormente el estado adquirió compro para poder construirles casas para que vivan ahí de forma legal.

En ese asentamientos existen varias familias que también buscan su progreso, las mujeres cumplen roles importantes pues son, en la mayoría de los casos, cabeza de familia. Es así como 15 mujeres de este asentamiento se unieron y formaron un comité que llamado “La Esperanza”. Ellas realizan distintos tipos de actividades entre ellas: venta de ajo, hierbas medicinales, venta de comidas, otras tienen despensas, otras poseen mercerías en donde venden colchas, sabanas, ropas, juguetes, artículos para el hogar, productos de limpieza, etc.

Debido que el asentamiento queda en un lugar retirado, ellas deben viajar hasta los puestos de salud más cercanos, es por eso que Marta, decidió hacer cursos de enfermería y ella es quien aplica inyecciones, hace nebulizaciones para niños, toma de presión y primeros auxilios para todas las personas que necesiten.

Es un grupo muy unido, ellas además de dedicarse a sus actividades particulares, también realizan actividades extras con el fin de obtener fondos para realizar mejoras en el barrio.

Hoy ellas necesitan de un crédito que podrán invertirlo en sus negocios, especialmente comprando mercaderías para vender.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing such as socks, gloves, hats, scarves, etc.  Those who sell food, to purchase items such as fruits and vegetables, dairy products, meats, flour, oil, noodles and frozen items.  Others wish to buy natural medicines, cosmetics, creams, coal, etc.

loans.name: Rosario's Group

texts.es:
Mrs. Rosario is the president and lives in the south, dedicated to pastries and also beauty products. The members are dedicated to different activities such as: sale of breakfast pastries, neighbourhood store, brick, etc., also in the area and the group usually works well. Carola sells used clothing, Francisca is a brick-maker, Rosario and Filiberto make pastries, Blanca has a grocery store, Monica sells breakfast, Victoria manages a taxi, Angelica tends to her neighbourhood store, Claudia sells groceries, Reina sells food, Elizabeth sells cosmetics, Aida sells empanadas, similarly to Sissy.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Rosario es la presidenta y vive en la zona sur, se dedica a la repostería pero también venD. productos D. belleza. Las socias se dedican a diferentes actividades como ser: venta D. desayuno, repostería, tienda D. barrio, ladrillera, etc. también viven en la zona por lo general el grupo trabaja bien. Carola veD. ropa usada, Francisca es ladrillera, Rosario y Filiberto son reposteras, Blanca tiene su tienda D. abarrotes, Monica venD. desayuno, Victoria administra un taxi, Angélica atienD. su tienda D. barrio, Claudia comercializa abarrotes, Reina venD. comida, Elizabeth venD. cosméticos, Aida venD. empanadas al igual que Sissy.

loans.use: Capital for Operations

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es:
La señora Angelina S. G. tiene cuarentainueve años y vive en la calle 28 de julio 225 del distrito de Mache de la provincia de Otuzco  del departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta quinto año de primaria y no siguió estudiando porque sus padres tenían una educación muy machista ellos pensaban que deberían recibir educación solo los hombres.
Se casó a los veintidós años con el señor Andrés Flores Gutiérrez y tienen seis hijos, dos de ellos son independientes y dos mujeres y dos hombres todavía son estudiantes.
El primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles con lo que compró quesillo, hizo queso y vendió a mayor precio los en cuatro meses.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará quesillo para vender fuera de la provincia y también utilizará este préstamo para la compra venta de papa  ya que es temporada.
Angelina pertenece al Comedor Popular Sagrado Corazón y también es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache del que un tiempo fue presidenta y pertenece ya ocho años.
Su gran sueño es tener un restaurant muy grande que pueda servir bien a propios y visitantes de Mache.
texts.en:
La señora Angelina S. G. tiene cuarentainueve años y vive en la calle 28 de julio 225 del distrito de Mache de la provincia de Otuzco del departamento de La Libertad Perú. Estudió hasta quinto año de primaria y no siguió estudiando porque sus padres tenían una educación muy machista ellos pensaban que deberían recibir educación solo los hombres. Se casó a los veintidós años con el señor Andrés Flores Gutiérrez y tienen seis hijos, dos de ellos son independientes y dos mujeres y dos hombres todavía son estudiantes. El primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de 300 soles con lo que compró quesillo, hizo queso y vendió a mayor precio los en cuatro meses. Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000 soles, el cual será pagado en 4 cuotas, comprará quesillo para vender fuera de la provincia y también utilizará este préstamo para la compra venta de papa ya que es temporada. Angelina pertenece al Comedor Popular Sagrado Corazón y también es socia del Banco Comunal Mujeres de Mache del que un tiempo fue presidenta y pertenece ya ocho años. Su gran sueño es tener un restaurant muy grande que pueda servir bien a propios y visitantes de Mache.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh curd and potatoes.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
This loan is for a small group of three members. Mariam M. is 40 years old, widowed, and sells perfume in the market. She has been selling perfume since 2006 and earns around USD $4 per day. Mariam has five children, two of them are married and other three stay home and are in school. Mariam needs a loan of USD $200 to add to her money to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to transport her perfume to sell. She is the group leader and other two are: 
1- Mrs. Ler L., a grocery seller who needs a loan of USD $200 to purchase more grocerys to sell. 
2- Mrs. Khor M.,  a fish seller. She needs a loan of USD $200 to purchase a pump for her husband to use in his business of growing vegetable. 
They all live in Slaket Commune, Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Khursheeda M.din Group

texts.en:
Khursheeda baji is 59 years old and is a wife of M. and resides in a city named Shah Rukn, Pakistan. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder son is a daily wage labor. Her younger son is a tailor. Her daughters help her embroider clothes for sale, something she has done for 20 years. Her husband has a power loom machine and manufactures bed sheets. Khursheed baji successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine for her younger son so that he able to hire an employee on monthly wage and takes more orders and earn improve his income.

She is joined in her loan group by a the following members. Syeda Nasreen baji requests a loan to buy tools for her carving business. Shazia baji requests a loan to buy vegetables for her vegetable selling business. Nagina baji requests a loan to buy tools for her furniture making business. Najma baji requests a loan to buy material (spices) for her Punjabi food “Dahi Bhalay” selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites M. has a passion for cooking. She enjoys preparing foods like noodles and simple snacks which she sells to her neighbors. She is married to Victor who works as a tricycle driver and also manages their farm.  They have three children: Marjorie – 20 years old, a college graduate; Jenny Rose – 18 years old, 2nd year college and Victor Jr. – 16 years old, 4th year high school student. 
 
Everyday, after doing household chores and preparing for the needs of her family, Marites various noodle dishes to sell.  Sometimes she also accepts orders from her customers.  Her little store is located next to her house. She is known for her excellent customer service

Marites  is requesting a loan to purchase items for her kitchen so she can improve her operation. She and her husband continue to work hard to have enough money to fully educate all their children. Marites says that a good education is the only wealth they can give to their children.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen items to improve cooking business

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria, es ejecutiva de ventas en una óptica capitalina en la ciudad de Managua , ya tiene tres años de laborar para esta empresa y sus aspiraciones son llegar a ser jefe regional de la óptica y de esta manera poder mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia. Tiene 36 años de edad, casada madre de dos niños que están estudiando la  primaria, habita en el  barrio  Laureles Norte, para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de uno de sus  planes familiares que son terminar de hacer su casa esta solicitando un préstamo con un periodo de devolución de nueve meses, que le permitirá comprar materiales  de construcción para reparar el techo de su casa, gracias a la ayuda que le brinda AFODENIC, lograra su anhelo. De tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Maria is a sales representative for an eyeglass store in the city of Managua. She has been working for this company for three years and her goal is to be a regional manager of the chain so that she can improve her family's quality of life. She is 36 years old, married and has two children in primary school. She lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. To focus on her goal she first needs to finish building her home and is therefore requesting a loan to be repaid within nine months. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to finish the roof of her house. Thanks to the help provided by AFODENIC she can achieve her dream of having a proper home.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lerch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase construction materials to finish building her home

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn P. is a 60-year-old widow who lives in Kna Roung village in Takeo province. She is a tailor and has six children, four of whom are employed in a garment factory. The others attend the local school. Even though Mrs. Lorn P.’s family members have jobs, they do not have enough money to buy a better house to live in. This is why Mrs. Lorn P. has decided to ask for a loan, which she will combine with her savings to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To help build a house.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo A.  first joined MicroInvest in 2004, when she heard from her sister about the good business developement loans available through MicroInvest.  Thanks to her first loan with MicroInvest she was able to open an outlet selling children wear. Now she has branched out her business into small wares selling. She has many repeat customers as she sells for the lowest prices at the bazaar. 

Dilrabo buys her supplies in Istaravshan and Bishkek (in the Kyrgyz Republic). She is asking KIVA for support through a  business development loan of 4100 STJ for 6 months to import new seasonal wear and increase her business turnover.

loans.use: To import new seasonal wear for resale

loans.name: Fatima Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Fátima se dedica ala venta de ropa y cosméticos vende al contado y al crédito a la quincena, tiene 34 años de edad, reside en el barrio Villa reconciliación, su esposo es ingeniero químico. Cuando inicio su negocio lo hizo con fondo de su liquidación de su trabajo y con ayuda de su esposo pudo comenzar. Su proyecto con este crédito es la construcción de un cuarto con el objetivo de alquilarlo para obtener otros ingresos, este es su quinto ciclo de préstamo que esta muy contenta con Afodenic por ser parte de sus metas adquirida. Sus planes a futuro es poder seguir mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Fatima works selling clothing and cosmetics by request and on credit. She is 34 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliacion. Her husband works as a chemical engineer. When Fatima began her business she used money from her previous job and money from her husband to start. She would like to use the money from this loan to construct another room in her house which she can rent out to earn more income. This will be her fifth loan and she's pleased with Afodenic for their support. In the future, she would like to continue to improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to construct another room on their house,  which they can rent out to generate additional income.

loans.name: Erhembaatar

texts.en:
Erhembaatar T. lives with his wife and a daughter in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His daughter is a student at a local secondary school. Erhembaatar runs a small retail stall in the local market where he sells toys and children's clothes. His wife works with him as a saleswoman. He launched this business in 2001 by selling toys and clothes he imported from Ereen, China, a border town where many Chinese goods enter Mongolia. 

Whenever he goes to Ereen and brings cheap products for resale, his wife works alone a saleswoman. Since its inception, the business has done well. His capital has doubled, and he is applying for a loan to buy more children's  products to sell. Erhembaatar hopes to be able to buy a car with his new profits because a car would help him run the business much more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell to his customers

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La Sra. ROSMERY T. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Talentosas”  con su negocio ubicado en el Mercado Nº2 en la sección de pasamanería del distrito de Callería; tiene 27 años, 01 hija.  Su esposo es empleado del Ministerio de agricultura.

La primera vez obtuvo un préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, (hace ya 01 año), con este capital implementó más su negocio comprando variedad de joyas.
 
Con este préstamo de S/.2500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará joyas de plata y oro en variados diseños directamente de la capital, así como también comprará joyas de fantasía fina.

Desde que esta con Manuela Ramos, siente que hay un apoyo cercano y está conforme con los préstamos que ha recibido, y por ello, ella no se atrasa en el pago de sus cuotas, por el contrario hace todo lo posible para estar al día.
texts.en:
Rosmery T. R. is a member of the “Mujeres Talentosas” (“Talented Women”) Community Bank, and has a business located in the trimmings section of the Number Two Market in the Callería district. She is 27 years old and has one daughter. Her husband is employed by the Ministry of Agriculture.

One year ago, she receied her first loan, for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles. She used this money to purchase a variety of jewelry for her business.

She will invest this loan for 2,500 nuevos soles in various designs of silver and gold jewelry, which she will purchase directly from the capital city. She will also buy costume jewelry.

Since beginning to work with Manuela Ramos, Rosmery feels very supported and she is satisfied with the loans she has received. Because of this, she has not been late with her payments and instead has done everything possible to be sure to be on time.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase gold, silver, and costume jewelry

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
R. Hassan is age 40 years and married with six children who are still studying.

He has been selling mattresses, cushions and pillows for over 28 years. He is using the loan to purchase more stock to sell.

He is an open-minded man, hardworking, whose dream is to educate his children and obtain a car.

loans.use: To purchase mattresses, cushions and pillows to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 32 years. She is married with two kids. Currently both her children are in school. She lives with her family at Kasoa in the central region of Ghana. She has been selling aluminum buckets and plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls, etc. for the past two years. She says prices of commodities have increased and for that reason she is not able to buy more stock from the market, making it difficult to make profit to expand the business. She buys her stock of goods from the city center of Accra and retails them at the community market where she lives.

Evelyn is requesting a loan to augment her working capital to buy more stocks of aluminum buckets and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family. Evelyn is a member of a community group called “Ezekiel” Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more aluminum buckets and plastic materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Hermes Francisca

texts.es: El Joven Hermes Pérez O. tiene 27 años, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de comida y refrescos naturales. Por lo que vive de una manera muy humilde, y con  mucho sacrificio logro establecer este negocio que le ha dado lo necesario, para que salir adelante, con este medio de vida. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que inicio con este negocio por cuenta propia, y que sus propósitos son de proporcionar lo necesario para su familia, ya que alguna veces no tenia las facultades necesarias para proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día. Pero esto no detuvo a Hermes par salir adelante con su negocio. Por lo que solicita el financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, aceite, frijoles, tomates y cebollas. El sueño de Hermes es que a su familia no le falte la comida ni lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Hermes Pérez O. is a young man who is 27 years old. He sells food and natural beverages. He lives very humbly. With great sacrifice, he was able to start his business which has provided for his needs and allowed him to succeed in this time of his life. He has been in this business for more than 7 years.

Using his own money, he started his business with the intention of providing for his family’s needs. Sometimes he does not earn the necessary resources to provide his family’s daily bread. However, this has not stopped Hermes from succeeding in his business. His requested loan will be used as working capital to purchase basic grains (such as rice), cooking oil, beans, tomatoes and onions. Hermes hopes that his family does not go hungry or lack basic living necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Bozui Na Ekenge Plus Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe comprend 26 membres, dont Frederick K., qui a la main levé sur la photo.

Frederick K. gère son propre atelier artisanal là où il vend des basins, seaux, arrosoirs et gaufriers fabriqués à l’aide des tôles. Il vend aussi des objets de seconde main. Frederick a commencé son activité en 1992 en vendant la boisson qui a été transformée plus tard en atelier artisanal. Dans le souci de développer son atelier et devenir fournisseur des quincailleries de la place, Frederick a intégré un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Bozui na Ekenge Plus» pour bénéficier d’un soutien financier permanent à travers des crédits. Le prochain prêt lui servira d’acheter le matériel de travail de son atelier dans le but d’améliorer la qualité de ses produits et ainsi accroitre le revenu. Frederick est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants âgés entre 4 et 19 ans dont trois vont à l’école secondaire. Son activité lui génère $30 par semaine et se situe au sud-est de Kinshasa.
texts.en:
This group consists of 26 members, one of whom is Frederick K., who has his hand raised in the picture. Frederick K. manages his own crafts workshop, where he sells bowls, buckets, watering cans, and waffle makers, which he creates from sheet metal. He also sells second-hand items. Frederick started his business in 1992, selling drinks; this business later transformed into his crafts workshop. In the enterprise of developing his workshop and becoming a supplier of hardware stores in the area, Frederick has joined one of the Hope RDC's groups known as "Bozui na Ekenge Plus" to benefit from continuing financial support through loans. The next loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials for his business with the goal of increasing the quality of his products and thus increase his revenues. Frederick is 45 years old, he is married and the father of 4 children aged between 4 and 19 years old. 3 of his children are currently in attending secondary school. His business generates $30 a week for him and is situated in southeast Kinshasa.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for his business in order to increase the quality of his products and generate lots of revenue

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy M. is from the village of Upper Puntod. She is 27 years old. Ivy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ivy owns and operates a business selling pork products in the local community. Ivy has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Ivy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ivy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Ivy is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Ivy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is 60 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. All are out of school. She works very hard to support her husband and to be able to provide for her family. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey. Kenkey is produced from corn dough. Ama sells the kenkey with stew and fried fish on the street in her community. She buys her raw materials from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years now and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Agustin es originario de la comunidad de Juchanep a ocho kilometros de la ciudad procer de Totonicapan su actividad principal es la carpinteria lo vine ejerciento hace mas de treinta años  con todos los conocimientos adquiridos, dos hijos tambien han aprendido y para ello necesita de mas capital para poder surtir su mercaderia en la compra, madera, pintura, clavos, cola blanca ya que tiene un pedido por motivo de la fiesta de la comunida y por las graduaciones en el mes de octubre necesita surtir su mercaderia
texts.en:
Don Agustin is from the community of Juchanep, which is eight kilometers from the city of Totonicapan. He has worked as a carpenter for more than 30 years and has become very knowledgeable over that time. His two children have also learned the trade.

Don Agustin needs additional capital to purchase goods such as wood, paint, nails, and glue. He has received requests for a community festival and a graduation ceremony in the month of October, so he needs these items to complete his projects.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase carpentry materials

loans.name: Ric

texts.en:
Ric D. S. is from the village of Gata Diot, Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 30 years old. Ric is married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ric owns & operates a business venture in the services sector, operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for his business comes primarily from providing hairdressing services to local community members. Ric has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ric joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation as well as his ability to engage in business activities. Ric has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from GDMPC. Ric is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase equipment to improve his business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ric from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve the business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 34 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus 3 hijos de 12, 6, y 2 años. Hace 2 años decidió que la mejor forma de generarse ingresos económicos era con la venta de animales (cerdos). Ella compra estos animales en la feria ganadera de su localidad y luego los vende a precios más altos; en esta oportunidad, como se muestra en la foto, ya no contaba con ningún cerdo, pero cuando no logra venderlos todos, los cuida en su establo durante una semana. 

Cristina cuanta con el apoyo de sus hijos para la venta de sus animales y con la experiencia ganada durante este tiempo aprendió a seleccionar a los cerdos para no ser engañada con animales enfermos. Su deseo a futuro es continuar con este negocio pero incrementar su capital de trabajo. 

Esta es la segunda oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP y en su anterior préstamo fue puntual en sus pagos, además de sentirse contenta porque aprendido el valor del trabajo en equipo. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de más cerdos y aprovechar esta temporada que es cuando se venden con mayor frecuencia.
texts.en:
Cristina is 34 years old. She lives in her parents home with her 3 children ages12, 6, and 2 years. Two years ago she decided that the best economic way to generate income was with the sale of animals (hogs). She buys these animals in the livestock market of her area and then she sells them for higher prices. In this endeavor, as she is shown in the photo (although without any hogs), when she fails to sell them all, she takes care of them in her stable for a week. Cristina counts on the income from the sale of her animals for the support of her children. With the experience she has gained during this time she has learned to select the best hogs and not to be deceived by sick animals. Her wish for the future is to continue in this business and to increase her working capital. This is the second opportunity in which she has requested a loan from MFP. In her previous loan she was punctual with her payments, besides being happy because she learned the value of teamwork. The money that she now requests will be used to purchase more hogs and to take advantage of this season when they are sold with greater frequency.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more hogs that she sells.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es madre soltera, tiene 43 años de edad y vive junto a sus tres hijos en casa de un tío de avazada edad en el caserío La Capilla Central de Ñaupe, distrito de Olmos, ubicado dos horas quince minutos al norte de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años es propietaria de una pequeña bodega que funciona en su casa. Allí vende productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite). La continua demanda de sus vecinos por los productos que ofrece ha hecho que se vea en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos y ampliar su negocio.

Este negocio es la principal fuente de ingreso familiar por lo que siempre trata se sacarlo adelante, por otro lado es de importancia para la comunidad en donde vive ya que es el único establecimiento de ese tipo en la zona.

Su más grande anhelo es ver a su hijo mayor terminar la carrera técnica de farmacia que con mucho esfuerzo le está brindando. Además desea ver convertirse a sus otros dos hijos en profesionales.
texts.en:
Sabina is a 43-year-old single mother. She lives with her three children in the house of an elderly uncle in the La Capilla Central de Ñaupe neighborhood in Olmos District, located two hours and fifteen minutes north of the city of Chiclayo. For the past three years, she has been the proprietor of a small grocery store in her home, where she sells basic items like rice, sugar and oil. She has steady demand from her neighbors for her products, so for the first time she has decided to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 soles so that she can buy more products and expand her business. This business is her family's main source of income, so Sabina is always trying to grow it. It is also very important within the community where she lives, since it is the only business of its kind in the area. Her greatest dream is for her oldest son to finish his studies at technical school, where thanks to her efforts he is currently studying Pharmacy. She also wants to see her other children grow up to be working professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic goods to expand her grocery store

location.town: Capilla Central de Ñaupe - Olmos - Lambayeque

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela has owned and managed a mini-canteen for a long time. Her canteen has been her way of helping her husband to provide for the needs of their children. Angela sells different kinds foods in their village. She is now borrowing PHP 8,000 from the KIVA lenders to buy cooking ingredients and improve her business. She hopes that the lenders will grant her request so she can also meet the demands of her customers. 

Angela is 40 years old and married. She is blessed with five children. They live in the village of San Isidro in Ilagan, Isabela. Angela and her supportive husband dream of improving their living condition and experiencing a more comfortable life. They hope that, through their business, they will able to achieve what they have only dreamed.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Elvis Axamir

texts.es: El señor Elvis L. trabaja como cadete de un taxi que es propio el cual desde hace cinco años lo trabaja, anteriormente tenia un negocio de venta de sorbete, también trabajaba como cargador en una bodega, con ahorros y ayuda de sus hermanos logro comprar el vehiculo. Ya que dos de sus hermanos están en los Estados de América el cual con remesas logro recoger y ponerse a trabajar. Como todo trabajo la clientela ha bajado, debido al desempleo en nuestro país, pero hay día buenos y también hay que recorrer varios kilómetros para poder hallar cliente. Tiene 36 años de edad, con tres hijos los cuales estudian para un mejor futuro. Su esposa vende ropa, cosmético el cual lo apoyo con los gastos básicos del hogar como: agua, luz, teléfono entre otros gastos de los niños. Con este financiamiento quiere dar mantenimiento al vehiculo, comprar llantas, pintura y enderezado en la parte de atrás que tiene malo el taxi para poder dar un mejor servicio de carrera al cliente. Contento por l aprobación del crédito el cual será para bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Elvis L. works as a taxi driver, with his own taxi. He has had this business for five years. Previously, he had an ice cream business and also worked as a stock clerk in a small shop. With his savings and the help of his brothers, he managed to buy his vehicle. Two of his brothers are in the U.S., and sent money to help him start his business.

Now, the number of customers is down as in all businesses, due to the unemployment problem in the country. Still, there are good days, though he often has to drive farther to find customers.

Elvis is 36 years old, with three children who are studying for a better future. His wife sells clothes and cosmetics, which helps with household expenses like water, electricity, telephone, and expenses for the children.

This loan will go toward maintenance of the taxi: tires, paint, and body repair in the back. This will give better service to the customers. Elvis is happy he was approved for this loan which will help the well being of his family.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tires, body repair, and paint for taxi

loans.name: Maria Benita

texts.es:
María Benita es una socia dinámica y colaboradora, vive en el distrito de Yarina Cocha, región de Ucayali. Ella tiene 48 años, es madre de cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es operador de maquinaria pesada.
Marìa se dedica diariamente a la venta de jugos desde la vereda de su casa y forma parte del Banco  Comunal “Las Fresitas” desde hace ocho años. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300.00 nuevos soles con los que pudo comprar telas, elásticos y adornos para vestidos.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 3000.00 nuevos soles con los que comprarà sillas, mesas y utensilios para implementar su negocio. 
El sueño de María es hacer màs conocido su quiosco de jugos y néctares.
texts.en:
María Benita is a dynamic and collaborative member who lives in the district of Yarina Cocha in the region of Ucayali. She is 48 years old, is the mother of four older children, and has the support of her husband who is an operator of heavy machinery. María dedicates herself every day to selling juices from the sidewalk in front of her house. She has been a part of the community bank "Las Fresitas" for eight years. The first loan the she received was for 300 PEN with which she was able to buy fabrics, elastic, and adornments for dresses. Currently, she needs a loan of 3,000 PEN with which she will buy chairs, tables, and tools to set up her business. María's dream is to make her juice kiosk better known.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs, tables, and tools to set up her business

loans.name: Evelyn Rosaura

texts.es: La señorita Rosaura es originaria del municipio de Totonicapan con residencia en la zona cuatro del mismo municipio su principal fuente de ingreso es la elaboracion y venta de pan en casa en casa dicho oficio lo aprendio de su querido padres desde cuando hera una ñina con los ingreso que obtiene ha colaborado economicamente en los gastos de la familia hoy necesita del apoyo de la institucion ASDIR en un credito para incrementar su capital para poder satisfacer las necesidades de su clientela.
texts.en:
Rosaura is from the Totonicapán municipality, and she lives in Zone four in the same municipality. Her primary source of income is making and selling bread from house to house. She learned this job from her dear parents when she was a girl. She has used the income she gets to help with the family expenses. She now needs help from the ASDIR Institution. She needs a loan to increase her capital to be able to satisfy her customers’ needs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Ramon Daniel

texts.es:
El Señor Ramón Daniel D., Labora como Mercado logó en el Dpto. de Capacitación del Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez  de Managua, el tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado un créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 1 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, Hierro y para terminar de  construir un baño por lo que este se encontraba en mal estado.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Ramón Daniel D. works as a market specialist in the Training Department of the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute in Managua. He has one school-aged child in his care, is married, and has worked with CEPRODEL for one year. Over this period of time, he has invested 1 loan into making improvements to the house where he lives. Thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he is an excellent client. The loan requested would be invested into purchasing construction materials such as: cement, iron, and items to finish building a bathroom to replace an existing one that is in a state of disrepair. His goal is to provide greater security and a higher standard of living for his child.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to, and to expand, his house.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, Genesis, and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the rural areas surrounding Santiago, an area known for its agricultural production of beef and tobacco, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Juana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling work boots, women's shoes, assorted clothing and perfumes by purchasing merchandise to sell in her ambulatory business. She will use the profits to invest in food for her family and shoes for her children. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy boots, shoes, clothes and perfumes

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Brisas.
Delia es soltera, tiene 35 años y 4 hijos, Delia tiene un puesto en el mercado 12de abril en donde vende cereales variados, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Delia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
Los sueños de Delia son seguir trabajando y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the communal bank Las Brisas. She is single, 35 years old, and has four children. She has a booth in the 12 de Abril market where she sells various cereals every day. Delia needs a loan of 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of cereals. Delia's dreams are to continue working and to have her children complete their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cereals

loans.name: Yamoussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yamoussa Dembélé  est âgé de 27 ans, marié et sans enfant, il réside avec son épouse à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Yamoussa Dembélé a très vite abandonné les études pour des activités génératrices de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, qu’il décida d’apprendre le métier de tailleur brodeur depuis l’année 2002. Son atelier de couture se trouve devant son domicile à Sanoubougou I où il dispose déjà 4 machines dont une machine de broderie et trois machines simples. 
Monsieur Dembélé est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses services. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui,  il est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter une machine de broderie dans le souci de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter. 
Il espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Yamoussa Dembélé is 27 years old and married, but he has no children. He lives with his wife in Sanoubougou 1, one of the popular districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Yamoussa Dembélé abandoned his studies at a very early stage in favour of finding an income generating activity. Only after having unsuccessfully carried out a number of activities did he decide to learn the trade of a tailor/embroiderer in 2002. In his sewing workshop, which is just in front of his house in Sanoubougou 1, he already has four machines, one of which is an embroidery machine and the others simple sewing machines. Mr. Dembélé is in great demand from his customers owing to the quality of his service. In order to satisfy better the ever increasing number of customers, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance company, with which he in on his first individual loan.
